loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina  is  28 years old. She is married with five children. She has a stall that display her Ready to wear items like jeans, shirts, and more for both sex. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy additional items to sell like shoes, slippers,and blouses. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business which eventually could help the family needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear items like jeans and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and one sibling. In addition to the family's main income from his father, Hassan's is also considered as an important source of financial earnings. 

He has been working in floor covering and bricks for the past eight years and he's way too good. He works independently and has his own and loyal customers. Today, he's asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new supplies. He notes that this will help him serve more customers and therefore increase his profits by 10%.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Jaime is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jaime hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Grace Nora

texts.en:
This is Grace, a 36-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roel, who is also her partner in business, and the mother of one child. Grace and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, Grace is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a room rental business. She offers rooms for rent in the family's house that local students and workers rent on a monthly basis. She also operates some arcade machines in part of the house for additional income. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in rent every month.

To help her continue operating her business, Grace is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of the rental rooms and arcade units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Grace hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of her room rentals and arcade units.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon, 42, is a married woman who lives in Kompong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom is already married. Farming is her livelihood and she typically earns about $2.50 per day. One of her children contributes to the family’s income by selling sweet iced drinks with syrup near her house. This business is doing well. She wants to expand it gradually. 

Mrs. Phon would like to request some funds from Kiva’s lenders to purchase a sugar cane squeezing machine for her daughter to provide natural soft drinks and satisfy her customers. She is thankful to all lenders who continually help in this business.

loans.use: to purchase a sugar cane squeezing machine.

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es:
Dilsa  de 44 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Malambo, con su cónyuge e hijo de 9 años de edad y allí mismo tiene una miscelánea,  donde vende accesorios femeninos, papelería, artículos de belleza entre otras mercancías,  de acuerdo con la exigencia de la temporada.  Su experiencia emprendedora comenzó desde hace 15 años, cuando aplicando su creatividad inició su negocio, elaborando con sus propias manos productos artesanales y aprovechando que su cónyuge era vendedor de un almacén, donde  hizo contactos comerciales en las instalaciones de pequeñas colmenas a su alrededor y  construyó su propia clientela y finalmente, hace menos de 2 años,  cuando este dejó de trabajar en el almacén, invirtieron su liquidación en una miscelánea agregando a sus productos, mercancías variadas, inicialmente sobre los pedidos y posteriormente en el marco de la época en la cual se mueve cada producto.
Como  la creatividad de Dilsa no tiene límites, así como su deseo de aprender,  además de fabricar productos en pequeños materiales de cuero, también aprendió últimamente a elaborar sandalias, que ahora exhibe en su miscelánea con mucho orgullo. Su negocio gradualmente va creciendo, porque su clientela se ha expandido, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará juguetería, aprovechando la temporada de navidad, que usualmente llega con muchos pedidos de sus clientes especialmente de juguetes, para el nacimiento del niño Dios, los niños lo reciban llenos de alegría y jugando por las calles de su municipio.
texts.en:
Dilsa is 44 years old. She lives in the town of Malambo with her husband and 9 year old son. She has a variety store in her house, where she sells women's accessories, paper products, beauty items and other merchandise, according to the season. Her enterprising experience began 15 years ago, when, using her creativity, she started her business. She made artisanal crafts with her own hands, taking advantage of the fact that her spouse worked in a store. He made commercial contacts in the small communities nearby and built their own clientele. Finally, less than 2 years ago, when her husband stopped working in the store, they invested his severance package in a variety store. They mixed their own products and various merchandise. They started selling via orders and later sold according to each season. 

Dilsa's creativity knows no limits, nor does her desire to learn. Besides making products out of materials such as leather, she also learned to make sandals, which she displays in her store with much pride. Her business is growing gradually, because her clientele has expanded. This is the reason why she has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy toys, taking advantage of the Christmas season. Usually she has a lot of orders from her customers, especially for toys, given to children for the birth of the Christ child. They receive them with much joy and they play in the streets of town.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is married and has five children. She is 54 years old and lives in  Lupagan, Clarin.

Lourdesita raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Lourdesita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a cow.  She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lourdesita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Palccaraqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “PALCCARAQUI II” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba en el distrito de Urubamba. (Cusco, Perú).  El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora,  profesionales, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado ocho integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y el dinero lo invertirán para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lucia y nos cuenta que ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba en el poblado de Palcaraqui junto con  sus tres hijos (Brenda de 18 años, Lenin de 15 años y Arnold de 11 años). Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Lucia es enfermera y trabaja en una posta de salud de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de la casa ósea quiere comprar maderas y cemento.  Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. El sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Palccaraqui II” and meets every 30 days in the city and district of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru).  The Communal Bank is distinguished for having hardworking individuals who are professionals, artisans, and merchants.  There are eight members and this is the first time they have requested a loan from Asociación Arariwa.  The money will be invested in the improvement of their businesses.  

At this meeting, the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sra. Lucia.  She indicated that she was born in the city of Quillabamba, but now resides in the subdivision of Palcaraqui in the city of Urubamba.  Lucia lives with her three children:  Brenda – 18, Lenin - 15, and Arnold – 11.  From a young age, Lucia has been known for being a responsible and friendly person.  Her neighbors encouraged and invited her to participate in the Communal Bank.  

Lucia is a nurse and works at a health clinic in the city of Urubamba.  She also engages in farming and raising small animals.  Lucia is taking this opportunity to request a loan for home maintenance.  She plans to buy wood and cement.  Lucia is 42 years and has great desire to succeed and do well in her business day after day so that she can always provide the best for her family.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and cement for home improvements.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married with three children who are currently going to school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Leah has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Leah has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Gerardo es un microempresario de éxito y además es agricultor durante toda su vida herencia de sus padres, el cultiva maíz y el mismo lo comercializa en los mercados del país, tiene 13 años que la institución le brinda financiamiento para su agricultura, es un emprendedor casado y tiene 58 años de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes como abono, urea, alquiler de terreno, granos para la siembra, desgranado, sacos etc.
texts.en: On top of being a successful micro entrepreneur, Gerardo has been a farmer all of his life, an activity he has inherited from his parents. He plants corn and sells it in the various markets of the country. Gerardo is 58 years old and he is a married man. Our institution has been granting him loans for his agriculture activity for 13 years. This new loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and urea, seeds to plant, corn off the cob, sacks and to pay rent for his lands.

loans.use: To buy manure and urea, seeds to plant, corn off the cob, sacks and to pay rent for his lands.

loans.name: Mahugnon 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON 1 est un groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Léké Solange, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Léké Solange est mariée à un certain Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léké Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Léké Solange et son mari. Léké Solange vend des bassines et des plastiques depuis trois ans. Léké Solange s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Léké Solange sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 1 dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des bassines et des plastiques

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 41-year-old farmer who is also hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a child, she learned the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' support. She lives in Nandihills, Kenya, a town near the great Rift valley, with her husband and four children. 
Josphine has been a farmer for more than ten years and raises poultry, eggs, cows for milk, and maize and vegetables. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity arises. Despite rapid prices changes for the goods she sells, Josphine is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. She is seeking a loan to expand her farm by buying farm implements. This move a big deal for her because with this loan, Josphine can grow a variety of crops, but on a larger scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nandihills and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will help her overcome the high farming expenses she has to deal with and satisfy her family’s basic needs. She puts it this way: “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my four children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Calamba and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Anita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, natural medicines and other vitamins. She learned to be a saleswoman from her parents who are also in the same line of works. She is in need of a loan in order to invest in products. She is especially interested in diversifying her line of natural medicines because her clients are satisfied with the results and they have become very popular items. Maria is 41 years old and has 3 children. Her oldest daughter is married but still lives with Maria at home. Maria has been separated from her husband for 5 years and she has had to play the role of mother and father to her 2 younger children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in natural medicines and vitamins

loans.name: Ameenullah

texts.en:
Ameenullah is 27 years old, single, and has a shop in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has been working in his current business, selling shoes, for about 3 years. During the Taliban government he sold 2nd hand shoes and after there was peace he opened a new shoe shop to cover his family financially and develop his business.

Ameenullah is happy with the procedure of AFSG, giving loans to people to increase their business. He took a 1st individual loan to design his shop and buy shoes.

loans.use: Buying Shoes

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Mrs. Kit S. is a 27-year-old mother of one child who lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a good housewife who looks after the children and cooks meals, while her husband works very hard in a field with his two healthy cows growing, cultivating and plowing soil for his new coming crops. Meanwhile, he typically makes around $3.5/days from his produce. In order to maximize their revenue, Kit S. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase some seeds and two healthy cows, which would be a big help for her husband's agricultural pursuits.

For the next coming year, her husband hopes to introduce a great variety of crops, especially some kinds of vegetables which are so common for his clients' needs. With this increasing size, he hopes he would have enough money to find a better education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase some seeds and two healthy cows to help her husband in his agricultural pursuits

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Business Description

Yorleny used to work doing domestic chores from her home. She has 1 year of experience on cosmetic sales. She was motivated to start her own business by her aunt and Yorleny was able to gather the capital toinvest in cosmetics. She has her own business thanks to her determination to save some money to start it. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. Yorleny has a good clientele to whom she distributes her products.

Loan Investment

The loan will be use to buy cosmetics and other products that she sells like: perfumes and costume jewelry. Yorleny also plans to invest some of the money in clothes too since she has orders already.

Personal Information

Yorleny is 26 years old and has 3 children. Two of the children go to school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and helps with the expenses at home. Her small home is made out of reed and has only one room (her dining room and bedroom are together). Her wish is to provide security for her residence where her children can grow without fears.

Traslated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Yorleny tiene experiencia de 1 año en su negocio. Ella se dedicaba a trabajar realizando quehaceres domésticos en casa. Por medio de una tía, se motiva a conseguir un capital para invertir en cosméticos. Gracias a sus ahorros tiene su negocio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Tiene una buena cartera de clientes a los que le distribuye sus productos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos como lo son: perfumes, bisutería, joyas. Además piensa invertir algo de prendas de vestir para la venta ya que tiene pedidos.

Información Personal

Yorleny tiene 26 años. Y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian. Su esposo trabaja realizando trabajos de albañilería. Con lo que también ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de caña y tiene un solo ambiente. Es decir comedor y dormitorio junto. Su deseo es poder darle seguridad a su domicilio donde sus hijos puedan crecer sin temores.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetics other products for her business.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sukarmi

texts.id:
Wayan Sukarmi’s husband works as a skilled construction laborer whose monthly income is unpredictable. To pay for food and her children’s education she needs Rp 700.000 (about USD80) per month. With her pig breeding business she is able to supplement her husband’s income. Currently, she has 1 breeder sow, each birthing produces 10 to 12 piglets every 4 months, worth Rp 250.000 (about USD30). With this loan of Rp 1.300.000 (USD150), she intends to purchase feed increase the number of breeder sows thus increasing her income to cover her family’s expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Suami Wayan Sukarmi bekerja sebagai seorang buruh tukang bangunan yang memiliki penghasilan tidak tetap setiap bulannya.Untuk Biaya makan dan biaya sekolah anaknya dalam satu bulan memerlukan dan Rp 700.000 dengan usaha inilah Wayan Sukarmi dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya yaitu menjalankan usaha beternak babi.Saat ini Wayan Sukarmi memelihara 1 Ekor induk babi yang sekali melahirkan anak bisa mencapai 10 sampai 12 ekor per 4 Bulan yang harga perekornya Rp 250.000. Dengan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000,- ini Wayan Sukarmi pergunakan untuk membeli pakan dan juga rencananya ingin menambah jumlah induk babinya agar jumlah pendapatannya bertambah untuk bisa menutupi biaya kebutuhan kelurganya setiap bulan.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow (female pig) and feed (Membeli induk babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: Aleircina Medina

texts.en:
Aleircina is an active and very positive woman who is striving to make a living.  She is married with four children.  Two of them, the eldest, attend the public school of the town.  Her husband is a taxi driver. 
Aleircina is a clever businesswoman and her entrepreneurial spirit has helped her be successful in her business activities.  
Six months ago, she took a loan from our organization and started to sell clothes for children.  She operates her business in a public place and could obtain a lot of customers.
She says that with this activity she better supports her family and now she can save money for emergency issues.
Currently, the entrepreneur needs more credit to make her business larger.  She wants to buy larger quantities of garments in Santo Domingo, the capital, in order to augment her sales and income.  As such, Aleircina will have more facilities to help her husband financially support the family.

loans.use: To purchase big quantities of children's clothes in order to make her business larger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie M. is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 3 children who attend primary and high school. She has been selling “attieke” made with cassava (a local food) and fried fish, a food appreciated by Ivorian people. She used her first loan from AE&I to increase her goods. She sells her food outside and next to a road, which is a problem for customers because cars and taxis stir up dust in the area of the restaurant. She uses the money from her business to help her husband with their household expenses. She hopes to settle down in a better place for her health and for the health of her customers. She will use the loan as capital to improve business conditions and to earn additional profit.

loans.use: To improve business conditions

loans.name: Darling

texts.es:
Darling learned farming from her husband who worked in the fields at a very young age. They live in Ticuantepe, an agricultural area with a high potential for eco tourism. For the last 30 years, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to growing the most predominant crop in the area, pineapple, as well as, bananas, oranges, lemons and mandarins (citrus). The municipality has excellent farming conditions because of the climate and arable land, both favourable for agriculture. This is how these parents prepared their children, who are university students preparing themselves for a better life.

She explains that the production process of different crops includes chemical control of bushes, as the crops need to be free of them to develop properly; to this end, 3 cycles of chemical control -- herbicides and man power -- are needed during this process. Unfortunately, this process is expensive and Darling can't afford it at the moment. She needs a loan to cover the costs, as the success of her crops depend on it.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Darling aprendió de su esposo el oficio de la agricultura, quien desde muy joven ha trabajado en el campo, habitan en Ticuantepe una zona altamente productiva con un alto potencial para el ecoturismo. Hace 30 años la señora junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de piña siendo este el más predominante de la zona, así como banano, naranjas, limones y mandarinas (cítricos), debido a la excelente condiciones agro climática y la fertilización de las tierras que presenta dicho municipio, las cuales son favorables para la actividad agrícola. Es de esta manera como estos padres han preparado a sus 2 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, preparándose para un mejor futuro.

La señora explica que el proceso productivo de los diferentes cultivos requieren de un control químico para la malezas de las plantaciones durante el desarrollo vegetativo, ya que requieren estar libre de malezas; para ello se debe realizar por lo menos tres controles químicos a lo largo de todo el proceso, a base de herbicidas combinadas con controles manuales y esto tiene un alto costo que ella no puede cubrir en estos momentos, es por eso que necesita un préstamo para poder cubrir esos gastos, ya que de esto depende el éxito de su cosecha.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for her crops.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity T. owns a shop where she makes hair for people living in her community; she also sells cloth. She is married with a child and is 27 years old. She has been in business since 2004 and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She spent 1 year and 6 months learning the business. She needs the loan of $450 to buy cloth in bulk for sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sale

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Kung C. is 44 years old, unmarried, and working as both a farmer and an electrician in Siem Reap Province. He makes $6 U.S. per day in his business. Kung wants to make his farm more efficient by purchasing a water pump that will be used to better irrigate his fields, thus his request for a $300 loan..

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from a very young age has been a farmer. This being a very common profession in her area and in her family from whom she learned the trade. Thanks to her efforts her production and economic stability at home have improved greatly. She hopes to continue achieving the dreams of her beloved children and with this motive she hopes to solicit a loan in order to purchase more fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Gloria, desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a la agricultura siendo este una labor muy común en su localidad y dentro de su familia de quienes aprendió los gajes del oficio.Gracias a su desempeño continuo su producción y economía dentro de su hogar han mejorado mucho. Su deseo es continuar con el desarrollo de los sueños de sus amados hijos y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines, a member of the Village Bank Retoño, is 35 years old, married, and has five children. Ines has a car washing business at her house, and at the beginning she had very few clients. However, thanks to the great service she offers and the quality of her products, she has been able to develop a client base surpassing all other car washing services. Furthermore, Ines dedicates much of her leisure time to her business. She now needs a loan of $425 to renovate the floor of her car wash so that the runoff doesn’t infiltrate her home.

Ines´s dreams are to have a stock of car lubricants, continue developing her business, and have her children grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: To renovate the floor of her car wash in order to avoid infiltration into her home.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Forutnata is a married 55-year-old mother of five children. Fortunata travels to different regional fairs where she sells wool, brooms, cleaning tools, combs, and flashlights, among other goods. Furthermore, Fortunata buys avocados and oranges at the regional fairs and sells them to middlemen in the city of Ayacucho.

Fortunata needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) that she will invest in more wool, avocados, batteries, creams, and soaps to further expand her business.

Fortunata dreams to improve her business, improve her home and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Fortunata needs a loan that she will invest in more wool, avocados, batteries, creams, and soaps to further expand her business.

loans.name: Helena's Jerusalem Group

texts.en:
Helena is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, aged 16, 20, and 26. She has been a clothes seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US100 from her sales.

Helena now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Martha, who has a business dealing with farming.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory

loans.name: Thi Thanh Tam

texts.vi: Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương năm 2003, ngay từ vòng vốn đầu tiên chị Tâm đã sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Tận dụng nguồn thức ăn sẵn có của gia đình và kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi đã được tích luỹ trong nhiều năm nên dự án đã cho kết quả  rất tốt. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị Tâm đều sử dụng vào chăn nuôi lợn, đến nay gia đình chị đã có khu chăn nuôi đủ tiêu chuẩn với khoảng gần 20 con lợn. Hiện tại ngoài công việc chăn nuôi hàng ngày chị Tâm còn đi chợ để buôn bán rau. Công việc buôn bán cũng đem lại nguồn thu khá ổn định cho gia đình chị. Chị Tâm có một người con gái hiện đang đi làm và có thu nhập ổn định 2.000.000đ/ tháng nên hàng tháng chị đều nhận được sự hỗ trợ thêm từ con gái. Với mong muốn cuộc sống của gia đình ngày càng ổn định và phát triển, chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đâu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Joined the TYM Fund in 2003, Mrs. Tam used the first loan to raise livestock. With the readily available animal feed in her house and her experiences in raising livestock, the project was very successful. The subsequent loans were also used to invest in rearing pigs. Now, Mrs. Tam's family has a pig sty up to standard with about 20 pigs. Beside raising livestock, Mrs. Tam also sells vegetables in the market everyday. This also brings about a stable income for her family. Mrs. Tam has a daughter who is working with a stable monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD) so every month, Mrs. Tam receives financial support from her daughter. Wishing to improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Tam would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (900USD) to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Eder

texts.es: Eder hace un año trabaja en sus terrenos agrícolas sembrando papa, maíz y arveja, productos que son muy buenos en esta temporada, por eso que aprovecha el momento para producir mayor cantidad y comercializarlos en los mercados.  Todo este trabajo está basado en el bienestar de su familia y sus padres, quienes al igual que él, son agricultores, ahora con la colaboración de sus hijos puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, y  también brindar un apoyo a sus padres, para que sus hermanos menores puedan estudiar.  Sin embargo, hay ciertos obstáculos que impiden que Eder pueda tener una producción adecuada, siendo la principal, los altos costos de los abonos y fertilizantes para sus terrenos de cultivo, esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo, y espera que usted pueda ayudar a que siga trabajando y ayudando a sus padres para su bienestar.
texts.en:
For a year, Eder has worked in his agricultural lands growing potato, corn, and peas, products which are very good in this season. This is why he takes advantage of the moment to produce a higher quantity and sell them in the markets. All this work is based on the wellbeing of his family and his parents, who like him, are also farmers. Now, with the help of his children he can cover the household expenses, and at the same time offer support to his parents, so his younger siblings can study. However, there are some obstacles that prevent Eder from having an adequate production, the main being the high cost of fertilizers for his agricultural land. This is the reason he requests a loan and hopes you can help him keep working and helping his parents for their wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer for her agricultural land.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Mrs. Muth S., who is 37 years old, lives in the village of Boeng in Kandal province. She is a garment worker, while her husband, Mr. Yoem Yen, pictured on the left of the photo, is a construction worker. They have four children, all of whom attend the local school.

Despite the fact that she and her husband work extremely hard, they do not generate enough income to support their family's living expenses or to improve their standard of living. As a result, Mrs. Muth S. is seeking a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house for her family in the future and to thereby provide the family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To one day build a new house in order to improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Edith Nereyda

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer joven de edad que trabaja para una agencia aduanal dentro y fuera del trabajo Edith a demostrado una gran honradez, responsabilidad y el ser muy trabajadora.
Ella esta solicitando este credito para la colocación de las protecciones de su casa y asi obtener mas seguridad para su hogar.
texts.en:
Edith is a young woman that works as a customs official. Within and outside of work Edith has demonstrated great honesty and responsibility and she proved to be a hard worker.

She is requesting a loan to implement safety measures in her home, to obtain greater security for her house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement safety measures in her home.

loans.name: Edith Norma

texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Muchuy Warakaq Village Bank. She is 59 years old and married with four children, two of whom still live at home. Edith and her husband run a hardware store from their home, which they have had for the past 18 years. Edith works each day from 6:30 am to 8:30 pm.

Edith is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy construction materials, mostly normal and fine-grain sand. Her goal for the future is to finish construction on her hardware store, which is currently missing part of the roof.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (different grades of sand).

loans.name: Zenie

texts.en: Zenie C. is 39 years old, married and has 3 kids.  Her husband is a motorcycle driver. They admit that living with only the income from driving is difficult.  Education for her children is also an expense that they have to suffer.  Zenie thought of opening a store on their doorstep.  It's a matter of "diskarte" (strategies) on how to live life.  One has to work hard and make sacrifices.  Zenie and her husband really take care of their business.  The populated area around her store is what gives her the edge over other stores in the area.  They hope that Paglaum MPC will always be there for them in times of need.  To put up a decent home and children established with their own field is a dream come true for the C. family.

loans.use: purchase of additional inventories to her sari-sari store

loans.name: Maria Valeria

texts.es: Maria Valeria es una mujer de 54 años, tiene 9 hijos, y ya todos son mayores de edad y ya no viven con ella.   Tiene 15 años de vender maíz y fríjol en el mercado de su localidad.  Vende por pequeñas cantidades su producto y también por volúmenes mayores.  Su esposo le ayuda en su negocio.  Los días de mas venta son los días jueves y domingo, se les llama “días de mercado”, los cuales ella aprovecha mucho.  Los demás días de la semana ella esta en su casa, y allí se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.  Ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y fríjol por cantidades grandes, así logra un mejor precio para la venta.  Su deseo es mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos y no depender de otras personas para poder vivir.
texts.en:
Maria Valeria is 54 years old and has 9 children, all of whom are adults and no longer live with her. For the past 15 years, she has sold corn and beans in her neighborhood market. She sells her product in both small and large quantities. Her husband helps her in her business. The days she is able to sell the most are Thursdays and Sundays, which are called "market days," and she takes advantage of these days. The other days of the week, she stays in her home and makes hand-woven fabrics. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and beans in large quantities in order to be able to sell at a better price. Her goal is to improve her business and her income so she doesn't have to depend on others for her livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business selling corn and beans

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
R. Khursheda has been an active client since 2002. She works with MicroInvest because she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. Thanks to the previous loans she could improve her business terms.

Khursheda started the business practically from scratch but today she has her own trade outlet selling children's and women's wear. She brings her assortment from Istaravshan, Uzbekistan, and Kyrgyz Republic. She has good taste so she has repeat customers who come to buy her goods.

Khursheda is married with 2 children Her husband helps her to trade in the bazaar. Khursheda is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 5 months for importing a new seasonal assortment from Uzbekistan.

loans.use: importing a new seasonal assortment

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. raises ducks. She has been in this business for almost 10 years now. She is 47 years old and has six children. She is married to a farmer, Pablo M., who manages their small rice farm. Aside from rice and ducks, she also has a small sari-sari store business. People come to buy their needs at her store. With  these endeavors she is able to feed and clothe her family well.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 500 ducklings. In that way, she will be able to increase the size of her duck farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides their clients with training and insurance coverage services to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase 500 ducklings and 2 sacks of feed

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза - молодая женщина 31 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. У нее есть продуктовый магазин "Нигина" в центре города Кайраккум. Её муж занимается поставкой продуктов для магазина. Он закупает товар из рынка "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда, потому, что там продукты дешевле. У него есть легковой автомобиль, которым он привозит продукты в магазин. Дилфуза начинала с уличной продажи мелких продуктов. С помощью кредитования она расширила свой бизнес, и теперь у нее есть небольшой но свой магазин. С помощью последующих кредитов она хочет увеличить свой ассортимент, поскольку спрос на другие продукты очень большой. Дилфуза благодарит кредитную организацию за помощь в развитии ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is a young woman of 31. She is married and the mother of two children. She has a grocery store named Nigina in downtown Kairakkum. Her husband handles the delivery of groceries to stock the store. He purchases goods from Khujand's Panchshanbe market, because products are cheaper there. He has a passenger car that he uses to make the deliveries to the store. Dilfuza began by selling small items on the street. Using credit, she expanded her business, and now she has a small store of her own. With her next loans she wants to increase the variety of goods as the demand for other products is great. Dilfuza is grateful to the finance institution for its assistance in developing her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store

loans.name: Mumina

texts.ru:
Мумина Хамдамова  1966 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  Она работает  в Ковровом Комбинате Кайраккума  ткачихой.  Но в прошлом году  все ее сотрудники попали под сокращение и ее попросили выйти в отпуск без содержания. Она решила продолжить свой бизнес так как с работы нет  заработной платы. Ее сын привозит товар -обувь  она продает на рынке. Кроме этого она также торгует и мужской одеждой.
Кредит она потратила на расширение   ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Mumina H. was born in 1966; she is married and has 3 children. She has a high school education. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. She works at the Rug Factory Kayrakuma as a weaver. But last year all of her coworkers were laid off and she was asked to take a vacation without pay. She decided to continue her business because she does not have a salary from her job. Her son brings the products, shoes, and she sells them at the market. In addition, she also sells men’s clothing. She used her loan to expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand assortment

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: Ilyas E. is 25. His family lives in a small village of the Agsu region, where Ilyas runs a small grocery store selling food. Ilyas' store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with work. Ilyas has been in business for seven years. Currently he is seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods he offers. Ilyas had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelista is 48 years old and married to Mr. Jose Falcon, with whom she has five older children. Evangelista owns a small grocery store and her husband sells charcoal on the street from a small cart. They wake up very early every day in order to travel to purchase merchandise in the Abasto Market in Asunción. 

Evangelista sells her merchandise to her neighbors and to neighborhoods close by. She has a very well established clientele in the area. 

In the future they would like to purchase a vehicle in order to better carry out their charcoal sales.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, oil, meat, onions and potatoes for her grocery store

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita A. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with four members including her husband and her children: a daughter and a son. Her husband, Mr. Bashanta A., works in the government service. Her daughter is studying in secondary school and her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. Adikari started selling cows milk a year ago. She already owned a cow. Now she is requesting a loan to buy another young cow to sell more milk in the local area because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal, people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young cow for her milk business

loans.name: Leidy Laura

texts.en:
When I visited Leidy at her home on Saturday, she impressed me with her enthusiasm and priD. in her business. Although Leidy has been working with Manuela Ramos for less than a year, she was chosen to be president of her communal bank, “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women). Leidy sells beauty products, perfumes and undergarments from a variety of different catalog vendors. She has an impressive display case for her goods and a room dedicated to receiving customers.

Leidy plans to use this loan of 1,000 soles to purchase clothes in Lima to sell. In this way she will begin working on one of her goals, which is to have a boutique out of her home. She envisions this boutique as a “one-stop shop” where clients would be able to outfit themselves for any event. She hopes to sell not only beauty products and clothes, but also shoes, jewelry and gift items. Leidy also spoke to me about her desire to expand into new lines of products available by catalog.

Leidy is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She teaches English in a local school in the mornings and dedicates herself to her business in the afternoons. She is happy to have the support of her parents (with whom she lives) for her business ventures. She told me that her business is doing very well at the moment; she has a good clientele. Leidy very much enjoys her work and appears to have excellent business skills!

loans.use: To purchase clothes in Lima to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria P. is from the village of Bato. She is 38 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Maria owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kande

texts.en:
Kande is forty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children: three sons and a daughter. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central Region of Ghana.

Kande is a trader, selling textiles and jewelry. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the local market. She also hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to sell. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli S.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Faleu Manono. She is married and does not have any children. Kalameli has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 450 WST a month.

In 2008, Kalameli (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Kalameli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Kalameli is now requesting a new loan of 1250 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second loan from SPBD. Kalameli plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 20 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Wael has owned a generator for three years. He offers electricity to the houses in his surroundings when the electricity shot off. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a bigger and more powerful generator for his work. This is her third cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. Wael is special in his work because he works 24/7. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Wael first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase a generator for his work.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida S., a 48-year-old married mother of four children she loves taking care of, makes a living growing rice in Agusan Del Sur.  Her rice crops are growing but still need farm inputs, so to ensure a healthy and abundant harvest, she is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, of which she is a member.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Dondogjav

texts.en: Dondogjav T. is 41 years old and lives with her two sons in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent, and both of her sons currently attend universities in the city. T. operates a meat trading business, which she started in 2001. She has gained much selling experience over the years and has built a a very positive reputation among her many customers. T. is a very hard worker and hopes to continue to grow her business in the future. She says, "With my business earnings I am trying hard to support both of my sons' educations so that they can make good lives for themselves." She is requesting a 4,000,000 Mongolian tugrug (or about $2800 US) loan to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Lilingayon Valencia City. She is 59 years old. Conchita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a business buying and selling cinnamon and peddling it around the village. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en: Mouna is a 20 year old single woman living with her parents and 3 siblings. In 2008, she started her own home-based beauty salon to help with the household expenses. Today, Mouna is requesting $1,200 in order to purchase new machines for the salon.

loans.use: To purchase new machines.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget sells slightly used handbags at the front of her house in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is happy because she does not have to pay stall rent. The demands for her slightly used handbags are high because there are people in her community who cannot afford new bags. She is married with three children and she is 32 years old. She is a LAPO client. The Kiva field partner, LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more slilghtly used handbags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more slightly used handbags to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan's business is to sell food in bulk. He has two business locations. One is in Striy city, where he mainly sells flour and sugar in bags to small local retail stores. At the other location, which is in small village, he sells same products but to individual people, who prefer to buy sugar and flour in bags. This helps them to save some money as well as make sure they have enough food for several months.

Ivan started this business 19 years ago. He has many repeat clients who buy from him. Ivan has good prices and offers transportation services using his private vehicle. Ivan would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase 11 tons of flour. Ivan's business goal is to build his own storage place that he would not need to pay rent for. Ivan sponsors Christmas gifts for children in the village where he works.

loans.use: To purchase 11 tons of flour

loans.name: Lolita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. desde muy temprano sale a la carretera los altos a vender frutas como sandilla, melón, papaya, elotes, jocote, mango, coyolito y piña entre otras. Ella con este trabajo puede darles el sustento a sus tres hijos por eso paso esta navidad trabajando e invertirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y diversidad.

Además este año lo concluyo feliz por el éxito de su negocio y con la espera que en este año nuevo sea mejor que el anterior.
texts.en:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. leaves very early for the Los Altos highway to sell fruit (watermelon, melon, papaya, corn, jocote, mango, coyol, and pineapple, among others). With this job she has been able to provide for her three children. For this reason she spent this Christmas working. She will use the loan to buy higher quantities of more diverse fruits.

This year ended happily for her because her business was successful, and she hopes this new year will be better than the last.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit (papaya, jocote, mango, pineapple, watermelon, etc.)

loans.name: Afissa

texts.en:
Afissa is 38 years old, married with four children aged between 6 and 12 years old. She also takes care of one dependent from another family who is 14 years old. Afissa lives in Nyakabungo, the Western province of Rwanda. Her business is well organized and it is open from 6 AM to 9 PM every day. This is her 7th successful year in this business of selling foodstuffs.

Afissa is requesting a Kiva loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs including vegetables, beans, fish, etc. With these additional foodstuffs for sale, Afissa will be able to satisfy the demand of her customers as well as earning more profits in the process. This, in turn will allow her to reinvest in business so that she and her devoted husband can continue to pay school fees for their children, provide more food for them and save some for their future.

loans.use: More foodstuffs to sell like vegetables, beans, etc.

loans.name: Dallal

texts.en:
Dallal is a 48-year-old married woman with three unemployed children. She has helped her husband in the household by working as a hairdresser for the past ten years. She receives clients at her house and also works upon request by visiting her clients at their houses.

Dallal is thankful for her work; it allows her to alleviate her hard living situation. Today, she is requesting $1,200 to buy beauty products such as hair accessories, hair colors, and make up needed to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married with five children aged between 8 and 18 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and rents a three-room house where she stays with four people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Rose owns a stall selling yellow bananas and charcoal. She buys these yellow bananas from the very market where she works in Nakawa, one of the city markets so she doesn’t incur transport costs to and from shopping. She receives an average of 10 customers a day. She has done this business for over 10 years. Her main challenges are defaulters and the rainy season because she works from an open place. She works on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over seven years, servicing her 16th loan working along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of yellow bananas and charcoal stoves. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start going to farmers directly.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Roselyn's Group

texts.en:
Roselyn C. is from the village of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Roselyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Roselyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Roselyn owns & operates a specialized retail store primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, sugar, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roselyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Roselyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yao

texts.en:
Mrs. Yao K. is 62 years old and a villager in Thkov village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Teng Put, is a construction worker who can earn a small salary to support his family. 
            
Mrs. Yao K. is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle to help her husband go to his work place. Mrs. Yao K. is a mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 70 años, es casado y tiene siete hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el centro poblado de Rosario, ubicada en Ayacucho. Para Juan su trabajo ha estado ligado desde siempre a la actividad agrícola y se ha venido desarrollando en esta actividad desde hace 50 años aproximadamente. Él se dedica a cultivar cacao, café y frutas cítricas; en tiempos de cultivo y cosecha necesita de sus peones para que lo realicen en un menor tiempo y costo, pero usualmente él está en su chacra cuidando de sus cultivos ante cualquier plaga de insectos que afectase sus productos. Normalmente sus productos los vende en los Centros de Acopio de sus comunidad, pero sus frutas los vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Pese a la crisis social que atravesaron hace dos décadas, están tratando de recuperarse de a poco, es por ello que en el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo para que pueda cumplir con sus compromisos hacia sus clientes potenciales. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, del cual se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas en las fechas determinadas, además se siente conforme con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, espera cumplir con los pagos a sus peones, además desea aplicar  abono a su terreno de cultivo.
texts.en:
Juan is 70 years old. He is married and has seven children. They live together in their own home located in the town of Rosario, in the Ayacucho district. For Juan, his work has always been tied to agricultural activity, and he has been expanding in this activity for approximately 50 years. He cultivates cacao, coffee, and citrus fruits. During the growing and harvest seasons, he needs workers to complete these tasks with less time and cost, but usually he is at his farm caring for his crops in the face of any plague of insects that might affect his products. Normally he sells his products in the Collection Centers of his community, but he sells his fruit in the city of Ayacucho. In spite of the social crisis that they went through two decades ago, they are trying to recover little by little. It is for that reason that in the future he hopes to expand the land that he cultivates so that he can fill his obligations to his potential clients.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he promises to make the established payments on time, and in addition, he is complying with his community bank. With the loan that he is applying for, he will pay his workers, and he also wants to apply fertilizer to the land he cultivates.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay his workers and buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Kim Ang

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Ang N. lives in An long Ta Sek Kraom village in Kandal province and she was born in 1971. She and her husband, Mr. Khuy Heng Phorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income. So to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Kim Ang N. is finding a loan to buy some piglets to breed to start a new business. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school. The other one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Lô est âgée de 25 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE depuis le 20 octobre 2007. Elle a eu 5 fois de suite a recevoir de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problèmes de remboursement. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux s'équiper en matériels et produits de coiffure. Son objectif est d'aménager son salon, de le rendre plus accueillant et attrayant afin d'attirer la clientèle, mais tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Awa Lô is a married 25 year-old woman with one child. She has been a member of the Diamaguene credit association since the 20th October 2007 and has received 5 loans, all of which have been successfully repaid. She is a hairdresser by trade and this new loan would enable her to purchase new hairstyling tools and products. Her aim is to equip her salon, make it more welcoming and attractive in order to bring in more customers, and support her husband with the costs of looking after their family.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her hairdressing business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria Mancillas tiene ya mas de diez y ocho años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya le esta haciendo falta y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio. 
Doña Rosa Maria ha tenido ya cinco préstamos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Maria has been selling groceries for more than eighteen years, and the business is her family's source of income. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise that she lacks because she does not want to take money out of the business. She plans to pay the loan with a portion of the earnings from the business. Ms. Rosa Maria has already had five loans with FVP which she has paid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the business

loans.name: Salman's Group

texts.en:
Salman lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari with her husband and five daughters and one son. All of them are being educated and read in kindergarten and 2nd standard. A very caring and responsible mother and housewife, Salman arises early, mending clothes and cooking healthy meals.

Salman's husband is a sweetmeat producer and seller, and for the last 15 years has operated a shop in the market where he displays his items to customers. Having repaid her first loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan), Salman is now applying for a new loan to expand her husband’s business. The loan will enable him to buy more items such as milk, sugar, dry fruits and cooking oil for his shop. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will thus expand and earn him more income.

loans.use: Purchase items for sweetmeat selling business

loans.name: Martha Angelina

texts.es:
Martha Angelina B. tiene 29 anos de edad, es trabajadora, casada y tiene una hija de 4 anos.  Vive en Barrio La Soledad en Juticalpa, Olancho y es miembro del Grupo Solidario Luz y Unidad.  Tiene una pequena pulperia donde trabaja cada dia desde 6 de la manana hasta las 9 de la noche.  Hace 4 anos comenzo alquilando y sus ventas han ido creciendo y ahora tiene su propia casa.  Su esposo trabaja y le apoya a veces cuando bajan las ventas.    

Con el prestamo de 7,000 Lempiras comprara canaleta y aluzinc para unos cuartos que esta terminando y va a alquilar. Con el prestamo de mejoras de vivienda ella y su familia se sienten mas seguros en su casa y los clientes estan mas comodos.

Su sueno es surtir mas su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y apoyar a su hija en la educacion.  Martha ha tenido otros prestamos con FAMA y siempre a pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.  Los prestamos le han ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar su casa y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Angelina B. is 29 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is married and has a 4 year-old daughter. She lives in the La Soleded neighborhood of Juticalpa, Olancho and she is a member of the communal bank "Luz y Unidad." She has a small grocery store where she works every day from 6am until 9 at night. She started renting 4 years ago and her sales have been growing and now she has her own house. Her husband works and helps her out when at times her sales are low. With the loan of 7,000 Lemipiras, she will buy gutters and corrugated metal sheeting for roofing in order to finish the construction of some rooms that she is adding and is going to rent out. With the loan and the improvements to her home she and her family will feel more secure in their home and their customers will be more comfortable. Her dream is to better stock her business so that she can provide better service to her customers and support her daughter in her education. Martha has taken other loans with FAMA, and has always made her payments on time. The loans have helped her to grow her business and improve her home and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy gutters and corrugated metal sheets for roofing to finish building some rooms

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa 22 años de edad reside en el Municipio de Lolotique, Departamento de Morazán, está acompañada, vive con el esposo y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la ven de pescado y Elaboración de Hamacas.
Se dedica al negocio de las hamacas hace un año el cual lo aprendió gracias a su madre, y también se dedica a la venta de pescado el cual lo compra en la Ciudad de San Miguel y lo comercializa en los alrededores de Lolotique, dos veces por semana, y el resto de los días se dedica a fabricar Hamacas. Solicita un préstamo para compra de materiales como son: hilo de seda de diferentes colores, compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Tomasa son adquirir un puesto en el mercado de Lolo tique, para venta de pescado, y mejorar las ventas, contribuir para mejorar el sistema de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Lolotique, in the Department of Morazán. She lives with her husband, and she has a 4-year-old child. Her work is selling fish and making hammocks. She has been working in the hammock business for a year. She learned the trade thanks to her mother, and she also sells fish, which she buys in the city of San Miguel and sells twice a week in the area surrounding Lolotique. On the other days, she works making hammocks. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as silk thread of various colors, and to buy fish. Tomasa's dreams are to acquire a market stall in Lolotique to sell her fish, to improve her sales, and to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies to make hammocks, such as silk thread in various colors, and buying fish

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en: H. Nghiêm Thị (20201020051) is a 31 year old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase feed and other supplies. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by H. from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. H. Nghiêm Thị (20201020051) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi vịt để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
Oeun R., 61, is the village bank president, havI. been selected by its fifteen members, who are located in Tuol Kdei village, Kandal province.  With this loan, each member hopes to increase his or her income and standard of livI..

Oeun sells fish in the local market and is able to earn a small income to support her family.  Her house is old and needs to be fixed.  She is requestI. a loan to fix her house.  Oeun R. is a widow with one child who works in a bakery shop.

loans.use: Fix house.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena G. is from the town of Banga. She is 63 years old. Magdalena is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Magdalena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Magdalena also grows pigs for fattening and sale.

Magdalena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feed for the pigs. This will be the third loan taken out by Magdalena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Myrna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business selling snacks like fried elbow macaroni in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina belongs to Vehari, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, that is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives in the housing colony of Vehari named 575/EB in a three-room brick house.  

She is married to Z. A., who has a business of selling fertilizer and seeds. He has a shop in the market and has a good number of farmer contacts, particularly for selling his products.  

Sakina is a housewife. She spends all day staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy fertilizer and seeds in bulk quantities for selling through his shop. Buying items in bulk will cut his cost of purchasing and make him able to meet urgent orders on time.  

Sakina is hopeful that with the help of this investment, her husband will successfully be able to grow the business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds in bulk quantities for selling

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 25 years old and married with three children between the ages of two and seven. All of her children go to school. Esperance sells potatoes. She has had her business for seven years and her husband works with her. With this loan she will buy more potatoes to sell and she will buy a cow with her profits. Esperance says that her business is successful because of the large number of clients she serves. In the future she would like to buy a truck to supply potatoes to the capital city.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Wadad

texts.ar:
وداد عمرها 30 سنة متزوجة ولها ولدان تحب عائلتها كثيرا وتريد لها وضع اجتماعي جيد  تعتمد على نفسها فهي تعمل منذ اكثر من 5 سنوات                                                                                                           
طموحة تتطور في عملها فهي لديها محل لبيع الاكسسوار والعطور تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة زيادة البضاعة الموجودة     وزيادة الانواع في محلها بعد نقصانها                                                                                   
زبائنها يحبونها وهم من محيطها وجيرانها تجيد عملها بشكل جيد تعاني صعوبة في السيولة لتطوير العمل تتلقى دعم كبير من عائلتها  وزوجها بعد ان اعتمدت على نفسها في العمل
texts.en: Wadad, 30, is married with two sons. She loves her family very much and wishes to secure a good social status for them. Wadad has been self-employed for more than five years. She is an ambitious character who is developing her business. Wedad has a shop for selling accessories and perfumes.
