La señora Justa V. se dedica a su actividad económica que es la venta de verduras teniendo su negocio desde hace 33 años que dio inicio con sus propios ahorros y los de su esposo. Su negocio de venta de verduras lo inicia en León ubicándose en el mercado la Estación en las afueras, sin embargo mas adelante solicita un puesto para su negocio y se le fue otorgado sin ningún problema.

Justa V. es una dama casada y con 3 hijos que junto a su esposo luchan para sacarlos adelante en su proceso de estudio en niveles de primaria y secundaria.

No podemos omitir que la señora Justa Vasquez ha sido beneficiada desde hace tres años por Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento otorgándole 20 créditos hasta el momento de los cuales le han beneficiado para la compra de las verduras y además le han ayudado para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Wati

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Wati’s husband, I Made Suja, is a middle school teacher whose income barely pays for his family needs. Because of this, Ni Nyoman Wati would like to find a new source of income to increase their household income. That was why she joined DINARI’s pig breeding program, which provides training before the loan is disbursed in order to prevent unnecessary usage of the fund. With this loan, Ni Nyoman Wati will buy 2 sows and pig food. In the next 6 months, each sow will bear 8 piglets. That means, in 6 months, Ni Nyoman Wati can have a total of 16 piglets, which can be sold for $25 each, and yield about $100 monthly profit, which will be used to help pay for her family expenses. Ni Nyoman Wati hopes that her pig breeding business will grow even more with time so that she will no longer struggle to make ends meet and pay for her children’s school tuition.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Wati adalah istri dari I Made Suja yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai seorang Guru di sebuah Sekolah Menengah Pertama yang penghasilanya pas – pasan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan penghasilan seprti ini Ni Nyoman Wati menginginkan untuk mencari pendapatan baru untuk dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarga. Oleh karena itu Ni Nyoman Wati memutuskan untuk ikut memelihara babi yang didukung oleh program DINARI. Salah satu kelebuhan yang ada di program ini adalah adanya pelatihan dan pembinaan sebelum modal diberikan. Hal ini untuk mencegah penggunaan dana pinjaman untuk keperluan lain yang tidak berguna. Dengan kredit yang diperoleh, ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian 2 ekor Induk dan pakan ternak. Selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan Induk Babi ini akan melahirkan rata-rata 8 ekor. Sehingga dengan demiki selama 6 bulan pemeliharaan Ni Nyoman Wati menghasilkan 16 ekor anak babi yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Dari hasil penjualan keuntungan yang akan diperolah sebanyak Rp.1.000.000.- per bulan. Keuntungan itu ia manfatkan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Ni Nyoman Wati berharap kedepan ia akan dapat lebih mengembangkan usaha ternak babinya dengan memelihara induk dan penggemukan. Jadi dengan demikian jelas ia tidak kesulitan lagi dalam memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sekaligus biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: To buy 2 sows and pig food

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Since his childhood, Mr. Marcos F. has dedicated his life to agriculture and cattle ranching in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. He is a married father and carries the responsibility of providing for his family's quality of life; they depend on his agricultural income.

Ever since they have lived in this location, they have had problems with the absence of electricity, since they live in a remote, rural area. To get around this issue, Mr. Marcos requested the installation of a solar panel. Once received, he must be very responsible about paying this debt, and that's why he is seeking the help of Ceprodel in earning credits that will help him cover his debt, and so contribute to improving his household's condition.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Marcos F. desde su juventud ha dedicado su vida a la labor de la agricultura y ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de llevar el sustento a su hogar brindando todas las condiciones de vida a su familia que dependen de sus ingresos en su labor de agricultura.

Desde que viven en su localidad siempre han tenido el problema de la inexistencia de la energía eléctrica por estar ubicados en una zona rural muy alejada. Para evitar tal problemática, el señor Marcos solicitó la instalación de un panel solar que al ser otorgado debe muy responsablemente pagar esta deuda y por este motivo busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan cubrir la deuda y de esta manera contribuir con el mejoramiento de las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel to provide his household with electricity.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and originally from Namaacha. She was married for many years, but her husband left her a couple of years ago and moved to South Africa. Julieta has 6 children ranging from 25 to 6 years old. All attend school, expect from the older one who is already working to help with the household expenses.

Julieta just studied until 2nd grade, as she had to work to help her family’s difficult financial situation. Soon after Julieta had her first son and got married, she started to sell baskets bought in the capital city Maputo in Namaacha, where she would buy shoes and go back to Maputo to sell them. Ten years ago, Julieta started to sell only pots and pans made in Maputo. The person that produces those pots comes from Maputo to sell to her and Julieta then sells them at Namaacha’s open market. Julieta buys each pot for Mozambique Metical (MZN) 120 to MZN230 and sells them for MZN180-270. Julieta makes between MZN1,000-3,000 per day, but unfortunately the market is only open twice a week (on Wednesdays and Saturdays).

This will be Julieta’s first loan. She heard about Hluvuku during a conversation with a friend, and decided to apply as well. This loan will be used to increase her inventory and help increase sales. According to Julieta, the more products there are in the stand, the more the stand sells.

In the future, Julieta would like to ask for a new loan to build a stand at her house where she would be able to sell her products during every day of the week.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Domullojonova

texts.ru:
M. is 31 and has a high school education. She is married with four children. M. has a business selling vegetables wholesale; right now, her main business is in carrots. She would like a loan in order to expand into selling potatoes, beets, and other vegetables as well. M.'s husband is a mechanic. Her children are in school. M. has a steady income from her business and would like to increase her sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Манзура женщина в возросте 31 год замужем имеет 4 детей , образование имеет среднее .Она занимается оптовой продажей овощей восновном сейчас продает морковь.Получив кредит Манзура хочет увеличить ассортимент, продавать нетолько морковь но и картофель , свекла. и.т.д. Муж работает слесарем. Дети учатся в средней школе. Манзура имеет доход со своего бизнеса и хочет увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael sold chifles (plantain chips) in the streets but realized that the business wasn’t making enough money, so he needed to reevaluate new possibilities. One year ago he decided to rent a stall and sell soup in a market in his neighborhood. He works there from 6am until 4pm. He sells a variety of soups, such as chicken soup, lamb soup, and stewed corn soup, among others. The loans that Rafael has received thus far have helped him to purchase the ingredients he needs to make his soups. He would like to open another stall to sell chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rafael se dedicaba a la venta de chifles (chips a base de plátano) en las calles, sin embargo, se dio cuenta que el negocio no le estaba rindiendo económicamente, por lo que tuvo que evaluar nuevas posibilidades. Fue así que desde hace 1 año decidió poner un puesto de caldos en un mercado de su barrio. Él trabaja allí desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Vende diversos tipos de caldos, como de gallina, de cordero, de mote, entre otros. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los ingredientes que necesita en la elaboración de sus caldos. A Rafael le gustaría poder abrir un puesto más de caldo de gallina.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his soups

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, age 45, has two school age children who are her reason to keep struggling to get ahead. She and her husband, Mr. José, work hard for their children, hoping that one day they will become professionals. Doris has been selling groceries and basic need items for a while now. This business is her family’s source of income. Doris intends to expand her business, buy foodstuff, and above all, make some repairs to her house, which is why she turns to you in search of a loan that will help her advance. Thanks to your help, Ms. Doris will be able to obtain her goal very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doris (45 años) tiene 2 hijos que aún están estudiando y son el por qué D. seguir luchando para salir adelante, ella junto a su esposo, el señor José, trabajan muy duro por sus hijos esperando que algún día sean profesionales.Doris se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad desD. hace ya tiempo, este negocio es el que brinda el sustento económico D. su casa e hijos. Doris tiene el propósito D. ampliar su negocio, comprar comestibles y sobre todo mejorar algunas estructuras D. su vivienda, por lo que recurre a ustedes en busca D. un préstamo que pueda ayudarla a surgir. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Doris logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store and make home repairs

loans.name: Dinna's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Dinna is married with four children between the ages of one and eleven. She has owned and run a small food shop since 2005. Everyday, she works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Dinna now hopes for a loan to buy more items to sell in her business, like rice, sugar, oil, and salt. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Eliamani, who has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To increase her food shop inventory.

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
chị C. thị Hương Ms 01030017 năm nay 32 tuổi, chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động và hoà đồng với mọi người, công việc bán hoa tươi nên lúc nào cũng bận rộn, cùng với việc chăm sóc 2 con đi học, chồng chị làm công an xã nên không giúp chị được nhiều trong công việc gía đình. Nhưng mỗi khi người dân đến mua hàng, đều nhìn thấy vẻ mặy luôn tươi cười chào đón, vì vậy cửa hàng nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông khách đến mua nhất là vào dịp lễ tết. Thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn trước từ 150.000 VND đến 170.000 VND/ ngày. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 C. kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, lần này chị đăng ký vay tiếp C. kỳ III với mức vay 5.152.000 VND để mua hoa, giấy trang trí đám cưới, mở rộng hàng kính mắt nhằm thu hút nhiều khách hơn. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Minh Ms 01030018 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh điện thoại
  • chị Lê thị Hà Ms 01030019 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh chăn ga gối đệm
  • chị Đặng thị Hoa Ms 01030020 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh điện thoại di động
  • chị Tống hồng Xuyên Ms 01030021 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để kinh doanh áo cưới
  • chị Nghiêm thị Thành Ms 01030022 vay mức 5.152.000 VND để đầu tư vào cửa hàng giầy dép.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thi Huong (ID: 01030017), aged 32, is a very active and sociable woman. Mrs. Huong is very busy, as she sells flowers in the farmer market as well as takes care of her two children. Her husband is a local police, so he is very busy too and isn’t able to help her much with all the family work. Mrs. Huong’s flower shop is relatively popular in the area, especially during the Lunar New Year and festivals. The daily income of the family is about 150.000-170.000 VND. Mrs. Huong and her group’s members have been very on time in paying back the loans of the previous round. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Huong would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy more flowers, decoration papers for wedding to expand her business. Other members in her group include: -Mrs. N. Thi Minh (ID: 01030018) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling telephones. -Mrs. Le Thi Ha (ID: 01030019) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling blankets and pillows. -Mrs. Dang Thi Hoa (ID: 01030020) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling cell phones. -Mrs. T. Hong Xuyen (ID: 01030021) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a shop selling wedding dresses. -Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID: 01030022) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a shop selling footwear.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vay vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ROGELIO ES CHOFER DE TRAILER Y SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GEORGINA ES VENDEDORA POR CATALOGO TIENEN 1 HIJO EN EDAD DE ESCUELA Y OTRO PEQUEÑO, JUNTOS COMO FAMILIA ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COLOCAR PROTECCIONES EN PUERTAS Y VENTANAS A SU CASA Y ASI DARLE A SU FAMILIA UNA MAYOR SEGURIDAD.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio is a trailer driver and his wife, Georgina, is a catalogue saleswoman. They have one son who is an elementary school student and another small baby son. As a family, they are seeking a loan in order to add protective bars on the doors and windows of their home to provide greater security for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door and window guards (bars) for their home

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang S., 55, and her husband, Mr. Nat Chum, 58, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1970, they have three sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two of their other children are garment factory workers, two are silk weavers, and the youngest in study in local school.

Mrs. Lang and her husband have been in the business of selling mangoes for five years. They buy mangoes from farmers on contract, meaning they pay money upfront to villagers before the harvesting season and then they collect mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market. Mrs. Lang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase mangoes before the harvest season for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for business

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., 48, is married and lives with her husband and five children in  Battambong province, Cambodia. She is a local teacher and makes $3 a day, while her husband stays at home growing many kinds of mint. On average, he is able to make $4 a day. Three of their children are students and two are helping him with planting mint. 

Long N. is asking a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizers. (Husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
Mirian, tiene 40 años  es soltera con una hija que es menor de edad y  dependiente de ella,  solo estudia por el momento. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, championes y ropas.
Mirian  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de dos años y su local comercial se encuentra en la zona del mercado de abasto de ciudad del este. Todo empezó como un negocio familiar  hicieron una sociedad con su hermana donde invirtieron capital para montar su negocio, hoy día la hermana de la misma le vendió toda sus acciones quedando ella como única propietaria del local comercial. 
Mirian, con sus ganancias de las ventas  hace frente a los gastos de la casa y ayuda a su hija en sus estudios para que en el día de mañana la nena sea una gran profesional.
Mirian, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de ropas primavera - verano y championes deportivos, y así  abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Miryan is 40 years old and single. She has a daughter, still a minor, who is dependent on her and is a full time student at the moment. Miryan works sells shoes, running shoes and clothing. Miryan has worked in this business sector for more than 2 years. Her business is located in the zone near her city´s wholesale market. It all began as a family business when Miryan and her sister formed a company together and invested the money with which Miryan would launch her business. Her sister has now sold all of her shares to Miryan, leaving her the sole proprietor of the business. With the earnings she receives from her sales, Miryan takes care of the household expenses and helps her daughter with her studies so that one day her daughter will be a great professional. Miryan comments that she has plenty of sales. For this reason she wants to acquire a larger quantity of spring and summer clothing and sports shoes, as a way of stocking up to meet the strong demand she sees for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
R. Shoira is 38 years old. She is married with two children. Shoira has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing clothing for women and children. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. She has had this business for 8 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, she is planning to purchase a new sewing machine. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Shoira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Suyapa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Los salvadoreños a lo largo y ancho del mundo se  han caracterizado  por ser hombres y mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La señora Suyapa Guadalupe G. es un claro ejemplo de ello a sus 24 años cuenta con  tres puestos en el mercado de San Vicente; logros obtenidos a través de sacrificios y esfuerzos.  Su sueño es renovar los productos de su negocio y contar con mercadería variada  que  a atraiga nuevos clientes. 

Actualmente  esta solicitando a  integral  su tercer crédito para lograr comprar más insumos para sus  puestos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Además  en los créditos anteriores Suyapa  ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Salvadorian people have characterized themselves as extremely hard-working and enterprising men and women throughout the world. Suyapa Guadalupe G. is a clear example of this, having three stalls at the San Vicente market at only 24 years of age. She has managed her accomplishments through much sacrifice and effort. Her dream is to update the products she carries so she has a variety of items to attract new customers. Currently, she is requesting her third loan through Integral to purchase more supplies and improve her income. In addition, Suyapa has demonstrated she is responsible about her payments in previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businesswoman. She runs a shop selling clothes in the Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both used clothes and new clothes for women and children. She purchases the items from Kariakoo wholesale shopping center. The used clothes are purchased from Karume used clothes city market.

She has been running the business for six years.

She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Amope

texts.en:
Amope sells foodstuffs, torchlights, batteries, and provisions. She goes to the Republic of Benin to buy rice in bags, tin tomatoes in cartons, and vegetable oil. She supplies her customers during the daytime from 7 am to 3 pm. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years.

Amope has four children and she is 38 years old. She lives in Orile-Agege and has been in her business for the past twelve years. Amope is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provision to sell.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru:
Саломов Толибджон проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее.
 Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Покупает, откармливает и продает . ТАким образом и зарабатывает деньги. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить дополнительно одного молодого и породистого бычка. В дальнейшем , если бычок вырастет крепким клиент планирует его использовать в качестве производителя.
texts.en:
Tolibjon S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 28 years old, married and has a child. He has a secondary education. He is involved in breeding cattle. Tolibjon buys, raises and sells the cattle. This is how he makes a living. Currently, he plans to obtain a loan in order to purchase an additional young purebred bull. Then, if the bull grows to be strong, Tolibjon plans to obtain a purebred breed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a young purebred bull

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 38, sells frozen foods. Ruth is married with three children.  She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Iklim

texts.ru: Иклим Исматова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Иклим имеет самбусочную на рынке "Корвон". Она продает самбусу, пирожки, кофе и т.д. Этим видом бизнеса занимется более 7 лет. Муж работает проводником на поезде "Душанбе-Москва". Клиентка хочет взять кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот. На полученный доход хочет дать детям хорошее образование.
texts.en:
Iklim I. lives in the vicinity of Gissar. She is 27 years old and is married with 3 children. Iklim has a sambusa shop at the Korvon market. She sells sambusa, pies, coffee, etc. She has been doing it for over 7 years. Her husband is an attendant in the train Dushanbe - Moscow. Iklim would like to use her loan for increasing cash flow and using the profit for providing her children with good education.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Virgen De Cotoca 1 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen de Cotoca I”  esta cursando su primer ciclo, esta conformado por  15 participantes  pertenecientes al barrio santa lidia su  mesa directiva esta conformado por las señoras Felipa que es la presidentas, Elisa tesorera y Heidy Liliana secretaria. A pesar de ser su primera participación en la institución las socias ya estaban juntas en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital conociendo la modalidad de trabajo en equipo, y demostrando ser responsables y con ganas de trabajar juntas para salir adelante.  Los miembros de este grupo realizan diferentes actividades como la venta de refrescos, ropa, comida, material escolar, carne y también realizan actividades de soldadura, transporte publico de pasajeros y la agricultura. La competencia en el rubro a la cual se dedican los socios es grande pero las ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante los pone en campaña para ser mas competitivos a través del crédito otorgado con el que podrán contar con un capital de trabajo que ayude a en la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas para generar un mayor ingreso que apoye en el desarrollo de sus pequeños negocios y de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Cotoca I group is in their first loan cycle. The group is made up of fifteen members who live in the Santa Lidia neighborhood. Their executive board members are Felipa, the president; Elisa, the treasurer; and Heidy Liliana, the secretary. In spite of this being their first participation in the institution, the members have already been together in similar entities at the Agrocapital foundation. They know the way to work as a team. They demonstrate responsibility and have the desire to work together to get ahead. The group members have different businesses such as selling soft drinks, clothes, meals, school supplies, and meat. They also perform tasks from welding to public transportation of passengers and farming. The competition in the area that the members work is big. But, the desire to work and get ahead puts them on a campaign to be more competitive. They do this via the loan, which they count on for working capital to acquire materials, supplies and tools to generate greater income. This will support the development of their small businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar N. lives with his wife and two teenage sons in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Erdenebayar had worked for the local army for over a decade. When Mongolia transitioned from the communist regime to the free market economy in 1991, he decided to leave his job and pursue small business for himself.

Today he has a small retail business dealing in unprocessed livestock products such as unprocessed wool, cashmere and animal skins. He purchases these livestock products from herder families in the countryside and sells them at profit at the wholesale markets in the city or sometimes in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running this business for the last 18 years and he is very experienced and well-known in the business. His business capital is currently 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase more wool, cashmere, and animal skins from herders.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool, cashmere, and leathers

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Progreso” esta representado por la señora Gloria y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentran las hermanas Guadalupe y Maria Laura quienes al igual que sus compañeras poseen negocios pequeños con ingresos independientes como la venta D. cosméticos, comida, zapatos y principalmente ropa para todas  las edad. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería por cambio D. temporada así como para la mejora y ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "The Progress" is represented by Mrs. Gloria, and comprised of 12 members including two sisters, Guadalupe and Maria Laura. The sisters, like the other group members, have small businesses with individuals incomes. The businesses incluD. cosmetic sales, food sales, shoes and clothing sales. The business competition in the commercial atmosphere is quite high, but the dedication and drive to work help these women exceed the competition. The final destination of this financing is for the acquisition of merchandise for the new season, and to improve and expand their sales stands. This will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher standard of living. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Манзура

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Манзура женщина –кредитор в организации более шести лет. Она жительница Костакоза, занимается продажей нижнего белья, детской одежды и обуви на рынке Костакоза. Для завоза школьного ассортимента детской одежды она планирует  съездить в Бишкек. На снимке Манзура на месте деятельности.

loans.use: продажа  детской одежды

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es: La señora Karla Rodríguez de 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace nueve años administra la cual logro poner con ayuda de su esposo, ahorros y luego con prestamos, procreo seis hijos tres de ellos mayores y casados y los otros estudian, su esposo trabaja en una ferretería como conductor, doña Karla desde horas temprana  se levanta para preparar el desayuno de su familia y para dar un buen servicios a sus clientes ya que abre la pulpería bien temprano, tiene la ventaja que sus hijos le ayudan ya que en horas de la mañana las ventas son buenas. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, productos lácteos, y carnes, para ofertar a sus clientes, y brindarle un mejor servicio. Agradece a la institución ya que a través de este financiamiento incrementa su inventario, lo cual genera mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Karla Rodríguez is 48, and she lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has a mini market that she established nine years ago. She was able to do this with help from her husband, savings, and then with loans. She has six children. Three are grown and married, the others are in school. Her husband works as a driver in for a hardware store. Karla gets up very early to make breakfast for her family and to give her customers good service. She opens the mini market very early. She has the advantage of her children helping her; sales are good in the morning hours. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, and meat, in order to give her customers better service. She is grateful to the institution because she is able to increase her inventory with this loan. This will generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and dairy products

loans.name: Faasao

texts.en:
Faasao T. is a 31 year-old woman living in the town of Mulifanua Fou. She is married and has six school-aged children. Faasao owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Faasao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 tala WST a month.

In 2009, Faasao joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faasao's request for a loan of 1000 tala WST, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment, is her first loan request. Faasao plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat C., age 46 and her husband, Suy Hour live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have one son who attends school. 

Sarat has been selling fruit (mango) for 10 years. She buys them from villagers and resells them in other districts.  Her husband sells grocery items from home.  Sarat is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase mangos.

loans.use: Purchase mango for resale.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia P. S. de 49 años de edad reside en el departamento de San Salvador con su esposo quien es comerciante y sus tres hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes y uno el mayor de edad universitario, para Marta brindarle educación a su hijos es importante, ya desea la superación profesional de cada uno de ellos  que con mucho esfuerzos Marta y su esposo han brindado a sus hijos. Marta posee su propio negocio en el mercado Excuartel, donde vende productos hechos en El Salvador, sus ventas son estables ya que muchos conocen de este mercado por su concepto típico, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para surtir su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia P. S. is 49 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador. Her husband is a merchant. Two of her three children are still in school, while her oldest child has already started university. Providing for her children’s education is an important priority for Marta. She hopes each of them will develop professionally. Marta and her husband work extremely hard to provide for their children.

She manages her own business at the Excuartel Market, where she sells products made in El Salvador. Her sales are stable and her business is known throughout the market for its traditional handicrafts. Marta is currently requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Iligan City. She is 58 years old. Evelyn is widowed. To make a living, Evelyn operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: S. Chantal est mariée à DADE Fidèle, un agent au Port de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Chantal est mère de six enfants tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont à sa charge. Chantal réside depuis une trentaine d’année au quartier Hindé à Cotonou. C’est avec son mari et ses enfants qu’elle vit. Chantal vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, Chantal s’est mise dans la vente de paniers et de balais à son domicile, afin de faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. C’est depuis quinze ans que Chantal mène cette activité. Chantal s’approvisionne à Comé au Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour renforcer son activité  et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Chantal sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Chantal S. is married to Fidèle Dade, an agent at the Port of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Chantal is the mother of six children, all in school, of whom four are in her care. Chantal has lived for thirty years in the Hindé area of Cotonou. She lives with her husband and children. Chantal helps her husband in providing for the family. Having abandoned her schooling very early on, Chantal began selling baskets and brooms at her home in order to meet her needs and those of her children. She has run this business for fifteen years. Chantal gets her supplies at Comé in Benin. She is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and has repaid all her loans properly. To strengthen her business and better satisfy her customers, Chantal is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets in bulk

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher D. lives in Aghavnavank Village in the Ijevan area. She is a widow and has 3 daughters. Two of her daughters are married and live independently and the third one is engaged. 

Shogher works as a librarian in the village administration building. She also raises cattle and manages a little food and household goods shop (you can see it in the photo) which is located in her home. Cattle breeding is very hard and profitable work which helps Shogher to finance her family and organize her daughters’ weddings. 

Shogher needs a 600.000 AMD loan to buy fodder for her farm animals, to buy 4 or 5 pigs for her farm, and to buy candy and juice for her shop to sell during the New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her farm animals, to buy 4 or 5 pigs for her farm, and to buy candy and juice for her shop

loans.name: No Joke Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'No Joke' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who want a loan in order to expand their businesses in size and quality. In this way, they can make better sales and earn more profit. Consequently, their living conditions will improve to a new level – they can thus better support their school-going children in terms of feeding, clothing, educationally and medically.

On the right in the photo is Aminata K. K., the leader of this group of five. Aminata was born in Matotoka village about eight miles away from Magburaka town. She is age thirty-two, married and has three children. Her husband is a motor mechanic and her children are attending Senior and Junior Secondary Schools.

For over ten years now, Aminata has been selling palm oil (the favorite cooking oil in this country), rice and peppers. With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil, bags of rice, and bags of peppers. Aminata can not tell exactly how much of each of these commodities she will buy as prices are not stable.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil, bags of rice, and bags of peppers

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Hermelinda es separada, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Hermelinda venD. comida en un puesto alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días al mediodía, también reparte la comida en taper a los comerciantes del mercado. Además Hermelinda en épocas venD. tuna.
Hermelinda necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal.
Los sueños D. Hermelinda son tener casa propia y un restaurante granD..
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the communal bank Amauta Huamanga. She is separated, 43 years old, and has 1 child. Hermelinda sells food from a rented stand, an activity that she carries out each day at noon. She also distributes food in containers to the market traders. At times Hermelinda also sells tuna. She needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil and salt. Hermelinda dreams of owning her own home and a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is a 36 year old woman who lives with her husband and son in Goicochea, San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Her highest level of formal education is the completion of 3rd grade.

The loan consultant that has been working with Erika has described her as a hardworking, honest, sincere, noble woman with a battling spirit. This will be her first loan with Fundacion Mujer. Erika is applying for this loan in an effort to gain financial independence as well as to earn an income to help her sister Karol raise her child, who has special needs.

Erika's determination is exemplified by her daily work routine. She has dedicated the last five years of her life to selling newspapers in the morning while working as a masseuse in the afternoon. Recently, an opportunity to purchase the newspaper stand and license where Erika and her sister work, has presented itself. Erika plans to use this loan to purchase the newspaper vendors license from the Costa Rican government, for 250,000 colons, and also the newsstand itself.

As owner, Erika will be able to earn more revenues and better support herself, her immediate family and her sister. The newspaper stand is located diagonally to the Legislative Assembly in a densely populated pedestrian zone of San Jose where many locals have become accustomed to purchasing their daily newspapers.

Erika and her sister sell papers from 6 a.m. to noon everyday or until they run out of papers. In an average good month Erika can earn 290,000 colons selling papers.


Erika’s goals are to earn enough money from the newsstand to provide a quality standard of living for her family. In the long term she would like to open a beauty salon.

Although she would like to be able to sell more than just newspapers at her stand, this would require the purchase of another expensive license. Erika mentions this as one of the main deterrents to the growth of her business. The good news is that her papers are selling fast, and often she is sold out by 8 in the morning!

loans.use: To purchase a newspaper vendor's licence and stand

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru: Зухуров Ислом проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка а дети учатся. Отец, пенсионер. Сам Ислом имеет высшее образование. Он Более 20 лет работает по специальности ветеринаром. Ислом в основном лечит жывотных. Кредит берет для закупа лекарств и вакцины.
texts.en:
Z. Islom lives in the Shahrituz region. He’s forty-seven years old, married and has five children. His wife stays at home, his children go to school and his father is retired. Islom has a university education. For more than twenty years he has worked as a veterinarian, usually treating only animals. He’s asking for a loan in order to buy medication and vaccines.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Закуп лекарств и вакцины

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya is 33 years old and the mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser since 1999. Over the years, thanks to her business income, she has been able to support her family with her husband, and she has a good number of clients who like her work. 

Today, Inaya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to add new decor and renovate her shop, in addition to buying more tools needed order to attract more clients and increase her income.

loans.use: Add new decor, renovate her shop and add tools that will attract more clients

loans.name: Rosa Llane

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín,  tiene 36 años y 02 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella 
Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Rosa tiene por actividad la venta de productos de belleza. Cuenta con clientela fija, amigos del barrio,  vecinos, moradores y otros, también trabaja con pedidos anticipadamente.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.
Rosa se siente una mujer realizada, con ganas de salir adelante siempre agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
La Sra. Rosa, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín, tiene 36 años y 02 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Rosa tiene por actividad la venta de productos de belleza. Cuenta con clientela fija, amigos del barrio, vecinos, moradores y otros, también trabaja con pedidos anticipadamente. Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente. Rosa se siente una mujer realizada, con ganas de salir adelante siempre agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará productos de belleza para surtir su negocio,

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. She is 39 years old. Vilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. Vilma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily use products. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sandra Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Alejandra A. tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
A su negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de comida y desea también tener otro tipo de productos para vender. Pero en este momento no cuento con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio sin descapitalizarlo, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito. Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio planea pagar el crédito.  
Ya que es madre soltera y el negocio es la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Alejandra A. has been working for more than a year making and selling food. Her business is lacking a greater variety of food, and she wants to also have other products to sell. However at the moment Sandra doesn't have the necessary money to invest in her business without taking away working capital, so she is seeking a loan. She plans to pay back the loan with part of her earnings. As Sandra is a single mother, the business is the source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and inventory

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang N. is 36 years-old. She sells different types of fritters from her store at her home. She sells to people who are her nearby neighbors and usually generates about $1 each day. She was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.  Heang N. now has four children who attend school or go to work. She also helps her life partner husband, who works in construction, earning $6.50 a day.

Heang N. lives in a very old house that is needs frequent repairs and the family’s living situation has not been comfortable. Therefore, Heang N. is applying for a loan of $1100 to repair her old house and as she intends to use some of the loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Melissa es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, estudia informática en un instituto, Melissa vende zapatos que reparte a domicilio a amigos y familiares, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Melissa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Los sueños de Melissa son terminar su carrera y ejercer.
texts.en:
Melissa, 23, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and their son and is studying information techology at an institute. Melissa sells shoes door-to-door to friends and relatives; she buys her stock in Lima. Melissa needs 1000 soles to buy shoes. Her dream is to finish her professional preparation and start her career in her field.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Mrs. Tes R., 34, lives in Kompong Tom province. She owns a small store next to her house where she makes and sells fritters to her neighbors to generate a daily income. Mrs. R. lives with her mother, who stays at home making silk palm mats to sell.  Mrs. R. was married, but is now divorced and doesn't  have any children. Mrs. R. will soon be cultivating rice crops during the approaching farming season. Due to a  lack of capital, Mrs. R. would like to purchase some equipment to support her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk C., 44, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a cleaner and earns an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces hammocks to sell, earning an income of about USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to transport their hammocks to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport their hammocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her cultivatable land area and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: La Señora Diana Patricia es una mujer muy trabajadora, le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con el paro de las colegiaturas de uno de sus hijos ya que ella tambien trabaja como profesora en una escuela primaria. Este seria su primer crédito y lo requiere para el pago de colegiaturas de su pequeña hija.  Ella desea que sus hijos salgan adelante, invirtiendo en  una buena educación. La señora Diana Patricia les agradece la ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Diana Patricia is a hard-working woman. She works as an elementary school teacher to help her husband with the family's expenses and to pay her children's school fees. This is her first loan and she will use it to pay the school fees of her youngest daughter. She wants her children to get ahead in the world so she is investing in providing them with a good education. Diana Patricia thanks all of you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School fees.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa T. is from the village of Manaring. She is 48 years old. Felisa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Felisa owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as biscuits, canned goods, condiments and other commodities needed in the local community. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Felisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
la sra. Adela Martínez se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña repostería denominada REPOSTERIA B&D la que ha llenado de sabor por mas de 10 años al pueblo paraiseño, su sabor y precio hacen de su negocio tener muy buena clientela,  su negocio esta ubicado en el Barrio Las Flores frente al Mercado Municipal de La ciudad de El Paraíso, Adela a sabido ganarse su clientela con la calidad de producto y el buen precio que maneja en su negocio     
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materia prima para la fabricacion del pan, necesita producir lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adela Martínez is a businesswoman who has a small bakery named Repostería B&D which for more than ten years has filled the El Paraíso community with flavor. Her business has a very good customer base owing to its tasty offerings and prices, and is located in the Las Flores neighborhood across from the City Market of the city El Paraíso. Adela has known how to win her customers over with product quality and the good prices she offers in her business. She will use the loan to purchase basic ingredients for making the pastries of which she must produce enough to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, lard, margarine, flavorings, sugar, colorings, eggs and milk

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia T., 47, is married and has three school-aged children. She is from the municipality of Banga in the province of South Cotabato. Ofelia grows corn to sell. She has been engaged in farming for over five years. She also sells native chickens, too, which she says helps in providing for her family's needs.

Ofelia joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and chickens to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and chickens

loans.name: Welsie

texts.en:
Welsie R. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Welsie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Welsie owns & operates a business providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. Welsie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Welsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Welsie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Welsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en: Batsuuri S. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters are university students while his son is handicapped and stays at home with his wife. Batsuuri sells water to households and organizations in his town that are too far away from the town well. He started this business in 2005 using his horse cart. Since then, his business has been successful enough to purchase a new car for water deliveries. His monthly revenue is between 180,000 and 250,000 MNT. He tries to provide pure water in sanitary containers. Batsuuri is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase new barrels for his water delivery business.

loans.use: to purchase new barrels

loans.name: Respect Father Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org located in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Respect Father” group. These individuals are small-scale entrepreneurs who have all come to SMT/Kiva to request individual loans of SLL 500,000 in order to invest in their businesses. 

Adamsay C. is the leader of this group. Adamsay is thirty years old and is married with five children. Three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Adamsay sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths), rice, palm oil, groundnuts, and other items. She has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now. Adamsay is going to use her share of the loan to buy the materials used to make gara lapper in order to produce a large quantity of gara cloths. She will also use part of the loan to buy bags of rice for her rice selling business.

loans.use: To buy materials to make gara lapper (locally dyed cloth) and to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Laberiano

texts.es: Liberiano, de 45 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Desde muy joven Laberiano se dedico al cultivo de papa, arveja y maíz, ya que esta es la actividad que se ha realizado en su familia desde hace mucha generaciones, sus productos los vende a los compradores, que llegan hasta sus chacras, quienes posteriormente llevan el producto a vender a la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y aún mantiene el mismo ritmo, cuidando y procurando que sus plantaciones no sean perjudicadas por la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Liberiano, 45, is an unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house and what he most wants is to get ahead in life.  From a very young age Liberiano has been a potato, pea and corn farmer since this is the activity his family has been in for many generations.  He sells his products to buyers that come by his fields and then take the product to be sold in Tarma.

What he enjoys most about the work is cultivating the fields, something he does with much dedication.  He has been farming for 25 years and still maintains the same work rhythm, caring for his plants ensuring that they aren’t damaged by insect infestations.  In time he’d like to buy more land to increase production.

This is his 8th loan with MFP.  He understands that he must repay on time and is willing to do so.  He is very respectful toward his fellow communal bank members.

He will use the requested one-thousand new soles to buy manure and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
When she was 46, Nazira D. lost her husband and became a widow. She has 3 children who claim care and proper upbringing. The eldest daughter is temporarily unemployed, one son is a university student and the youngest son is a schoolboy.

In 1994, Nazira began her career by working as a canteen cook, and she came to the conclusion of starting her own business. Today she offers a public catering service in the Tashkomur canteen. Business profits have made it possible for her to obtain a car. However, in order to make more profit, her business requires development. That’s why Nazira has applied for a loan: she wants to purchase equipment for cooking and improve the canteen’s interior. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for cooking

loans.name: Klever John

texts.es:
Klever John T. T.  tiene 39 años. Es viudo, vive con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Klever se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y tener una mujer que quiera a sus hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Klever John T. T. is 39 years old.  He is a widower and lives with his three children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The V.R.C. EL BATAN co-op is 90 minutes away from the Chillanes Offices which belong to the Chillanes canton.  The co-op is comprised of 21 members who has been actively involved for many years in short cycle crop farming of cocoa, yucca and corn.

Klever has been growing cocoa, yucca and corn crops for a long time.  He buys products in the Bucay canton and sells them at the Chillanes tradefair and in the canton.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products and fertilizers for his cocoa crop.  The loan will help finance the purchase of needed supplies to combat insect plagues, crop illness and weather variation.  He dreams of contuining his work and one day meeting a lady who will love his children.

He enjoys being active in sports.

loans.use: Agricultural products and fertilizers for growing cocoa

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Cecilia is married and has two children, ages 12 and 9. Her wish is for her children to finish college and have bright futures. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Cecilia is just starting this business.

Cecilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El Senor Leopoldo H., tiene 58 anos de edad, casado, con 7 hijos, agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, fue alfabetizado; habita en El Coyolito, La Concordia, Esteli.
El cuenta que tuvo una ninez muy sufrida, no disfruto, pues desde la corta edad de 7 anos empezo a trabajar, criando animales, en ocasiones tenia que caminar mas de 1 hora para llevarlos a tomar agua, porque no habia rios cerca; esta situacion le impidio estudiar, ademas la escuela mas cercana le quedaba a 2 horas de su casa.
A partir de los 12 anos comenzo a sembrar, para poder ayudar a sus padres y poder costear sus propios gastos, pero de esta manera inicio su experencia en este sector.
A los 23 anos se caso, lo que le dificulto mas sus problemas economicos, porque comenzo a tener hijos; 
El realizo estee prestamo para comprar insumos para la siembra de Tomates, espera obtener buenas ganancias; pero ademas de esta actividad, posee otros ingresos por ganado y aves de corral.
Espera que de sus 7 hijos se puedan prepara la mayoria para que ellos puedan tener un mejor futuro y no sufrir tanto como el.
texts.en: Mr Leopoldo H., age 58, is married with seven children. He is a farmer who plants vegetables. He has been educated. He lives in El Coyolito, La Concordia, Esteli. He says that he had a very difficult childhood, and from the young age of seven he started to work, raising animals. At times he had to walk more than an hour to bring the animals to water, because there were no rivers nearby. This situation hindered his studies, and furthermore the nearest school was two hours from his house. From the age of twelve he started planting in order to be able to help his parents and cover his own costs. This is how he gained experience in this sector. At the age of 23 he got married, and their greatest difficulty was economic problems, because they started having children. He is requesting this loan to purchase items for sowing tomatoes. He hopes to make a better income. On top of this business, he has other income from livestock and barnyard birds. He hopes that his seven children will be able to be better prepared so that they can have a better future and not suffer as much as he has.

loans.use: planting vegetables

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita tiene 48 años, es una madre de familia amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su hija Yoselin de 12 años de edad. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de aretes, collares, carteras y prendas de vestir, en un centro comercial muy concurrido. Este trabajo le es muy conveniente, ya que un familiar también se dedica a la venta de estos productos y es quien le prevé de mercadería para vender, por ello cuenta con una gama de productos de calidad y de alto precio y que tiene mucha aceptación por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que conoce mucha gente, de esa manera se distrae, así que cuando posee de nueva mercadería rápidamente visita a sus clientes. Lleva dos años en este negocio, dejando a crédito o al contado los productos que vende; pero a veces se le complica cuando tiene un cliente que no termina de pagar sus cuotas. En adelante planea construir su casa, ya que actualmente es de madera, así mismo acondicionar un espacio para su negocio. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este crédito que necesita será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo se desempeña en su grupo comunal como una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cuál es muy respetada. Benita, tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de prendas de vestir casuales, para la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
48 year-old Benita is a kind and unassuming mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and 12 year-old daughter Yoselin.  Benita's business is selling earrings, necklaces, purses and clothes in a very busy shopping center.  This business is very convenient for her as one of her family members also sells these products and provides her with merchandise to sell.  This means that she has a range of high-price, good-quality products which are very popular with her customers.  What Benita most likes about her business is that she gets to know a lot of people, it keeps her occupied and whenever she has any new merchandise she quickly visits her customers.

Benita has been in this business for two years, selling her products for cash or leaving them on credit.  However, sometimes things get complicated when she has a customer who doesn't pay all of their instalments.  In the future, Benita plans to re-build her home since it is currently made from wood.  She would also like to remodel a space for her business.

This is Benita's 11th loan with MFP and she knows that this loan she needs will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and is therefore very well respected.  Benita plans to invest her loan money in buying casual clothes for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Retroceder Nunca, Rendirse Jamas Group

texts.es:
Felicia V. D. L., casada, 53 años D. edad, pertenece al grupo comunal "Retroceder nunca, rendirse jamàs".
Felicia, es una mujer emprendedora y desD. muy joven aprendiò D. sus padres el oficio D. la confecciòn D. prendas D. vestir; posteriormente se independizò y formò su proio negocio confeccionando prendas D. vestir a sus vecinos y conocidos D. su localidad.
Desafortunadamente Felicia no cuenta con la compañia D. su esposo, ya que por problemas D. salud ocasionados por el clima propio del lugar; su esposo tuvo que irse a trabajar a la capital desD. hace ya algunos años.
Felicia vive con su ùnico hijo, que ya tiene familia.
El prèstamo solicitado es para compra D. tela para poder cumplir con las entregas D. sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Felicia V. D. L., 53, is married and a member of the "Retroceder Nunca, Rendirse Jamás" (Never Retreat, Never Surrender) communal bank.

Felicia is an enterprising woman who learned very young from her parents the occupation of Dressmaker.  She later became independent and started her own dressmaking business making clothes for her neighbors and acquaintances in her location.

Unfortunately Felicia does not enjoy the company of her husband because he had to move several years to the capital to work because of health problems caused by the local weather.  Felicia lives with her only son who has his own family.

The requested loan is to buy fabric in order to fill some pending clothing orders.

loans.use: To buy dressmaking fabric.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E., a 46-year-old married woman with seven school-aged children, is from the village of Olingan where she owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different kinds of goods in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.



In 2005, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Candida

texts.en: Candida G. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 60 years old. Candida is married and has one adult child. Candida owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Candida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Candida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Candida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Candida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad.  Está casada y  tiene 07 hijos (5 independientes), la señora estudió hasta 2do de educación primaria. 
Hace 4 años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros y  venta de artículos artesanales.  En la foro la vemos tejiendo.
Con éste crédito de S/.  2800.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez unidades de llicllas (tejidos) y cuatro unidades de chanchos.  Trabaja junto con su esposo, quien  trabaja en construcción civil (obrero).
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y poder vender más vacas para generar más ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian palabras con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Luján" (Our Lady of Luján) located in the district of Tinicachi, province of Yunguyo and department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of seven children (five of them live on their own). She studied until second grade of elementary school.

She has been working with the microfinance institution Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan amounted to 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business.
