She buys and sells livestock and sells handicrafts. In the picture we see her knitting. Currently she applies for a new loan of 2,800 nuevos soles. She will use the money to buy ten units of fabric (llicllas) and four pigs. She works with her husband, a construction worker.

Her dream is to improve her business and sell more cows to generate more income. What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings because she can chat with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy 10 units of fabric (llicllas) and 4 pigs

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet de 29 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, habita en el sector huarmamayo del distrito de Quimbiri, actualmente reside en una casa alquilada en el caserío de Chiriumpiari cuenta con vivienda propia construida a base de madera y techo de calamina. Yanet es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Ella es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Quimbiri. La bodega de Yanet es la primera en abrirse, desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, quienes acuden a su establecimiento para comprar los productos que tiene.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias y comprar un lote de terreno dentro de la ciudad de San Francisco y así ofrecerle un techo donde pueda vivir a su futura familia. Este es su octavo crédito de Yanet con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo, y a su vez agradece a la institución por concederle el crédito. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
29 year-old Yanet is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in Huarmamayo sector, in Quimbiri district.  She currently lives in a rental house in the small village of Chiriumpiari but she owns her own home which is built out of wood and has a corrugated metal roof.

Yanet is a very industrious woman.  Through hard work, she strives to excel in life despite the adversities that fate puts in her path.  Yanet is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Quimbiri district market.  Yanet's store is the first to open its doors at 6.00am and she is always ready to greet her first customers who come to her establishment to buy her products.

What Yanet enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers and thereby remaining up to date on what is happening around her.  She has been in this business for four years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be staying on her feet nearly all day long.

Yanet will use her loan to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock up with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to invest her profits and buy a plot of land in the town of San Francisco so that she can provide a home for her future family.  This is Yanet's eighth loan from MFP.  She feels that this support will help her a lot in making progress in her work and she is grateful to the institution for granting her the loan.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to acquire merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Blanca Irene

texts.es: Blanca tiene  30 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de padres en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumi en el norte de Perú. Solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz, no de agua potable. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 30 familias. Gana la vida vendiendo abarrotes, productos de primera necesidad y recargas de teléfonos móviles. Ademas, ofrece el servicio de peluquería. Estas actividades las realiza desde hace 03 años. Su negocio está situado en su domicilio. Emprendió este negocio ante la escasez de oferta de abarrotes y recargas asi como también de peluquería en su comunidad. Estudió cosmetología en Lambayeque,  es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Es muy conocida y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona y en zonas aledañas. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de más abarrotes para surtir su bodega y atender todas las necesidades de la comunidad. Con esta inversión, podrá generar mayores  ingresos en el corto plazo. Blanca tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Ya ha manejado préstamos y demuestra puntualidad en pagar sus obligaciones. Su negocio muestra muy buena rentabilidad debido a que el costo de producción es muy bajo. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le brindan en seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca, 30, is single.  She lives in her parents’ house in the rural part of Mochumi District in northern Perú.  She only has electricity, not potable water.  Her community is small; it has approximately 30 families.  She earns her living selling groceries, basic need items and mobile phone recharges.  She also provides barbering services.  She’s been in these activities for three years.  Her business is located in her home.

She started the business because groceries, mobile phone recharges and barber services were unavailable in her community.  She studied Cosmetology in Lambayeque, that is to say, she knows the occupation to perfection.  She is very well known and has an established customer base in the zone and from surrounding areas. 

She will use the loan to buy more groceries to stock the store and meet all her community’s needs.  With this investment she’ll be able to generate higher income in the short run.  Blanca has very good personal and work-related references.  She has handled loans in the past and she’s shown herself to be punctual with her repayments.  Her business is having good profitability because production costs are low.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide her to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: El Santuario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "El santuario", esta historia es acerca de la señora Yaneth O. C., ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene 30 años de edad está casada con el señor José Luis, quien es policía, tienen 4 hijos Chelsi Mariel, José Luis, Félix y Yoctzi Yamel, de los cuales solo 2 estudian primer y segundo año de primaria, ya que los otros dos todavía están muy pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de carne y chorizo desde hace 8 años.
Ella dice que se decidió por esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de ayudar a su esposo con los  gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos también para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas carne de res y chorizo, para continuar con sus ventas. 
La meta que se ha puesto doña Yaneth es la de darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos, para que así puedan estudiar una carrera y hacerse de una excelente profesión, para poder tener un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que está pensando en empezar a construir un local, para poner su carnicería y así tener mucho mas surtido y más variedad de productos, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ingresos.
Dice que todos los integrantes de su grupo, son muy confiables, responsables y sobre todo personas muy trabajadora. 
La señora Yaneth le da las gracias a FRAC y kiva por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr tener su propio negocio y asi cambiar su vida y la de su familia.
Otros de los compañeros de doña Yaneth son: soila, Elvia, Maribel, María del socorro, Tomasa, natividad, Faustina, yarexis, eloina, María, teresa, yanet, Virginia y Sonia quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: frutería, venta de ropa, pescados, abarrotes, venta de comida, maíz, carne, tamales, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is called "El santuario" (The Sanctuary). This story is about Señora Yaneth O. C., one of the group members. She is 30 years old and married to José Luis, a police officer. They have four children: Chelsi Mariel, José Luis, Félix and Yoctzi Yamel. The eldest two children attend elementary school, second and first grade respectively, while the other two are still too young.

Yaneth has been selling meat and chorizo (pork sausage) for eight years. She says that she chose this activity because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with household and education expenses. Moreover, she wanted to improve her quality of life and have a good financial cushion. She will use her loan to buy more beef and chorizo to continue her sales.

Doña Yaneth's goal is to provide a very good education to her children. They should study for a degree and get an excellent profession, and thus have a better future. In addition, Yaneth wants to expand her business. She thinks about building new premises for her store with a much greater and diversified offer, and earning a higher income.

She says that all the members of her group are very reliable, responsible and above all hard-working people. Señora Yaneth is thankful to the microfinance institution FRAC and to Kiva, because they have enabled her to have her own business and thus change her life and that of her family. Doña Yaneth's colleagues are Soila, Elvira, Maribel, María del Socorro, Tomasa, Natividad, Faustina, Yarexis, Eloina, María, Teresa, Yanet, Virginia and Sonia, who are engaged in different activities, such as selling fruit, clothes, fish, groceries, food, corn, meat, tamales, fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more meat and sausages.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo.  La señora no cuenta con estudios. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de tres años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros y artefactos usados.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 100.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital que tiene y comprará artefactos para luego venderlos.

La socia nos cuenta que también hacen chacra (cosecha) como: papa, cebada, trigo, trabaja junto con su esposo e hijo, la señora cuenta que viaja a diferentes lugares con  su negocio ofreciendo sus productos.
Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es lo que gana el ahorro y las facilidades de los préstamos.  Su sueño es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the communal bank "Chijuyo Copapujo", located in the district of Ilave of the province of El Collao in the department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and she has 1 child. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/. 500 nuevos soles and she invested the funds in her business buying and selling livestock and used goods. 

This new loan is in the amount of S/. 100 and it will supplement her capital funds to purchase merchandise for resale.

She tells us that she also has farm land where she cultivates: potatoes, barley and wheat. She works with her husband and son. She says that she travels to different locations to sell her products. 

What she enjoys about her communal bank is that her savings earn an interest, and the easy loan process. 

Her dream is to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase second hand merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mary V.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Sierra Leone International Mission Secondary School from Waterloo. Waterloo is a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to open a branch.  This school is staffed with 30 employees and has an enrollment of 1,500 pupils. 

These hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 5,600,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful projects that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials or a piece of land, or to pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in business. 

Mary is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Makeni city, today Mary is living in Waterloo together with her husband and child. Mary has served in the teaching profession for many years now. She requested a loan in order to buy house-building materials to complete the building processes she has begun.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials to complete the building she began

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 42-year-old married man and father of six children. Houssam lives and works in Saida. He studied to work as an X-ray technician, but because of lack of opportunities and because he has a big family to take care of, Houssam started working selling coffee in the streets. In 1996, he took a fixed place next to a hospital as his official selling point.

Houssam has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower for three consecutive cycles, and all his previous loans helped in improving his business and his family's social and financial situation.

This time Houssam isn't requesting the loan for his business; he really needs it to pay for an urgent kidney surgery for his daughter. The surgery costs $26,000 and he was able to collect a big amount of it but he still needs the requested amount to start with the necessary medications before the surgery.

Houssam found it hard at the beginning to start such a business, because he's well-educated and not used to street work. Now he's friends with everyone in the region, and he got used to it.

He hopes his daughter gets well soon and that he never faces such a situation with any of his children again.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's surgery.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 56 years old, married, and never blessed with a child. To make a living, Nena catches and sells fish in the local market. This is her only means of income. She sells fish like milkfish, grouper and blue marlin to earn a living. She has been running her business for over five years with a monthly income of PHP 7,500. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fishing materials.

Nena has been member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Nena hopes to have an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 35 years old and lives in the city of Otavalo, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and two children who are 10 and 4 years old, respectively. Nancy is an entrepreneurial person who works day-to-day for the well-being of her family. She is a seamstress who dedicates her time to creating embroidered blouses that are popular with the indigenous community in the region. Nancy is obtaining a loan to purchase four rolls of material to make these blouses. She began her business with a single sewing machine six years ago. Now she works with two sewing machines and two machines that do embroidery. She currently works with two other seamstresses. Nancy hopes that this loan will help increase her income and allow her to hire another co-worker. Her dream for the future is to covert her workshop into an industry where many people work. She hopes to hire others so that their families may benefit from her business as her family has.

loans.use: to buy rolls of cloth for her sewing and embroidery workshop

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer, a married woman with one child who attends school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Jeniffer has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major business challenge of high transportation costs, and her major dream is to expand into a wholesale shop in the future.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Jeniffer is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase six bundles of maize flour, three sacks of beans, cooking oil and sweets.

loans.use: to purchase six bundles of maize flour, three sacks of beans, cooking oil and sweets.

loans.name: Nelly Hermelinda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Nelly es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga con ayuda de su esposo tienen un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual preparan desayunos y almuerzos, en las mañanas prepara el delicioso ceviche de pescado y camarón y otra variedad de platos. Además del restaurante también tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles que atienden a la vez que están en el restaurante ya que es en su misma casa. Llevan 35 años en sus negocios y gracias a Dios lo mantienen hasta la actualidad y les va bien ya que los clientes la prefieren por la sazón que les da a los platos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda y para preparar los alimentos para su restaurante.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y gozar de buena salud que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The “Primero de Abril” (1st of April) Communal Bank meets each 15 days in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan work, recognized at the national and international level. This is the place where the famous “Panama” hats are made from “toquilla” straw.

Nelly is a founding member of the communal bank and is its president. She likes it because interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions. Nelly is 61 years old, married, and has 2 adult children who are independent. Her husband is a merchant.

Nelly, aided by her husband, has a small restaurant in her home in which she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Mornings, she makes her delicious fish and shrimp ceviche and a variety of other plates. In addition to the restaurant, she also has a small grocery store that she attends while she is in the restaurant, since they are in the same house. She has had these businesses for 35 years and, thank God, she has maintained them until the present and they are doing well. Her customers prefer her restaurant for the flavor she gives to her dishes.

This loan will be used to buy food to restock her store and to prepare dishes in her restaurant.

Nelly's goals are to forge ahead in her businesses and to enjoy good health, which is most important.

loans.use: to buy food for her store and restaurant.

loans.name: Jefrey

texts.en:
At the age of 32, Jeffrey is married and has two school-aged children. He is married to a one and only loving woman, Lilibeth. They are both engaged in the farming business, in which they plant and harvest corn.

Jeffrey is also engaged in a hog-fattening business but it is not stable because he don’t have enough capital to continue operating it. At present, Jeffrey temporarily stopped his hog-raising business. He wishes for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy piglets to raise. He will use the loan wisely to be able to continue operating his business.

In the future, Jeffrey wants to expand his business for it to become a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul wants a loan to buy alcohol for resale. He is a Ugandan male, aged 29 years, and hails from the Kyenjojo district. He lives in a semi-permanent house. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him, and his desire is to diversify and set up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy alcohol for resale.

loans.name: Hailyn

texts.en:
Hailyn is married with 5 children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hailyn is 25 years old and has one child who is in school.

Hailyn has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Hailyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and other equipments for fishing.

Hailyn has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Hailyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Ramona, es un grupo antiguo, fueron saliendo adelante, cada integrante tiene su propia actividad. Todas ellas son de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y responsables.
Una de las miembros es la señora Ramona, ella tiene una despensa, mediante la cual ella mantiene a su familia y todas las personas que de ella dependen. Comenta que tiene muchas ventas, pues tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden hasta su despensa. Ella dice que todo lo que hace es por darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás, con lo cual podrá aumentar la cantidad de productos que tiene para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This long-standing committee was created thanks to Ramona.  Its members are getting ahead in life and each one of them has their own business activity.  All of the women are from the town of Villa Elisa.  They are all very hard working and responsible. 

One of the members of this group is Ramona, who owns a grocery store.  Through her business, she supports her family and all the people who are dependent on her.  She tells us that she makes a lot of sales as she has many customers who always come to her store.  She says that everything she does is done to provide her family with a decent and respectable life.

Ramona is requesting this loan to buy food, drinks, dairy products, etc.  This will enable her to increase the quantity of products that she has available with which to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 52 years of age. She is married and has seven children. She was not able to send them all to school due to lack of finances to sustain their need for a good education. Four of her children are already married. To make a living, Clarita involved herself in rice farming together with her spouse. They both plant and harvest rice and in the future, they sell it to traders in the village. They usually earn a yield during the months of May and November. 

This planting season of October, she needs to pay for laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm. This serves as an additional expense for them but they need to hire laborers because they are not capable of performing all the activities on the farm such as sowing, tilling and transplanting rice seedlings. She has an insufficient fund so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.

In the future, she wants to achieve an abundant harvest to save for the college education of three of her children and assure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to pay for laborers to help transplant the rice seedlings

loans.name: Kalamkas

texts.ru: Каламкас 54 года, вдова  и воспитывает двух детей. В 1991 году Каламкас начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Каламкас использовала стартовую сумму в 9,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство с численностью в 5 голов коров и 1 лошади.  Благодаря ежемесячной прибыли в сумме 7,500 сом (KGS) Каламкас покрывает ежедневные расходы своей семьи и откладывает деньги на обучение для своих детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каламкас обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Каламкас планирует заготовить корма  и сено для скота на зиму.
texts.en: Kalamkas is 54 years old, a widow and is raising two children.  She started her business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural products in 1991.  Kalamkas used a starting a capital of 9,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and was able to develop her business to contain five heads of cattle and one horse.  Thanks to her monthly profit of 7,500 som (KGS), she covers daily family expenses and saves money for her children's education.  In order to further develop her business, Kalamkas requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  In the near future, with the help of earnings from the loan, Kalamkas plans to prepare livestock feed and hay for the winter.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo es trabajador en una empresa pública, pero también es artesano confeccionista: confecciona chamarras con la ayuda de su esposa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser tela de diversas texturas, cierres, forros, etc. Leonardo vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona Tacagua  en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene el crédito en IMPRO deseando hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonardo works for a public entity but is also a craftsman: he makes jackets with help from his wife.  He needs the loan to buy raw materials like fabrics in various textures, zippers, lining, etc.  

Leonardo lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  He’s married and has two children.  This is the first time he’s gotten an IMPRO loan wishing to make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lining, zippers, etc. for his jacket making business.

loans.name: Weya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weya SHG Group in Western Kenya!  Esther is the facilitator of the Weya SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Esther takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have quality farm produce and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Esther was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Esther will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In the above photograph, Esther is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has owned an electric generator since 2007, leasing electric lines for his area and surrounding areas. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation and is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2500 loan in order to replace the power lines' spare parts. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to replace the power lines' spare parts

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh is 53 years old. She is a member of An Tap cluster in SEDA. She has participated in SEDA since 2008. She has four children who are married. Mrs Canh has a store. She raises pigs and sells iron nails. She has had this job for two years. She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). Previously she borrowed 8.288.000 and repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy iron to produce iron nails.

loans.use: to buy iron to produce iron nails.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and married with four children aged 3 to 14. The three eldest children are in school. She sells beans and sorghum in a shop she has run for three years. 

Beatrice would like a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. Any profits will be used to buy a hectare of land. She dreams of having a large inventory of foodstuffs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She is the mother of five children. Mayson decorates with flowers and she is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase flowers for decoration purposes.

Khawla is looking to open a shop to better display her products. She hopes to employ people to help her. She aspires to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase flowers for decoration purposes

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is forty three years of age and is married with nine children.

Akenese owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Akenese needs a loan of WST 1,000 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Akenese's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with a three-year-old child and has been a farmer for 10  years. Martin's farm produces milk, vegetables, and poultry for the local market. He also works as a motorcycle driver to earn extra income. Martin states that animal diseases and occasional droughts are the major challenges in his farming business, but he remains optimistic his business will be better.

Martin is requesting a 61,500 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his dairy and poultry farming businesses. He believes the loan will improve his farming income and enable him provide better living standards for his young family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and poultry

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en: Augustin is a 25 year old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo is determined to succeed in the business to establish a bigger store someday. Indeed, without sufficient capital, all of the hard work will be of little worth. But when his previous loan was granted, the amount made a vast impact on the business. He bought stocks of grocery items for his variety store. He wants to thank lenders since the amount they’ve provided became a way for him to increase sales as he’s earning an income is approximately Php 9, 000 every month.

Camilo wants to thank as well Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving his previous loan. He is blessed for God’s abundance and the medium of blessing, CCT and all of the lenders with compassionate hearts. He’s also grateful as they conduct seminars for every entrepreneurs. 

This year, he is requesting for a loan of Php 22, 000 that will be used for the renovation of his variety store and added grocery items as well. 

Camilo is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where he gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share his own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: The amount will be used for the renovation of his variety store and added grocery items as well.

loans.name: Kennide

texts.en:
Kennide owns a tire sale and repair shop. After working for several years in a market selling fruit, Kennide decided to pursue the family trade and open this workshop. He learned the ins and outs of the business from his father who has already passed away. He started the business with a loan in order to buy the machinery but he is eager to receive more capital in order to continue to grow his operation. His shop is open from 7 in the morning to 7 pm. He has 2 kids and a wife who is a teacher.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy materials for his workshop

texts.en:
A. is 40 years old and has two daughters. A. owns a grilled chicken business, while her husband sells live chickens in the market. The $50 loan from MBK will be used partly for her grilled chicken stall and the rest for her husband's business. Hopefully with Rp. 50,000 (about $5) earnings, A. can help with her family's financial situation and pay for her daughters' tuition expenses. A. needs a larger loan to expand her grilled chicken business.

Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

A. berusia 40 tahun dan mempunyai 2 orang anak perempuan. A. mempunyai usaha berjualan ayam bakar, sedangkan suaminya Adul berjualan ayam hidup di pasar. Oleh karena itu pinjaman yang diterima dari MBK sebesar $50, sebagian digunakan untuk usaha ayam bakar dan sebagian lagi untuk usahanya suaminya. Dengan pendapatan Rp. 50,000, A. dapat membantu perekonomian keluarganya dan dapat membayar biaya sekolah anaknya. A. memerlukan pinjaman yang lebih besar lagi agar dapat mengembangkan usaha ayam bakarnya.

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is married with nine children who are all in primary school. He has not undertaken any formal training, but he is a member of the community’s AIDS awareness group.

Moses started his business in 1984 in order to support his family. With this $150 loan from Pemci, he wishes to expand his business and be able to buy charcoal in bulk and sell it at different marketplaces. Through his business, Moses has been able to build himself a house, buy a piece of land, and also provide a needed service to the community. He has also been able to engage in cattle trading where he’s doing well. An enterprising gentleman who is battling to improve the well-being of his large family. Support from Kiva partners will give him a big boost.

loans.use: Charcoal Dealer

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is twenty-eight years old and the mother of one child. She sells hot peppers in the town of Magburaka, Sierra Leone. Almost ninety-five percent of Sierra Leoneans put hot peppers into their cooking sauces and therefore hot peppers are a big business in the country. Isatu is only able to purchase two bags of the peppers a week and earns $20 as profit. If she could access a loan of $175, she would be able to purchase three more bags to increase her profit and reduce her time of traveling to purchase the items and have more time to run her business.

loans.use: Isatu would like to increase the inventory for her business selling hot peppers.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano S., 49, is a married mother of 3 children. She has high school education. Rano’s husband earns a living as a handyman. Each of Rano’s adult children has their own family. For 18 years since closing of the factories, Rano has been engaged in sales. At first, she sold clothing for children, but gradually Rano switched to selling men’s shoes. Her previous MicroInvest loan, Rano used to expand her store, gain new clients, and increase the assortment of shoes. In the future, to reduce her costs, Rano plans to buy her goods directly from the suppliers in neighboring countries.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Саидова Рано-49лет, замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Муж разнорабочий, каждый из детей имеют свою отдельную семью. Рано занимается торговлей уже 18лет, после того как заводы и фабрики закрылись. Раньше она продавала детскую одежду постепенно она перешла на продажу мужской обуви. После получения кредита она расширила место деятельности, приобрела много клиентов и увеличила ассортимент. В дальнейшем планирует ездить за товаром сама в соседние страны.

loans.use: To increase assortment of shoes

loans.name: Victor Alberto

texts.es:
Victor is 41 years old and has a fruit tree farm. He has this business on his property in Sapahaqui. He sells his products mainly in the markets of La Paz, El Alto, and sometimes in the cities of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. Victor lives with his family in the community of El Pabellon, in the county of Sapahaqui, in the province of Loayza. His wife is Aurora Mamani Lopez and she works with him in the cultivation and care of the fruit trees. Their children are studying in the same town.

Victor has more than 20 years of experience in fruit tree cultivation. Though there is competition in the market, he has his own clientele because of the good way he treats his clients. He is preferred by them due to his punctuality in the delivery of the fruits, especially in Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. There are no fixed prices in the sale of the different types of fruits. They vary according to the season and weather each year. Victor does not have any record of negative credit history with the Risk Center or the INFOCRED Bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

VICTOR DE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE REMOSION Y PLANTACION DE ÁRBOLES FRUTALES DE SU PROPIEDAD EN LA LOCALIDAD DE SAPAHAQUI, LA PRODUCCIÓN DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS PRINCIPALMENTE LOS COMERCIALIZA EN LOS MERCADOS DE LA PAZ , EL ALTO Y ALGUNAS VECES EN LAS CIUDADES DE COCHABAMBA Y SANTA CRUZ. VICTOR RADICA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE EL PABELLON DEL CANTON SAPAHAQUI PROVINCIA LOAYZA, JUNTO A SU FAMILIA, SU ESPOSA ES LA SRA. AURORA MAMANI LOPEZ, QUE SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO Y CUIDADO DE FRUTALES JUNTO A SU ESPOSO, SUS HIJOS ESTUDIAN EN LA MISMA LOCALIDAD. VICTOR CUENTA CON MÁS DE 20 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO DE CULTIVOS FRUTALES. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, EL TIENE SU PROPIA CLIENTELA YA QUE POR LA FORMA DE ATENDER A SUS CLIENTES Y PRINCIPALMENTE LA PUNTUALIDAD EN LA ENTREGA DE LAS FRUTAS ES UNA DE LOS MAS PREFERIDOS, SOBRE TODO EN COCHABAMBA Y SANTA CRUZ. NO EXISTE UN PRECIO FIJO EN LAS COMPRAS DE LA VARIEDAD DE FRUTAS, LOS MISMOS VARIAN DE ACUERDO AL TIEMPO CLIMATOLOGICO DEL AÑO. EL CLIENTE NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURU DE INFOCRED.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elisa Efigenia

texts.es:
Señora Elisa Efigenia is 60 years old. She finished elementary school. She currently lives in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad.

She used to live in the district of Salpo, in the town of Otuzco, but she decided to move to the town of Trujillo because all of her children lived there.

Since she has always been able to take care of herself financially, she decided to lease a small space, located close to a public transportation company, where she sells spare car parts and car accessories. She tells us that she started with only selling car accessories, but thanks to the loans she's been able to obtained from her local community bank, she has been able to expand her business by adding spare car parts.

Señora Elisa is a member of the local community bank called "Victor Raul" where she obtained her first loan in the amount of $300 nuevo sol. With this money, she was able to purchase spare car parts.

With this loan of $175, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase oils, bolts, schock absorbers, etc. Her dream is to one day have her own locale where she can sell her car parts.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elisa Efigenia tiene 60 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa. Actualmente vive en el distrito D. El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Anteriormente la señora Elisa vivía en el Distrito D. Salpo, provincia D. Otuzco, en la Sierra D. la región, pero decidió venir a vivir a Trujillo porque todos sus hijos ya están radicando en esta ciudad. Como estaba acostumbrada a trabajar y tener sus ingresos propios consigue un local pequeño para vender repuestos y accesorios para carros en un lugar cercano a una empresa D. transporte público. Nos manifiesta que empezó vendiendo sólo accesorios pero gracias a los préstamos recibidos en su banco comunal ha podido ampliar su negocio a la venta D. repuestos. La señora Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00, dinero que utilizó para comprar repuestos e iniciar la venta D. los mismos. Con este préstamo D. S/.500, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará grasas, pernos, amortiguadores, empaquetaduras, entre otros. Su mayor sueño es tener un local propio en donD. vender sus repuestos.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts and accessories (oils, bolts schock absorbers, etc)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 45 years old and sells cattle in the Villa Verde market. She had four children - one is 16 years old and studies, another is 19 and drives a motorcycle taxi, another is 21 and is studying and the oldest is 23 and helps his mother in the livestock business.

The business consists of buying and selling cattle. The purchases are made in the small villages near Montero and later the livestock is sold at the Villa Verde market. Alejandrina has 4 years of experience in this type of business. There is average competition in the business, but Alejandrina has some steady customers in the market who buy livestock. The prices vary according to the animal´s weight, as far as pigs, the prices also vary according to the weight.

This loan request is Alejandrina´s fifth with our institution, during which time she has demonstrated an excellent repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina es una señora de 45 años de edad que se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno en el mercado de Villa Verde. Alejandrina tiene cuatro hijos, uno de 16 años que actualmente estudia, el otro de 19 años de edad es transportista de mototaxi, el de 21 años de edad está estudiando y por último el de 23 años de edad le ayuda a su madre en el negocio del ganado.

El negocio consiste en comprar y vender ganado vacuno, la compra la realiza en las poblaciones cercanas a Montero y posteriormente vende el ganado en el Mercado de Villa Verde, Alejandrina tiene 4 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Existe competencia en un nivel medio, pero Alejandrina cuenta con clientes fijos en dicho mercado que adquieren el ganado. Los precios de los mismos varian según el peso del animal, en cuanto al ganado porcino los precios también varian de acuerdo al peso.

Esta solicitud es la quinta de Alejandrina con nuestra institución, tiempo en el que demostró tener un excelente cumplimiento de pagos.

loans.use: Buy livestock (cows and pigs).

loans.name: Azimia Group

texts.en: Khadija is a married woman, with one child who is 7 years old. She has a boutique business where she sells clothes, and she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. R. runs a general store in the town of Picota, San Martin. At the store she sells primary-need goods like canned food, pasta, fruit, and toiletries. Ruth has been running the business for 10 years and now has many loyal customers. These customers are happy that they do not need to walk to the main market on the other side of town.

Ruth is 54 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is happy she has been able to work and help her family. Over the years she has made countless friends and been able to save for her children’s education. Ruth is happy that she will be able to give her children more opportunities than she had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Mujeres En Accion, Ruth is requesting a loan of s/1000 to be repaid over 6 months. She will use the money to buy olives, eggs, rice, oil, and other goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of olives, eggs, rice, and oil

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad A. is 38, and he has his own store in the Imishi region. He started his business in 2004 and since that time he has sold beverages and crackers. Now Azad would like to expand the number of products he sells and improve the conditions of his store. Azad is married and has 2 small children. He tries very hard to take care of his family, but it is very hard for him. Azad decided to apply for a loan to purchase more products, which will help him to attract more clients and earn more money.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru:
Bunafsha Karamatovna K. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 42, is married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. Bunafsha is involved in agriculture. She has more than 5 years experience of growing vegetables. She has a small plot of land near her house where she grows vegetables for her family and for sale at the local market. Currently, she needs money to purchase new seedlings and chemical fertilizers. That is why she decided to apply for a loan. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кахорова Бунафша Кароматовна жительница района Шахринав . Возраст 42, она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Бунафша занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 5 лет. При доме она имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи для семьи и для продажи на местном рынке. В данный момент она хочет закупить саженцы и минеральные удобрения, для чего ей нужны деньги. Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Mujeres Necesitadas Group

texts.en:
Amada is a 50-year-old woman who lives in a secluded village called La 5 Casitas in the eastern province of Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. Two years ago, Amada started a small business selling arepas (a sweet bread), corn and other snacks. Since her first loan, she has expanded her business to incluD. other needs of the community, such as shoes and slippers. Amada is requesting this loan to buy larger amounts of flour, oil, sugar and other ingredients to meet customer demand.

She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable in order to proviD. her and her family with a sustainable income. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International and from Amada herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Sonrisa Village Bank.

She is married, is 30 and has 2 children. Vilma produces silver and gold jewelry with her husband and sells this jewelry in a craft market stall.

She helps her husband with the joins and the alterations and also has a stall in the same market where she sells scarves, pullovers, wallets she purchases from the producers. On Saturdays and Sundays, she is a mobile CD woman in a central street of the city.

Vilma needs a loan of 2400 soles ($875 USD) to buy silver and gold.

She dreams about having her own store and her own house. She wants her children to be professionals.

loans.use: Vilma needs a loan to buy silver and gold.

loans.name: Boturali

texts.ru:
Boturali U. lives in the city of Yavan. He works Daewoo as a driver. He is married and has one child. He lives with and supports his parents. He has a small farm on which he raises cattle. He has found out that it is possible to obtain a credit through Kiva and decided to use this opportunity to get money to purchase a calf. This will help him increase the amount of cattle he owns and increase the size of profit brought in by his business. He plans to repay the loan within the 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Умаров Ботурали житель города Яван. Рботает в ДЭУ , водителем . Женат и имеет одног ребенка. Кроме того живет сродителями . Живу хорошо и дружно. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит животных. Узнал про то , что есть возможность получить кредит и решил купить бычка через получение кредита. Это поможет ему увеличить поголовье скота и получить дополнительную прибыль. А погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is an entrepreneur from the small town of Korolyovo. She owns a nice little store selling souvenirs and gifts. Erika makes a good profit and always has many clients as there is little competition in the area. Erika has been in this sphere of trade for about 5 years. Presently, she is getting about US$ 1000 in income. Over US$ 10,000 is invested in inventory.

One of the most positive characteristics of her venture is stability. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has added much to growing the sustainability of her enterprise. Today Erika is hoping to get a 3000 Grivna loan to increase the assortment of merchandise and earn extra profit as a result. The loan will be a big help to Erika as she is a widow and has to rely on herself alone in terms of providing a decent living.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta.

Alejandra es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Alejandra viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa, abarrotes, frutas, pollo y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, sus ventas en algunas oportunidades son al crédito, Alejandra de las ferias compra cereales, queso, animales menores, que luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho al por mayor a los comerciantes.

Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz, arveja, haba. Alejandra sueña con comprar un carro para trasladar sus productos, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the communal bank “La Kantuta”.

Alejandra is married, 39 years old and has three children. Alejandra travels to the different markets in the region where she sells clothes, groceries, fruit, chicken and any items requested by her customers. She sometimes sells her products on credit. From the markets, Alejandra purchases cereals, cheese, and small animals which she then transports to the city of Ayacucho where she sells them to wholesalers at the market.

Alejandra needs a loan of 2,000.00 soles, funds that she will invest into buying wheat, corn, peas, and beans.

Alejandra’s dreams include acquiring a car to use in transporting her products, seeing her children complete their educations and expanding her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alejandra needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in the purchase of wheat, corn, peas and beans.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: V. Tamara is 54 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. She asks for a 2500 Somoni (750 USD) loan with the term of 9 months in order to buy more young cattle to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Nueva Victoria Nº 143, estudio el tercer grado de secundaria.
Tiene 42 años  y es madre de 6 hijos que están estudiando, es casada, su esposo le ayuda en su negocio de venta de comida. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro insumos para seguir preparando viandas (comida). Tiene casi 7 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad sigue con esta actividad económica  que le genera ingresos para cumplir con sus pagos regularmente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 meses comprara arroz, azúcar, fideos, carne y otros.

 “Es una buena ayuda para las mujeres que no tenemos facilidades para obtener un préstamo” manifiesta muy agradecida  Lourdes

Su  gran deseo es salir adelante para irse de Juli y abrir un Restaurante en Puno.
texts.en:
Mrs. María belongs to "Banco Comunal "Inmaculada Concepción" of the district of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Puno. She lives in Jr. Nueva Victoria No. 143, and studied third grade, secondary. She is 42 years old and the mother of 6 school-going children, she is married and her husband helps at her business selling food. With the first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, she bought raw material in order to continue the food production. She has been working with the bank for almost 7 years.

Presently this economic activity is generating earnings so she can fulfill her payments regularly. With this loan of S/.2000.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, meat and others.

"This is a good support for the women that don't have facilities to obtain a loan", says a grateful María Lourdes. It is her wish to be successful so she can move from Juli and open a restaurant in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material: rice, noodles, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny M. is president of a village bank of 14 members who all live in Trapang Samroung village in Kampong Chhnang province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ny M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problE. with her plantation, because her field is infertile and is badly affecting her crop. To deal with this problE., Mrs. Ny M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Oam Thaok, is a construction worker who makes a little income to support the family. Mrs. Ny M. is 53 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school.

One of the group members, Mrs. Ran K., could not be present for the picture, so her husband is presented instead.  

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest  have monthly payment loans. These thirteen members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term ( EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: N. Christine sells used clothes by moving around to the daily markets in and around Kayunga, Mukono, and Jinja, Uganda. She is a married woman with 5 children of her own and 2 more children in her care. She sells mostly ladies skirts and blouses, nets, and children’s wear and previous loans have been helped her to increase her clothing inventory. As a result of using loans, Christine has been able to buy herself a plot of land, care for her parents, and buy two cows with the hope that they will produce and give her more milk.

loans.use: More ladies', children and men's clothes in a bale for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Bertha V. P., tiene 42 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 5to de primaria, dejo los estudios porque se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene 04 hijos de los cuales solo 01 depende de ella económicamente.
Rosa tiene un Internet, se inicio en el negocio vendiendo pan, con las ganancias que obtuvo empezó a vender ropa y luego amplio su negocio instalando un Internet, el cual le da muchas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en un local que ella alquila.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y mantenimiento de sus computadoras.
Rosa sueña con tener su casa propia y un carro.
texts.en:
Rosa Bertha V. P. is 42 years old and lives in the La Rinconada residential zone of the district and province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed the fifth year of primary school before leaving her studies because she was more inclined to work. She has four children, although only one is still economically dependent on her. Rosa runs an internet business. She started out selling bread, and with her earnings she was able to start selling clothing, and later expand her business by installing an internet service. This business brings in a lot of income, and she runs it from a rented storefront. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the “Mujeres Decididas II” (Determined Women II) Community Bank she bought clothing for her business. With this loan of 2500 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in more clothing and the maintenance of her computers. Rosa dreams of owning her own home and car.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing merchandise and maintain her computers

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula S. habita en el barrio los cocos ubicado hacia carretera la concepción junto a su hija, ella es madre soltera, desde hace veinticinco  años se dedica al comercio a la venta de comida y por las tardes la señora hace y vende tortilla , ella lleva siete financiamiento con Afodenic y ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida ; hasta tiene una venta la cual recientemente estableció en su hogar .Doña Paula con este octavo crédito va a incrementar su inventario ya que ella vende solo tres veces por semana comida y ahora la venta van a ser diarias el cual va comprar carnes, verduras y granos básicos para preparar los ricos alimentos el cual espera que sus ventas sean mayores y con mejores ganancias. A Futuro espera que su pulpería sea mas grande en inventario.
texts.en:
Paula S. lives with her daughter in the Los Cocos neighborhood near the La Concepcion highway. She is a single mother. For twenty five years she has sold meals. In the afternoons she makes and sells tortillas. She has had seven loans with Afondenic and has been able to improve her living conditions. Recently she has even set up to sell from her home. With this eighth loan Paula will increase her inventory. Up until now she has only sold meals three times a week, but with this loan she will sell daily. She will buy meat, vegetables and basic grains to prepare the delicious food which she hopes will increase her sales and earnings. She hopes to increase the selection in her mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, grains and vegetables

loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en:
Dorothy N. is a member of Budumbuli group in Jinja. She is a business woman selling fresh matooke in the Budumbuli trading center, her home area.

This is the eigth loan she is taking from Pearl Microfinance and she is grateful that with the loans, she has been able to increase stock and have great yields, both from the farmers she buys from as well as from trucks loaded with matooke.

She has been able to save over time and as a result, she bought a plot of land which she didn’t expect to achieve so fast. She is a farmer, though on a small scale. of maize, ground nuts and plantains and she hopes to increase the yield if she can access more land for farming.

loans.use: Buy more matooke to sell and land for agriculture.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en: M. Annet, 43, is a married woman with 4 children, all in school. She has a business selling spare parts for generators, boda bodas (bicycle taxis) and other machinery. As she has been in the business for long time, with few competitors, she has been able to supply a large customer base. The loans help her to purchase more spare parts to sell. She has also been able to start up a poultry farm using her savings. She keeps both broilers and laying hens and she has plans to expand this business further. After paying back her loan easily, she needs another one to be able to stock more spare machinery parts and to purchase feed for her chickens. She is a member of the Nkokonjeru model group.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feed and spare motor parts for her shop.

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 32 years old and married with two children. She sells drinks at retail to her customers. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye N., 47 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois à Vélingara depuis 05 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus et de café. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ndèye N., age 47, is married and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group in Vélingara for five years. Her work involves selling cloth and coffee. She wants to bolster her commerce to do better in supporting her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and coffee

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita vive con su esposo el señor Ariel y su familia esta integrada por dos hijos en edad escolar. Ella labora para una guardería en el área de pedagogía, su esposo trabaja en una institución médica en el departamento de conservación desde hace 20 años. 
Ellos le han ido realizando poco a poco mejoras a su casita pero el proyecto que tienen  en este momento es la colocación del vitropiso, y por esta razón es que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Juanita lives with her husband Ariel and their 2 school-aged children. She works as a teacher in a daycare and her husband has worked in the Conservation Department of a medical institution for the last 20 years. They have slowly been making improvements to their small home and their current project is buying and laying floor tile, which is the reason they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: floor tile

loans.name: Fransica

texts.en: Fransica is a 33-year-old single woman with no children. She has a retail business selling drinks to her customers. Fransica is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Elia Nancy Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Elia Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera  y tiene 02 hijos. No tiene estudios y vive en el Jr. Grau.

Es socia nueva, ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de alimentos y requiere de un préstamo de S/ 500 soles, piensa comprar arroz, aceite, chuño, papa, etc. 
Su deseo es continuar trabajando. A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Elia Nancy belongs to the “Medalla Milagrosa” Community Bank in the district of Pomata, province of Chucuito, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 47-year-old single mother of two children. She doesn't have any formal education and lives on Grau street. She is a new member to her community bank. Elia Nancy makes a living selling food outdoors and is requesting a loan of 500 soles (approximately $175), which she plans to use to purchase rice, oil, potato flour and potatoes. Her goal is to keep working. Elia Nancy enjoys the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, potato flour and potatoes

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a cheerful, welcoming woman whom I met last week while she was serving lunch at the house for which she and her family are the caretakers.  Norma has a variety of business ventures.  On Sundays, she sells barbecued meats from her home in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa.  She hopes to invest this loan of 1000 soles in used clothing, which she will exchange for food grown in the small communities along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Norma will then sell these agricultural products in Pucallpa.

Norma and her family (her husband and their two daughters, aged 15 and 24) are the caretakers for a home and office building near the center of the city of Pucallpa.  They live there during the week.  Norma serves lunch in her kitchen every weekday to a variety of regular customers.  Norma's husband works as a regional representative for a security company.  

Norma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for more than eight years.  She has used past loans to purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials.  Norma used to do clothing repairs and sew undergarments and children's clothing.  She has not been able to engage in this work recently due to an eye operation but hopes to begin again by September, at which time her eye is expected to be fully healed.  

Norma very much appreciates her loans from Manuela Ramos.  She told me that these loans help women to become independent, and to feel that they are strong and are contributing to society.  With the establishment of their own businesses, women no longer have to wait for their husbands' paychecks.

Norma's goal is to keep working in order to continue paying for her youngest daughter's education.  She wants to enable her daughter to go to college and have a professional career.  She also wants to be able to do some repair work on her house.  Norma is pictured here in her kitchen, where she had been preparing lunch for that day's customers.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to exchange for food to sell

loans.name: Jackeline Argentina

texts.es: Doña Jackeline M. de 31 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de fritanga y rifas el cual hace ambulante y es cansado ya que aun no logra tener un local fijo ,  lleva tres años en las ventas, logro ponerlo con liquidación de su trabajo anterior en la zona franca, casada  y con dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, su esposo vende verduras en los departamentos, y reside en el barrio Raspan Norte en la capital de Managua, sus anhelo es poder terminar de hacer su casa ya que es de zinc y sus servicio es de letrina, lo cual desea darle a su familia una mejor vida, con seguridad de tener una vivienda mejor y un servicio higiénico. Con este préstamo instalara las aguas negras para instalar un inodoro  y hacer el arranque de su casa hasta donde ajuste. Da las gracias a la institución ya que traerá alegría  a sus hijos y mejores condiciones higiénicas.
texts.en:
Jackeline M. is 31 years old. She runs a fast food business, offering her products from a push cart. She finds it very tiring work and she has not managed to find a fixed location. She has been selling for the last 3 years. She established herself with the serverance pay she received from her past employment. She is married, and has two children of 2 and 5 years of age. Her husband sells vegetables to stores. She lives in the Raspan Norte district of the capital city Managua. Her goal is to finish building her house, especially to finish installing the bathroom. She wishes to provide her family with a better life, with a safe home to live in and hygenic conditions. With this loan she will have the sewer built to put in place a bathroom and invest the rest in the renovations. She is grateful to the organization, especially because all this will bring happiness inthe her children's lives, and will provide them with hygenic living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a sewer and install a bathroom.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
"Lonise S. (0) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitoloa.  She is married and has 5 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Lonise owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Lonise has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 850 WST a month from these activities.

Lonise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lonise has successfully repaid a previous loan of 300 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Lonise is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Lonise plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: payer du labour

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia, 49, is rice farmer.  Her crop is starting to grow and she needs to ensure a good harvest.  She requests a loan of Php 6,000 for farm inputs, like fertilizer.  Eugenia is a new member of CEV and is thankful for a loan opportunity.

loans.use: Enhance harvest.

loans.name: Tytus

texts.en:
S. is a 25-year-old married father of three daughters, who are between the ages of three and nine. He has run his tailoring business, Lady B House of Creation, for 11 years and earns extra income selling cereals. He says that he has built a good base of reliable clients and would like to employ many as he expands the business. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy material, thread, and a sewing machine. He hopes to be able to build a home and buy a car in the future. He describes himself as keen, humble, and courageous.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric, thread and purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nheurng

texts.en:
Mrs. Nheurng K. is a villager in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is far from an irrigation system and the soil is not very fertile. Thus, Mrs. Nheurng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine, fertilizer, and pesticides to support her farm. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's standard of living. She is a 40-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is a driver while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 27 years old and runs a shop selling women's clothing. She has been in this business for three years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of Kes. 50,000 in order to add stock for sale during the upcoming festive holiday season.

Jane describes herself as a very hardworking, honest, and ambitious businesswoman. She has learned to run her business properly through taking training at Faulu.

In the future, she hopes to own her own home, learn to drive a car, and have children.

loans.use: To add inventory for sale during the upcoming holiday season

loans.name: Saoud

texts.en: Saoud is a 43-year-old married woman with five children. To help her husband in the household, she decided to work from home as a tailor to earn extra money for the family. Today, in order to provide good tailoring services for her clients, Saoud is asking to borrow $1000 to buy a new sewing machine instead of the used one.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla sells clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 31 years-old and married with four children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She is a hard working and faithful woman.  Priscilla is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa Maria C. esta agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindo ya que ella ha visto resultados  satisfactorios en su negocio desde que se le dio su primer crédito, observo  el cambio económico  ya que ha ido prosperando poco a poco . Este crédito lo quiere para comprar mas mercancía para su tienda llamada “Estanquillo Rosa” que ya tiene 18 años de estar establecido y para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener mas ganancias quiere comprar mercancía nueva para que su clientes encuentren lo que buscan y se vallan satisfechos por las compras.
texts.en:
Rosa María C. is grateful for the help she has received in that she has seen satisfactory results in her business since she got her first loan. She noted a change in her economy in that she has been making progress little by little. This loan will be used to buy more stock items for her store, called "Estanquillo Rosa," which has been in business now for 18 years and to improve her quality of life having higher profits to buy new merchandise so that her customers will find what they are looking for and leave satisfied with their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Ms. Mariama D., aged 47, has been a member of the Moda Kone branch of UIMCEC for many years and is now on her sixth loan from the institution.  She lives in the Concorde neighborhood of Thies, a city about 50 miles from the capital Dakar.

Ms. D. has two very different small businesses: selling fabrics and raising chickens.  She began selling fabrics about five years ago, she says, as she saw a demand among her neighbors and friends.  The chicken business she began more recently.  Raising chickens can be quite profitable and Ms. D. takes the business seriously, working with a professional veterinarian to insure the health of her flock.

With the loan of 250,000 FCFA, she will purchase 150 chicks and the necessary feed to raise them to full grown chickens  Ms. D. is married and the mother of four.

loans.use: Buying chicks

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is business oriented; with her last Kiva loan she rented a shop and bought more foodstuffs and sachet water (water in plastic bags) in addition to her ice-cube production. She has been in this business for a long time.

Blessing has three children and she is 33 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She is very determined to lift her family out of poverty and wants to make more money so that she can build her own house. She wants her children to have a very bright future by giving them the best education.

Blessing hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and sachet water to sell. She duly appreciates all Kiva lenders who would be providing her with this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional timbers for sale

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Pedro José R. I., tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una comunidad rural llamada Sirama Sur, él habita con sus padres, trabaja para la Alcaldía de este municipio desde hace dos años, en la casa de sus padres es el único ingreso que percibe su familia.

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de algunos artículos de necesidad que s le están presentando en su hogar.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los dos anteriores fueron para hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
This young man is Pedro José R. I.. He is 27 years old, single, and lives in the rural community of Sirama Sur. Pedro lives with his parents and has been working for the municipality for two years. This is the only source of income that his family receives.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a few necessary items that will be used in his home. He has received three loans from CEPRODEL. His two previous loans were used for improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furnishing for his home (stove, bed, and television)
