loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is a wife of A. M. and they both live in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. They are both very hardworking. They work to manage the financial expenses of their family. Razia makes artificial flowers whereas her husband performs his duties as a mason. They both use their incomes to pay for utilities and their children's educational expenses. They are parents of three children – two sons and one daughter – and they want to raise them with a good education. Razia is applying for a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband so that he is better able to do his job and will not have to rent the tools.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has been in the motorcycle transportation business for the last four years, operating in Naivasha town. He is 28 years old, is married to Eunice Wangari, and they have one school-going child.

Michael was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to add the proceeds of the loan to what he has saved to buy a new motorcycle. He will employ someone else to operate it for him.

Michael plans to grow in the transportation business and his future plan is to buy and operate a taxi in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda G. is a 60 year old widow who supports her family by selling fish and oysters. She lives in Catali Barangay Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 6 children. The children are between the ages of 27 and 38 years old, some of them already have their own families. 

Florenda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, selling fish and oysters, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Florenda is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can continue her business of selling of fish and oysters. This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Florenda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a son. She lives and works in Novaya Kahovka, Kherson region. She sells sportswear in one of the local markets of her home town. She began this business 10 years-ago. Her business has grown to 30,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital and her income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Svetlana has a reputation as a goal-oriented, hard-working, but pleasant merchant. She enjoys her work and is known to respond to economic opportunity. Svetlana is seeking a loan of 14,400 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of sports clothing for further retail sale at her kiosk at affordable prices.  This will attract customers and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase sportswear.

loans.name: Aftandil

texts.en:
Aftandil R. is 30 years old and an internally displaced person from Djabrail town, in the Kharabakh region. He now lives in Absheron region with his parents. He is not married. 

Two years ago Aftandil took out his first loan to buy a second cow. Since then, his dairy business has expanded to include five cows, three of whom are offspring of the original two. Aftandil is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN to buy an additional cow. He’d like to expand his small business. Currently, he provides fresh milk and yogurt to his neighbors and local stores, a natural alternative to prepackaged dairy products. 

Aftandil's other job is doing construction work. He hopes that by expanding his dairy business he will be able to dedicate himself full time to his cows.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio D. Sr. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. He is 56 years old. Rogelio is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Rogelio owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rogelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rogelio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres la zona Santa Barbara de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Mauricio trabaja como chofer y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de una habitación y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mauricio is single and lives with his parents in the Santa Barbara zone of La Paz. He works as a driver and maintains his home with his earnings. He will use the money from this loan for home repairs so that he can improve his quality of life. This is the second occasion of him requesting a loan and our analysis of his socioeconomic status qualifies him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo Nueva Vida, integrado por diez mujeres cada una con expectativas y metas diferentes pero todas con deseos de salir adelante y luchar cada día, ellas se sienten bien formando parte del grupo. Actualmente radican en la comunidad de Chalco, Estado de México.

Ella es Edith R. R. de 53 años de edad (la de sudadera azul marino)  tiene un hijo de 22 años quien actualmente trabaja ya que no pudo continuar con sus estudios por falta de ingresos en su hogar solo ellos dos son quienes se ayudan ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Edith es una persona que siempre ha tenido que trabajar para poder salir adelante y así poder comprar sus medicamentos ya que ella padece de bronquitis asmática pero eso no le impide seguir luchando. Edith se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza como fibras, escobas, en su casa y también a la venta de ropa y zapatos (de 2ª mano) en los tianguis que están cerca de su comunidad, coloca sus mantas para exhibir la ropa, en ocasiones le afectan las lluvias ya que es cuando menos vende, pero sus días de mayor venta son los fines de semana, trata de surtir su mercancía cada tercer día para poder tener variedad. Con el crédito solicitado ella podrá comprar un poco mas de ropa para su negocio al igual que sus productos de limpieza, sus planes son poder construir una pequeña accesoria en su domicilio y que su hijo pueda retomar sus estudios nuevamente y así tener un mejor futuro. 

Los integrantes de este grupo son:  
Virginia Mejía Gutiérrez (Albañilería)Representante del grupo
Edith R. R. (la señora de la historia- venta de productos de limpieza y ropa de segunda mano)
María Trinidad J. Benítez (Venta de Artículos Domésticos)                           
Fabiola Benítez J. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)
Irma Godínez T. (Venta de Antojitos)                        
Guly Gema Méndez Z. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)    
Irma Hernández C. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)       
Gloria Hernández C. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)
Maximina P. S. (Venta de Abarrotes) 
Roció Hernández Sánchez (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)

El grupo esta muy agradecido por haber recibido el crédito de Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad.
texts.en:
This group is called Nueva Vida ("New Life"), and it is made up of ten women, each of them with different goals and expectations, but all of them with the desire to get ahead and work hard each day. They are happy to be part of this group. They are currently headquartered in the community of Chalco, in the State of México. This borrower is Edith R. R., age 53 (the one in the navy blue sweatshirt). She has a daughter who is 22 and currently working, since she could not continue her studies due to a lack of income in the household. They only have each other for support, since Edith does not receive support from her partner. Edith is a person who has always had to work to get ahead and to buy her medicines, since she suffers from asthmatic bronchitis, but this does not stop her from continuing to work hard. Her business is selling cleaning products such as brooms and fibers out of her home, and also selling secondhand clothing and shoes at the markets near her community. She lays out blankets to display the clothes. At times her business is affected by rain and she sells less. Her best sales days are the weekends. She tries to stock new merchandise every three days so she can offer variety to her customers. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a little more clothing for her business, along with cleaning products. Her plans for the future are to construct a small extra room in her home and to see her daughter return to her studies so that she can have a better future. The other members of this group are: María Trinidad J. Benítez (Home products sales) Fabiola Benítez J. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Irma Godínez T. (Snacks sales) Guly Gema Méndez Z. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Irma Hernández C. (Shoe sales by catalog) Virginia Mejía Gutiérrez (Mason), Group representative Gloria Hernández C. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Maximina P. S. (Grocery store) Roció Hernández Sánchez (Shoe sales by catalog) The group very much appreciates receiving the loan from Kiva through the Realidad Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying secondhand clothing and shoes as well as cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A. is from the village of Manaring. She is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $67 a month from this activity

In 2009, Margie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the wife of M. A. and she resides in a city called Multan, which is famous for its shrines and sweetmeats, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years.
 
A 40-year-old lady with a happy nature, Nasreen stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother very well. She has given birth to three daughters. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school and read in 5th, 4th and 2nd standards respectively.
 
Nasreen’s husband is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at his home from which he gets milk and sells it to different milk shops. He has been doing this work for over 10 years. With this business, he has been able to enroll his daughters into school.
 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy another buffalo and increase the milk production of his business.
 
Nasreen is hopeful that this investment will bring a positive change to her husband’s business and her family will be able to live in a far better position. This is the first time she has applied for a loan from any microfinance institution (MFI) and she wants to build a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose A., 38. She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo A., a construction foreman, and is the mother of four elementary-aged children, all of whom are currently enrolled this year. By the grace of God, Rose has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send them all the way through college -- a dream for most Filipino parents like Rose as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Rose operates a food stall while doing sideline work as a manicurist. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only the usual family tradition but is also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use up cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands (prepared dishes) cost less than raw food. She also generates income from manicure and pedicure services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients for her food business and other materials needed for her manicure and pedicure services. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rose dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food business and other materials needed for her pedicure and manicure service

loans.name: Giovanna Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Giovanna del Rosario S. Z., tiene la edad de 43 años habita en el populoso Barrio Laureles Sur, lugar de conocido record de delincuencia, y escasos recursos de sus habitantes, habita acompañada por su pareja de vida, el cual trabaja como mecánico, tienen dos hijos menores de edad el cual el mayor se dedica  a la los estudios de la secundaria y el pequeño está actualmente en preescolar, pronto la mayor entrara a la universidad para realizar los estudios de su carrera profesional, estos planes son de prioridad para sus padres puesto que desean apoyar a su hija a  forjar su camino profesional, ella vende reposterías, y cosméticos, desde hace mas de 8 años, fue con sus recursos de ahorro que logro comenzar a laborar en esta actividad, ellos habitan en una humilde morada y es para su negocio que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de  materiales de construcción que le admitan reparar el baño principal del hogar, y de esta forma ofrecerle a sus hijos una vivienda digna donde desarrollarse en un ambiente cómodo, salubre y seguro con la finalidad de la tranquilidad de  los padres. 
Este no es el primer ciclo de la señora S., con los diferentes prestamos que se le han otorgado, ha mejorado de manera significativa su hogar, trayéndoles mejores condiciones económicas para todos los miembros de la familia, y es para nosotros un orgullo el ayudar de esta manera a toda una familia de valores responsables y emprendedores.
texts.en:
Giovanna del Rosario S. Z. is 43 years old and lives in the populated neighborhood of Laureles Sur, known for its delinquency record and its peoples’ scarce resources. She lives together with her life partner who works as a mechanic. They have two young children, the older of which is in high school and the younger is in preschool. Their older child will be starting college soon to begin studying for her professional degree. These plans are a priority for them as parents because they want to support their daughter in her career path. She has been selling baked goods and cosmetics for the past 8 years and was able to begin working in the business with her savings.

She lives with her family in a humble home and is requesting the loan for the purchase of construction materials to be able to repair the main bathroom in their house. This way, she will be able to provide her children with a decent home where they can grow in a comfortable, healthy, and safe environment and she and her partner can live calmly.

This is not Ms. S.’s first loan cycle. With the different loans that she has been granted, she has improved her house significantly and brought better economic conditions to all of the family members. We are proud to help an entire responsible and enterprising family in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to the main bathroom in the house

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa M. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del sur. She is 50 years old. Felipa is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Felipa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Mujeres en Desarrollo esta ubicado en la Aldea Santa Cruz de la ciudad de Choluteca, lo integran 4 mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y dedicadas a sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan;

la señora Olga Sofia P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio se encuentra en un lugar de facil acceso para la mayoria de personas que viven en su misma aldea, esto hace que sea muy visitado y que sus ingresos sean buenos ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que tambien es comerciante, juntos se ayudan en todos los gastos del hogar.

la señora Cecilia C. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad.
sus clientes son personal que trabaja en la Azucarera la Grecia, les entrega las tortillas por encargo todos los dias y tambien abastece a la mayoria de personas que viven en su comunidad.
Cecilia cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para sacar adelante su familia.

la señora Felicidad M. se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, vende su producto en la comunidad donde reside y fuera de la misma, Felicidad se levanta todos los dia a las 4 de la mañana para salir a tiempo con el producto y luego venderlo,  tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y el se dedica a la  agricultura y esto hace que sus ingresos sean muy buenos.

la señora Alba P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio es bien visitado por personas vecinas a su casa y personas que trabajan en las meloneras.
Alba trabaja muy fuerte para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, es una mujer muy honrada, seria 
y de buenos principios morales.

el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de materiales y mercaderias para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Women in Development group is located in the village of Santa Cruz in the city of Choluteca. It consists of four women who are very hardworking and dedicated to their families. The different activities they perform are detailed below:

Mrs. Olga Sofia P. is dedicated to the sale of dairy products and has a small grocery store in her home. Her business is in a location easily accessible to most people in her village, which explains the large number of customers. Since her income is good she has the support of her husband who is also a businessman. They help each other manage all household expenses.

Mrs. Cecilia C. is dedicated to the production and sale of tortillas, and has been performing this type of activity for several years. Her customers are employees working in La Grecia sugar factory. Every day she delivers tortillas on request and also supplies the majority of people living in their community.
Cecilia has the support of her husband in helping their family make progress.

Mrs. Felicidad M. is dedicated to the sale of nacatamales (a large variety of tamal typical of Honduras), selling her products in the community where she lives and outside of it. Felicidad gets up every day at 4 am to leave on time with her products and then sells them. She too has the support of her husband who is a farmer. As a result their joint income is quite good.

Mrs. Alba P. is dedicated to the sale of dairy products and has a small grocery store in her home. Her business is well attended by people in the surrounding area and people working in the melon plantations.
Alba works very hard to bring a better quality of life to her family. She's a very honest woman, serious-minded and with sound moral principles.

The loan will be used to purchase materials and goods for their businesses.

loans.use: purchase of wood, lime, sugar, yeast, corn, chicken, soft drinks, rice, butter, oil, beans, toilet paper, juice, sardines, pasta, soups, sausages, dairy products, milk, eggs, soaps, cakes, candles, matches , batteries, margarine,

loans.name: Jorge Fabian

texts.es:
Jorge de 29 años, es taxista informal, vive al lado del estero de Guayaquil en una casa caña ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. 

Desde muy pequeño le gusto andar en vehículos particulares, pero con ayuda de su padre pudo comprar un carro para convertirlo en taxi informal y poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 4 años. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm recorriendo las calles de todo Guayaquil. Unos de los inconvenientes es trabajar en las noches debido al índice muy elevado de la delincuencia. 

Para seguir trabajando en su carro el quiere comprar unos repuesto y otra parte del préstamo utilizarla para comprar cemento, arena, piedras para construir mejor su casa ya que es de caña. En el futuro quiere tener su casa ubicada en otro lugar ya que viven en la orilla del estero y tiene miedo que pueda derrumbarse.
texts.en:
Jorge, 29, is an informal taxi driver.  He lives beside Guayaquil’s estuary in a cane stalk house located along Guayaquil’s beltway.

Since he was a little boy he enjoyed riding in private automobiles and with help from his father he was able to buy a car to turn into an informal taxi to support his wife and two children who are 2 and 4 years of age.  He currently works from 7am until 10pm driving along all of Guayaquil’s streets.  One of the inconveniences has to do with working at night because of the very high crime rate.

To continue working in his car he needs to buy some replacement parts and the other part of the loan will be used to buy cement, sand and gravel to improve his house’s construction because it’s made from cane stalks.  In the future he’d like to have a house located somewhere else because they currently live alongside the estuary and he fears it might collapse.

loans.use: For replacement parts, cement and sand.

loans.name: Isan

texts.ru: Назиров Исан проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын на заработках в России. Сам Исан имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Арендует помещение, в котором открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Isan N. lives in Shahrituz. He is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  His wife is a housewife. His son works in Russia.  Isan has a secondary education.  He has been working in sales for more than five years. He rents a space in which he has opened a grocery shop. He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Edgar Hernan

texts.es:
Edgar Hernan R. S. tiene 38 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Edgar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edgar Hernan R. S. is 38 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has one child.

The 'El Batan' solidarity group is located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group has 21 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing cacao, cassava and corn.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Edgar has been growing cacao, cassava and corn for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells them in Chillanes market and in the district.

Edgar is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cacao crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in weather.  His dream is to continue working.

He likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cacao crops

loans.name: Tayangatane Group

texts.en:
Rukia K. is in her mid-fifties and married with 5 grown-up children.  She runs two businesses, selling fried fish, fruits and vegetables.  She has been in these businesses for two years now.  She works from 5:00am to 8:00pm daily and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's 6th loan from Tujujenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to increase her business stock and make bricks.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes to use her new loan to make more bricks and build the foundation of her house. Rukia's dream is to have her own house.

Rukia will share her loan with her loan group Tuyangatane, which has 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other responsible in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Rukia is in front, wearing a blue dress and holding a white bag.

loans.use: To make more bricks and build her house foundation

loans.name: Mrs. Mut Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people from Prey Robang village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan.  The members have selected Mrs. Mut N. as the village bank president.  The members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Mut N. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Roeung Seng, is a door-to-door toy seller.  With this business, he is able to earn some money to support his family. 

Mrs. Mut N. is having problems with her farm because her field has infertile soil and a lot of insects.  To improve production, Mrs. Mut N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.  With the remainder of the funds, she will buy more toys for her husband to sell.  

This couple supports five children, one is a laborer and  the others are students at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & pesticides, and buy toys to resell

loans.name: Magaly Salvadora

texts.es: Magaly Salvadora V. es una persona muy buena y umilde, es una persona que se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles o de consumo diario, ella vende huevos, frijol,arroz,maiz etc, y tambien se dedica a la venta de productos enlatados, ella dice que gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio,con su credito anterior logro creser un poco mas con su ganancia, y gracia a eso a ido aumentando sus ventas, solicita este credito para compra de producto comestibles, para asi aumentar un poco mas su ganancia y asi ofrecer mas bariedad de productos a sus clientes su sueño es tener un local mas grande y asi aumentar mas sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia agradese a fape y a kiva por la ayuda brindada
texts.en:
Magaly Salvadora V. is an outstanding and modest individual who sells food products for daily consumption such as eggs, beans, rice, corn, and other products. She also sells canned goods. Thanks to God, Magaly says her business has done very well. With her previous loan, she was able to earn a little bit more income due to an increase in her sales.

She is requesting this loan to buy food products so that she can generate slightly more revenue and offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. Her dream is to have a larger location so that she can increase her income and move her family forward with the support that FAPE and Kiva has provided.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, tiene 30 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja como profesora pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de pintado de platos de madera. Beatriz nos cuenta que compra platos de madera de los artesanos de la ciudad de Calca y después de pintarlos los distribuye a las tiendas del Centro Comercial Artesanal del Cusco. Beatriz forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en comprar platos de madera. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su negocio. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol).

Beatriz se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 30 years old, is single and lives in the city of Cusco. She works as a teacher but also has a small business painting wooden plates. She buys these plates from artisans in the city of Calca and after painting them she distributes them to shops at the Cusco Artisan Fair. Beatriz is part of the "Inti" Communal Bank of the Arariwa Assocation. She needs this loan to invest in buying more wooden plates. She has been working in this business for 10 years now and it has gone very well for her due to the hard work she puts in. 

(Inti is a word from the Quechua language which translates to Sun in English).

Beatriz is thankful for this opportunity afforded her and she is committed to making her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To invest in buying wooden plates.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a furniture business. She lives in Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her furniture business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 to fund operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Evelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Cicila

texts.en: Cicila is currently in a business of selling tomatoes, onions and soap. She is 34 years old, married to a pastor, and has three children, two of whom go to school. Cicila took out a loan to stock more tomatoes, onions and soap to sell. With extra profits from her business, Cicila hopes to open up a shop, buy land and construct a house in the future.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes, onions and soap.

loans.name: Cooperacion - Tambo Group

texts.es:
Lourdes L. C., 36 años D. edad, 02 hijos, conviviente; ella es secretaria D. la alcancìa comunal " Cooperaciòn - Tambo"
Lourdes vive en el distrito D. Huamancaca provincia D. Chupaca en Huancayo. Se dedica hace varios años a la venta D. menudencia D. pollo (alitas, patitas y vìceras) en el mercado modelo D. El Tambo; para llegar a su destino D. trabajo, Lourdes viaja diariamente 45 minutos desD. su casa.
Sus hijos estan en edad escolar y su esposo es chofer D. taxi, quien trabaja desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana  hasta muy entrada la noche.
El prèstamo solicitado serà para ampliar la lìnea D. sus ventas, comprarà otros productos afines a su giro para mejorar su negocio.
(En la fotografìa, Lourdes està vestida con chompa color negro, esta sentada y es la segunda D. la izquierda)
texts.en:
Lourdes L. C. is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She is secretary of the "Cooperaciòn - Tambo" community bank.

Lourdes lives in Huamancaca district, in Chupaca province, in Huancayo.  For several years she has been selling chicken wings, feet and internal organs in the 'Mercado Modelo' market in El Tambo.  In order to reach her work place, Lourdes travels from her home for 45 minutes every day.  Her children are school age and her husband is a taxi driver.  He works from very early in the morning until very late at night.  Lourdes will use her loan to expand the range of products she sells.  She will buy further related products in order to improve her business.

(In the photograph, Lourdes is wearing a black sweater.  She is sitting down, second from the left).

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis Güillín se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, calzado y mercancía en general mediante el sistema de pedidos; Denis tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 9 a 20 años y con sus esfuerzo  en esta actividad ha logrado sostenerlos y mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida.
Su actividad como comerciante la inició hace 20 años,  para apoyar el ingreso familiar que solo estaban a cargo de su esposo,hoy fallecido y también comerciante; así fue como Dennis se empeño en generar mas dinero para su hogar e inició vendiendo la  mercancía de él, a amigos y conocidos del sector hasta construír su propia clientela;   por eso cuando  esté falleció y dejó el legado comercial,  ella lo continuó y desde entonces ha ido extendiéndolo a otros mercados. Su sueño es adquirir una casa propia y continuar fortaleciendo su negocio, que es el sustento del hogar y que en el momento presenta una rentabilidad no menor de un 46%. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará  ropa, jeans, blusas, calzado y también  víveres, para adicionar un nuevo capital de trabajo y distribuir sus productos entre nuevos clientes,porque  finalmente  tiene el desafio de alcanzar su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Denis Güillín's business is selling clothes, footwear and general merchandise through an order system.  Denis has three children aged between 9 and 20  and, through her hard work in her business, she has managed to continually support them and improve their living conditions.

Denis started out as a saleswoman 20 years ago so that she could contribute to the family income which her husband had previously been solely responsible for.  Her husband, who was also a salesman, is now dead.  Denis worked hard to make more money for her household and started selling her husband's merchandise to friends and acquaintances in the neighborhood until she had built up her own customer base.  This meant that when her husband died and left her his business legacy she was able to continue it and, since that time, she has extended it into other markets.

Denis' dream is to acquire a house of her own and to continue strengthening her business which supports her household and which currently returns a profit of not less than 46%.

This is Denis' first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy clothes, jeans, blouses, footwear and also food products, to add new working capital and distribute her products to new customers so that she can finally achieve her dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jeans, blouses, footwear and also food products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Elizabeth is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & coconuts in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Isbelia

texts.es: Isbelia C. de 48 años y vive en el barrio Ciudadela metropolitana con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 18 años, allí en compañía de su familia tiene un negocio llamado : “ Taller de bicicletas Laurens” donde  ofrecen el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de bicicletas y venta de respuestos,  apoyada en esta actividad por su esposo y su hijo;  con este negocio suplen las necesidades básicas de su núcleo familiar y se sienten muy satisfechos de tener una unidad generadora de ingresos que sueñan con hacerla crecer con inyecciones se capital de trabajo  hasta convertirla en un punto de servicio especializado, confortable y atractivo para sus clientes. Su  mayor desafío es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para extenderse en el mercado, esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para solicitar un credikiva con el cual comprará mercancías para tener más inventarios,  como llantas moñonas, neumáticos rines, radios, cadenillas, guayas etc. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén donde ofrezca  también artículos para motos, diversificando su actividad con tal de obtener  una mayor utilidad que en la actualidad se encuentra en un % no menor de 30%
texts.en:
Isbelia C. is 48 years old and lives in the metropolitan neighborhood of Ciudadela with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 18. She and her family run a business called "Lauren's Bicycle Repair Shop", offering bicycle repair and maintenance services as well as spare parts. Her husband and son help her run the business, and they use the income to cover basic household expenses. 

She is happy to be generating an equal share of the family's income and dreams of expanding the business through a capital injection. Isabelia wants to build up her small repair shop as a well-equipped provider of specialty services. Her biggest challenge is lack of sufficient investment capital. This is why she is turning to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that will enable her to buy merchandise to restock her inventory of high-quality bicycle tire rims, replacement wheels, spokes, bicycle chains, and steel cables.

Eventually, Isabelia hopes to expand her inventory to include motorcycle parts. This will allow her to diversify her business activities and achieve a greater profit margin, which she currently believes is about 30%.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for restocking inventory of bicycle tire rims, replacement wheels, spokes, bicycle chains, and steel cables.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio tiene 44 años D. edad y vive en L. zona rural del distrito D. Lambayeque, en una pequeña comunidad D. 200 familias aproximadamente.

Aurelio es una persona amable y trabajadora.  Él da todo por su familia y  amigos. DesD. hace más D. 6 años Aurelio, se dio cuenta  que L. crianza y comercialización D. animales le daba los frutos que antes no había podido conseguir. Así que decidió criar ganado ovino en L. parte trasera D. su casa. Aurelio ya conoce a L. perfección este rubro pues vio a sus padres ejercerlo cuando él vivía con ellos. Además, cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto D. actividades relacionadas al jornal en agricultura.

Con L. comercialización D. sus animales y las labores agrícolas,  Aurelio logró ahorrar para las mejoras que poco a poco fue haciendo en su casa. Ahora Aurelio desea una renovación D. su techo y es por eso que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en L. compra D. planchas D. calaminas y tijerales que le permitirán tener una mejor construcción D. este.

Aurelio estaría muy agradecido D. concedérsele el crédito  pues le ayudaría a mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 44 years old and lives in the rural area of Lambayeque district, in a small community of 200 families.

Aurelio is a kind and hard-working person who gives his all for his family and friends.  More than six years ago, Aurelio realized that raising and selling animals provided him with rewards that he previously had not been able to achieve.  He therefore decided to raise sheep in an area behind his house.  Aurelio knows this business to perfection as he saw his parents carry out the same business when he used to live with them.  He also makes additional income from working as a day laborer on people's farms.

As a result of selling his animals and carrying out farm work, Aurelio managed to save up to make some improvements that he has gradually been carrying out on his home.  Now Aurelio would like to replace his roof.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will invest this money in buying corrugated metal sheets and trusses which will allow him to better build his roof.

Aurelio is very grateful for this loan as it will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to replace his roof

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two daughters. She is a private entrepreneur selling retail items, i.e. children’s clothing and footwear in small markets of the Kherson region where she is from. Tatyana started this enterprise eight years ago. Presently, she has over 20,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 6,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase 100 pairs of assorted children’s footwear. She likes working with this type of merchandise. She is ready to work hard to see her business grow and expand further.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pairs of children’s footwear.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott, aged 21, is married to Emily, and they are blessed with one child. He has been selling handcrafts for eleven years. The business earns him a monthly income of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to buy more handcrafts for resale. Scott intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his child and hopes to join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy handcrafts for sale

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is 20 years old and attends college.  

Ganbat manages a taxi service business in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2008. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I want to complete construction work of my house."  He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials for his house.

loans.use: buy construction material

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: Adelayda de 39 años, vive en el municipio de Somotillo, Allí tiene un negocio que es una pulpería. Su idea emprendedora surgió cuando decide invertir en este negocio por unos ahorros que tenia, persistente ha logrado que su actividad  crezca gradualmente hasta convertirlo en la fuente de ingresos con los que su familia cubre sus necesidades diarias. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo insuficiente para lograr hacer una compra de contado y obtener descuentos que incrementarían sus utilidades, esta es la razón por la cual recurren a un financiamiento para comprar productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, jugos y otros productos.
texts.en: 39 year old Adelayda lives in the town of Somotillo. She has a general store there. Her entrepreneurial idea arose when she decided to invest some savings that she had into this business. Her business has gradually grown until it has become the income source that her family uses to cover their daily expenses. Her greatest challenge is having insufficient working capital to buy supplies in cash and obtain the discounts that would increase her profits. This is the reason she has turned to a loan to buy products such as staple grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juices, and other products.

loans.use: buy dry goods, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juices, and other goods.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий разведен. Он малый предприниматель из Запорожья. Так как Запорожье в основном промышленный город, большинство людей здесь работают или на заводах или в торговле. Юрий – один из последних. Он занимается оптовой и розничной торговлей продуктами: яйцами, кондитерскими изделиями и т.д. Юрий имеет большой опыт работы и несколько своих торговых мест. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже около 9 лет. Юрий вложил в товар около 35.000 гривен. Его ежемесячный доход составляет около 11.000 гривен.  

Юрий планирует использовать кредит в 18.000 гривен с целью закупки большим оптом кондитерских изделий в Полтаве. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Юрий хотел бы запустить в работу новый прилавок, который почти готов к началу работы.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Yuriy is divorced.  He is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye.  Because Zaporozhye is primarily an industrial city, the majority of people here either work at factories or in retail.  Yuriy is one of the latter.  He is involved in wholesale and retail sales of food products, such as eggs, confectionery goods, etc.  Yuriy has extensive experience in this work and owns several retail outlet.  He has been involved in this business for almost nine years.  Yuriy invested about 35,000 hryvnia into the merchandise.  His monthly income amounts to approximately 11,000 hryvnia.  Yuriy plans to use the loan of 18,000 hryvnia to purchase a large set of confectionery goods in Poltava.  Having received the additional profit, Yuriy wants to put a new counter into production, which is almost ready to begin working.

loans.use: to purchase a large set of confectionary goods in Poltava

loans.name: Mayra Del Carmen

texts.es: Mayra se dedica a la venta de almuerzos en el barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Cartagena, donde vive con su hijo de 9 años, motor de todos sus esfuerzos por aumentar todos los días su bienestar. Mayra de lunes a sábados vende almuerzos y genera un empleo con su negocio, el cual se encuentra está ubicado en la terraza de su vivienda y se extiende a  sus vecinos del mismo barrio y hacia otros sectores aledaños. Sus compras las hace de contado y sus ventas también.  Como Mayra hace sus compras con una frecuencia diaria, sus gastos por transporte se incrementan y al cuando compra en bajos volúmenes no obtiene buenos descuentos,  circunstancias que  incrementan sus gastos de operación. Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para comprar en mayor volumen los productos que requiere para la preparación de sus comidas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con la cual comprará  arroz, aceite y materias primas en mayor volumen, para seguir creciendo porque su sueño es tener su propia vivienda y un restaurante bien estructurado y confortable, donde sus clientes se deleiten con la comida que Mayra prepara.
texts.en:
Mayra sells lunches in the city of Cartagena's San Francisco neighborhood where she lives with her 9-year-old son who is the motivating force behind her daily efforts to increase his wellbeing.

From Monday through Saturday Mayra sells lunches and generates one job through her business which is located on her terrace and which is aimed at her neighbors and nearby residents.  Her purchases and her sales too are cash.

Since Mayra makes purchases daily her transportation costs increase and purchasing small amounts makes her ineligible for discounts; both these circumstances increase her operating costs.  Her greatest challenge is the insufficiency of her working capital that does not allow her to buy large volumes of the products she needs to prepare her meals.

This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy rice, oil and raw materials in large volume to continue growing because her dream is to have a house of her own and a well-structured, comfortable restaurant where her customers can enjoy the food Mayra prepares.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and raw materials in larger amounts.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 47 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with three children.

Mario has a rice and corn mill business and earns approximately 30,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He had requested a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase 45 sacks of corn. Mario has been a member of PMPC since this year (2011). In the future, he hopes to expand his store.

loans.use: to purchase 45 sacks of corn

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor de 56 años quien se dedica a la venta de mercadería general entre los productos que comercializa están las almohadas, camisas, abanicos…etc. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años con unos cuantos productos y poco a poco fue creciendo.
El invertirá el crédito en blusas y electrodomésticos para seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmelo is a hardworking and entrepreneurial 56 year old man that sells merchandise, some of the products he sells are pillows, shirts, fans, etc.  This business was started 10 years ago with a few products and it slowly grew to more.  
He will invest the loan in shirts and electrical appliances to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electrical appliances

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a grocery-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry hot season the availability of vegetables for supply is lower compared to high demand. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Por un futuro Mejor está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por el cantón Paute, este cantón  es de clima templado lo cual es propicio para la floricultura y también se da una gran variedad de frutas. Su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura. En este cantón hay varios lugares turísticos, su gente es cálida y amable como nuestras socias, quienes son personas muy luchadoras y trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar económicamente y sacar  adelante a sus familias.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. Delia, vive por los alrededores del cantón Paute, tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del cantón. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Delia se dedica a la agricultura,  ella siembra papas y mellocos que los vende en el mercado del cantón, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo ya que labra sus propios terrenos. También se dedica a la cría de ganado, gallinas y chanchos. 

Este es el sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono.
 
Su sueño es comprarse un vehículo.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos del trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Por un Futuro Mejor” (For a Better Future) communal bank is formed by ten women who live in Paute Canton.  This is a canton with a mild climate that is apt for flower growing and also produces a great variety of fruit.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  There are several tourist attractions in this canton.  Its people are warm and kind like our members who are very hardworking people engaged in a variety of activities that make it possible for them to improve economically and support their families.

One of the group members is Delia.  She lives around Paute Canton.  She’s 24 years old, married and has three children who are 8, 5 and 1 year old.  Her two oldest children go to the local elementary school.  Her husband works in farming and the house they live in is their property.

Delia is a farmer.  She grows potatoes and “mellocos” [a tuber] that she sells in the canton’s market.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed work schedule since she works her own fields.  She also raises cattle, chickens and pigs.

This is the sixth loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she’s going to use it to buy seeds and manure.  Her dream is to buy herself a vehicle.

The small inserted photo is of one of the members who, because of work commitments, was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Dolores  Group

texts.en: Dolores is 44 years old and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 4 children. Dolores has a flower pot business, earning approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She has a requested loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase clay and materials for her business. Dolores has been a member of PMPC for 1 month. In the future, Dolores hopes to expand her business into the neighboring areas of Ozamiz.

loans.use: to purchase clay and materials for her flower pot business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 24 years old and has earned a living for the last 11 years by running a rental business in the town of Njambini. She is married and has two children. Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is now applying for her first loan. She plans to use the loan to renovate the  houses which she rents out. In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business by building larger houses.

loans.use: To renovate rental houses

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 50ans et le moins âgé a 35ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de bois de chauffe depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au secteur 28 Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter  un camion du bois de chauffe.

Mme veut acquérir son permis urbain d’habitation(P.U.H)  avec  économies. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haoua is a married mother of 5. The oldest is 50 and the youngest is 35. Nobody attends school. She takes care of 6 people.

She has been selling firewood for 10 years. She stocks up at sector 28 Ouagadougou. Her customers are her neighbors.

She wants to buy a firewood truck.

Mrs. Haoua wants to get her urban habitation permit (P.U.H.) with her savings. She hopes to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy a firewood truck

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Budiriro Group

texts.en:
Christina is 51 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged 31, 29, and 28 years old. They have all completed their school education. Her husband is a pensioner. She has two other dependents who stay with her. As additional income, she receives rentals from tenants who are renting other rooms at her house.

She buys and sells clothes and she operates from home. She takes clothes to customers' houses and sells them there. She does not have any employees who work for her, and she has been in business for 10 years. She faces the challenge of high import duties, and there is a limit on items imported. 

However, she has a vision of owning her own store and venturing into poultry in the next 5 years. With the profits from the business she will be able to save for her grandchildren's future and provide for their needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy materials and clothes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zambaonga del Sur. She is 24 years old. Alma is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Alma runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many other items. Alma has been in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Alma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gorret's Group

texts.en:
Gorret's group is comprises six hard-working women. Gorret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, She has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items to sell in her shop, and will help Gorret generate greater profits and pay her sister's school fees. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Gorret's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income by raising pigs. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Faleala

texts.en:
Faleala is forty-three years old and is married with five children. Faleala owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has many years of experience in this business. 

Faleala needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the business.

In 2009, Faleala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faleala's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril is a 57-year-old married man from Kamwenge, Uganda, who lives in a semi-permanent house. For the past 30 years he has been an agriculturalist who grows pineapples. He began with one acre of pineapples and currently he has four acres under cultivation. 

Cyril is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to transport his pineapples to market. His goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house, and buy a truck, since his major business difficulty is the high cost of transport.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport produce to market

loans.name: Zohra Group

texts.en:
Zohra is the age of 52, living in Lahore, Pakistan. Zohra is a married woman living with her husband, He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. 
He has been running a small furniture shop in a nearby town. He wants to sell furniture items like sofa, bed, chairs, tables, safes, etc. He is a good trained carpenter as well, so he makes different designed furniture items at his shop himself. 

People in his community like his furniture items very much. He sells furniture at very reasonable rates; that is why his number of customers is increasing rapidly. He wants to buy raw materials for his furniture making business. Therefore, Zohra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she hopes that the lenders will support her husband for his work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for furniture making business.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en: Morena is 45 years old married with no child. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She earns an income from her tutorial service. She started it almost four years ago and she earns 5,800 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she just join this year 2015 to buy additional books for her tutorial class. Her future plan is to expand her tutorial business.

loans.use: To buy additional books.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
30 years old, Mrs. Pauline A. had a difficult childhood due to the poverty of her parents. She abandoned her studies at an early age to learn sewing with the hopes of taking charge and helping our her parents. Today, she has her own store that she oversees with modesty and rigor. Married and a maother of two children, she also takes care of three other children [cousins]. She is in charge of all the cleaning, as her husband, employed at the airport, has an undesirable salary. In the hopes of improving revenues for her family, Mrs. A. recently added a small dry goods businesses to her store, as well as selling plastic objects (plates, glasses, etc). If she was able to obtain a loan in order to sell her things closer to the N\\\'kafu market, her business could be more profitable. Therefore, in order to increase her revenues, Mrs. A. is asking for a $1500 credit in order to buy a more sophisticated sewing machine, dry goods, and plastic objects to sell. The realization of this project would allow her to improve the work conditions of her three apprentices and the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 30 ans aujourd’hui, Madame A. Pauline a eu une enfance difficile à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents. Elle abandonna très tôt les études pour apprendre la couture en vue de se prendre en charge et aider ses parents. A ce jour, elle tient son propre atelier qu’elle gère avec modestie et rigueur. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle prend en charge trois (03) autres enfants de sa tante. Ce qui fait peser sur elle les charges du ménage car son mari, employé à l’aéroport, n’a qu’un salaire dérisoire. Dans le but d’améliorer ses revenus de la famille, Madame A. Pauline vient d’initier en plus de son métier, un petit commerce de mercerie et de vente d’objets en plastique (sceau, cuvette, assiette, gobelet…). Ces activités pourraient évoluer au mieux si elle disposait d’un fonds de crédit plus consistant car l’emplacement à proximité du marché de N’kafu un atout pour le développement de ses affaires. Ainsi, pour accroître et augmenter ses revenus, Madame A. Pauline sollicite un crédit de $1500 pour acheter une machine à coudre sophistiquée et acheter les articles de mercerie et les objets en plastic pour leur revente. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de travail de ses trois (03) apprenties et le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and dry goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify my business

loans.name: Alice Eni

texts.en:
Alice is one of two wives and a mother of eight children. The overwhelming school-related demands on her husband by her children and those of her maid was the irresistible appeal for her to engage in small commercial activities in 2004 despite her age and health.

This necessity and/or sympathy coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of previous loans are skills she will maximize in her current investment; retail. Given a loan of $500, Alice plans to buy and be a major supplier of palm oil, koki beans and onions to her community. She plans to repay her loan during the term.

loans.use: Selling of palm oil, koki-beans, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria is a single mother who has struggled greatly to provide for her two children, as she has no family in her hometown on Apodaca. Four years ago she started her own business selling jewelry to complement her meager earnings as a factory worker. She started out by selling jewelry to her co-workers and little by little increased her investment in the business. One of her children now helps her distribute her products.

Maria is requesting a loan of US $375 to purchase additional merchandise to meet demand. She will repay the loan over a period of 5 months. She and her children thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es madre soltera y ha luchado mucho por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos ella sola, porque en la localidad de Apodaca donde viven no tiene ningún familiar que pueda ayudarles. Hace cuatro años inició su propio negocio con la venta de joyería para poder solventar todos los gastos de su hogar, ya que el salario que recibía como obrera no era suficiente, comenzó a vender entre sus compañeras de trabajo y poco a poco fue incrementando su inversión y ahora ya cuenta con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos con la distribución los productos que comercializa.

Para poder continuar creciendo y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria y sus hijos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ligia Argentina

texts.es: Ligia Argentina G. H. es originaria de Bluefields tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad. Ligia se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de calzados de todas las edades. Este negocio tiene la ventaja que se venden muchos zapatos y estos a diferencia de la ropa casi no pasan de moda. Con este negocio Ligia a podido mantener hasta el momento a sus dos hijos a los que mantiene estudiando. Los pares de zapatos de mujer los compra en 12 dolares cada par, los zapatos de hombre en 16 dolares cada par y los tenis de niños en 5 dolares cada par.

loans.use: Para comprar 8 pares de zapatos de mujer, 8 pares de zapatos de hombre y 8 pares de tenis de niños.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables, chairs and utensils for her business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Fourty-two years old Natividad lives in her own house with her husband and children. She has a small store, located at home, where she offers food and beverages. She also receives income from the rent of properties. Her husband offers his services as construction worker. Both Natividad and her husband have accumulated great experience in their respective fields. Additionally, competition is low, the demand for their services is constant and they have regular clients.

The requested loan will be used to expand her business and to buy a freezer and other needed articles. Her credit history is good and she presently has no loans from other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad, de 42 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos, y se dedica a la atención de su local, ubicado en su domicilio, donde ofrece comidas y bebidas. También percibe ingresos por concepto de alquileres. Por otra parte su esposo ofrece sus servicios como albañil. Tanto Natividad como su esposo tienen bastante experiencia en los rubros que se desempeñan. Por otro lado, la competencia no es elevada, ya que la demanda de sus servicios es constante y además cuentan con clientes fijos.

La presente solicitud es para la ampliación de su negocio y para la compra de freezer y otros artículos necesarios. Su antecedente crediticio es bueno y actualmente no tiene créditos en otras instituciones.

loans.use: Business expansion and purchase of products.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, es una empeñosa madre que  trabaja de manera sostenida  desde  que tenía apenas siete  años de edad. Su niñez la ha pasado  ofertando gelatinas ante la necesidad económica por las que atravesaba su familia. Poco después de haber contraído matrimonio  la responsabilidad de brindar comodidades a sus pequeños  hijos a pesar de que su esposo también trabaja la  ha conducido  a   mantener   con muchas fuerzas la actividad que ya conoce y  disfruta comercializar sus productos en diferentes eventos públicos.Todos estos años ha estado expuesta a los intensos rayos solares  y no ha interrumpido sus labores a pesar de encontrarse en tratamiento médico; debido a la presencia de manchas en su piel. A pesar de tener una lucha interna en su corazón, desea seguir trabajando para procurarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos con este propósito solicita la ayuda de vuestro bondadoso y noble corazón a fin de invertir la cantidad que le otorgues en la compre de mayor cantidad de insumos para sus deliciosas gelatinas y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para fabricación de sus gelatinas e inversión en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.name: Lea's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Lea is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 10 and 8. Lea owns a food vendor store which she started in 2007. She works every day at her business from 6 am to 7 pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

In the past, Lea has received and successfully paid back one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in kiosk and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Adelma

texts.es:
For the past two years, Adelma has rented mototaxis to transport people from the community to their various destinations. With these taxis, she earns a daily living for her young children. Unfortunately, for some time now, her family has had serious financial difficulties due to defects with the mototaxis. With a desire to improve the capacity of her business and offer better, faster service, she is seeking a loan to put her repair plan into action.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

ADELMA, desde hace dos años se dedica al alquiler de mototaxis para transportar a las personas de su comunidad a sus diferentes destinos, con estas herramientas obtiene diariamente el sustento necesario para sus pequeños hijos, lamentablemente de un tiempo a esta parte su familia a tenido serias dificultades económicas debido a los desperfectos que han ido manifestando las motos. Con el deseo de mejorar su capacidad y ofrecer un mejor y rápido servicio solicita un préstamo para poner en marcha su plan de reparación.

loans.use: Mototaxi repair

loans.name: Emilia's Swahili South Group

texts.en:
Emilia is 24 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages 5 and 1 years old. Emilia owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 2.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maimuna, who has business dealing in goats and chicken sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Berna Nanyonga's Group

texts.en:
Berna is the leader of a group of 5 members and is the last one on the right. She is 54 years old and is a widow with 4 children, who are 33, 29, 26 and 24 years old. One child and her grandchildren are in school. The community she lives in is semi-urban. She sells babies' clothes in one of the biggest hospitals in Kampala, a business she has done for 36 years. She moves from ward to ward, looking for customers. She has a pool table that she hires out and a retail shop. The challenges include the fear of being stopped from doing her business in the hospital. She says it is more profitable to hawk around than to sit in one place and wait for clients. The challenge at her residence is having very dirty neighbors who always litter the place with rubbish.

Her achievements include the acquisition of a pool table, the retail shop, a house with 8 rooms, and the ability to run her home and educate her children singlehandedly.

She intends to increase her stock with the loan. Berna has successfully paid back 12 loans.
