loans.use: To increase her stock .

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es:
Esthela started her business after her husband suffered an accident at his old job that left him without work. He didn't have insurance to cover the medical bills and they had many debts. Their triplets had only recently been born and there was no money for household expenses. She needed to care for her husband and children and scrape together enough money to pay for medicine, therapy for her husband and everyday household expenses. She started what's now a tortilleria (a shop for making and selling tortillas) four years ago, working at home so that she could be there to care for her family. Thanks to the business, she's been able to support them.

Esthela is applying for US$600 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can remodel her shop and expand it so that she can better service her customers. With your help, she'll be able to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Esthela inició el negocio ya que su esposo se encontraba desempleado debido a que había sufrido un accidente en su antiguo trabajo, y no contaba con seguro de gastos médicos, tenían muchas deudas, sus trillizos estaban recién nacidos, no tenia dinero para el gasto familiar. Ella necesitaba sacar adelante a su esposo, e hijos, tener dinero para medicinas, terapia de su esposo, y para el gasto familiar. Comenzó su negocio hace cuatro años, decidió emprenderlo en su casa para sacar adelante a su familia, sin tener que descuidarlos, fue asi como inicio la que haora es una tortilleria, gracias a esta ha podido salir adelante.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para hacer una remodelación en su negocio, el cual ampliara, para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Remodel shop.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina is 59 years old; she didn’t finished elementary school, is married and has 3 kids. She lives in Queñuani village, district of Yunguyo.

Thrity years ago she used to sell chuño, pottatos, beans, quinua, cañihua. She belongs to the community bank “Vista Alegre”, and with her first loan of S/. 300.00 new soles, she bought 5 sheep and started a new cattle business.

With the loan of S/. 500.00 new soles that will be cancelled in 4 payments she will buy a bull to rise and to be sold later on.

She is very thankful with the loan because is helps her increase her working capital and increase her income.

Her hope is that her kids work and she can keep on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardina tiene 59 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo año de primaria, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en Villa Queñuani distrito d e Yunguyo. Hace treinta años se dedicaba a la venta de chuño, papa, habas, quinua, cañihua, pertenece al Banco Comunal " Vista Alegre", su primer crédito fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con ello compró 05 ovejas. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará un torete para engorde y después financiarlo. Esta muy agradecida con el préstamo porque le facilita negociar e incrementar de esa manera el capital y su ingreso económico. Su visión futura es que sus hijos trabajen y ella pueda continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a bull) / Compra de ganado (toro)

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 32 years old. She is married with three children. She has been a vegetable seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 1 p.m. to 12 a.m. at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $215 from her sales.

Zainabu now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Сафаров Иброхим житель района Вахш. Возраст 37 лет, женат,имеет 5 детей. Образование средние. Клиент занимается ремонтом грузовых машин. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 3 лет. Предоставляя свои услуги клиент содержит свою семью.Его оборудование устарело ,поэтому он хочет купить новое,более современное.На что ему нужны деньги. Иброхим решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ibrohim S. is a resident of the Vakh region. He is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. Ibrohim has a high school degree and for the last 3 years has been making a living repairing trucks. This business is the main source of income for his large family. Ibrohim's repair equipment has become old and he would like to purchase new, more modern tools. To finance this purchase Ibrohim wants to take out this loan which he plans to pay back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Yawo Mawusi

texts.fr: Yawo Mawusi D. est  un mécanicien réputé âgé de 42 ans qui assure un service de qualité dans un quartier de Lomé la capitale. Pour faire vidange pour ses clients,  il est obligé de faire va et vient pour chercher de l’huile à moteur ce qui est un fardeau supplémentaire pour lui. Il  souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV associer à son service mécanique le commerce d’huile à moteur pour bien servir ses clients, tout en faisant un bénéfice raisonnable. Ce faisant il contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawo Mawusi D., age 42, is a reputable mechanic who provides quality service in a district in the capital city of Lomé. To do oil changes for his customers, he must go back and forth looking for motor oil, and that is an added burden. He would like to use this first FECECAV loan to include, along with his mechanic's offerings, commerce in motor oil in order to serve his customers well, all the while making a reasonable profit. He will then help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toolboxes and also motor oil for resale

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin, 25 years old and married with three children, is a young happy hair stylist living in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria who strongly believes that happiness can attract customers. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers and sells weave-ons, hair extensions and hair cream in her shop.

Toyin is requesting a loan in order to purchase more weave-ons, hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions, hair cream and weave-ons to sell.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang C., 32, has two children, both of whom attend a local school. Mrs. Heang C. lives in the Veild village in Kampong Cham Province and earns income breeding pigs. Her husband, Mr. Try Trin, is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land that the family owns. The plantation, however, is not very productive, as it is far from an irrigation system. To improve the fertility of the soil of the rice field, Mrs. Heang C. needs a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and petrol for pumping.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and petrol for a farming business

loans.name: Mrs. Serei Chheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who all live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province are in this village bank and they will use this loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Serei C. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Roeung Samnang, owns a threshing machine which brings in income. Unfortunately, his threshing machine now needs to be repaired so his wife, Mrs. Serei C., decided to ask for a loan to fix it and re-start the business. Mrs. Serei C. is 46 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are dump truck drivers while the remaining three are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of some end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To repair a threshing machine.

loans.name: Lillian Kamya Group

texts.en: K. Lillian is the leader of the Concerned group in Kyengera, Uganda. She is 40 years old and the mother of school-age children; she also cares for two orphans. Lillian is a tailor who makes high-fashion clothes in her shop and also operates a bridal shop where she sells all sorts of accessories pertaining to a bride. She is a very stylish lady and is well known in her area. Lillian also creates party wear and makes different designs depending on her customers’ taste. She plans to use her portion of the group loan to buy material for making her clothes as well as cosmetics and other accessories for her bridal shop.

loans.use: Material for a tailor business and inventory for a bridal shop.

loans.name: Silvia Magali

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Magali U. V., tiene 26 años, vive en la Urb. La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Computación e Informática, carrera que ejercio durante 1 año y abandono debido a que se caso y tuvo a su pequeño hijo el cual depende económicamente de ella.
Silvia tiene una bodega, cuando inicio su negocio solo vendía pan, avena, leche, con sus ganancias logro surtir su bodega en la cual ahora vende de todo y le da muchas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Silvia sueña con tener un minimarket en su domicilio y viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia Magali U. V. is 26 years old. She lives in the town La Rinconada, district of Trujillo, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied Computation and Information, a career that she worked in for 1 year and then left after she got married and had a small son, who depends economically on her. Silvia has a neighbourhood shop. When she started it she sold only bread, oats, and milk. With her profits she was able to improve her shop, such that she now sells everything, and it gives her a good income. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank “Mujeres Decididas II” (Decided Women II), she invested in the purchase of groceries to stock her store. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she would repay in 4 months, she would invest in the purchase of groceries to increase the stock in her shop. Silvia dreams of having a mini-market in her home, and of traveling overseas

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her shop

loans.name: Aldo Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Aldo labora para una empresa de transportes como chofer de patio, con una antigüedad de 2 años, su esposa la señora Gabriela es ama de casa y lo apoya en cada uno de sus proyectos, ahora tienen el deseo de construir una barda en el frente de su casita, es por lo que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Aldo has worked as a driver for a transport company for two years. His wife, Gabriela, is a housewife and supports him in all of his endeavors. Now they would like to build a wall in front of their house, which is why they're seeking this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wall in front of his house

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru: На фото Вы видите дочь Ашурхон. Сама Ашурхон работает, а ее дети смотрят за скотом дома. Ашурхон 44 года, замужем, имеет троих детей. Кроме основной работы занимается предпринимательством – куплей продажей скота. С кормом у Ашурхон нет проблем так как она позаботилась об этом и сделала запасы сена и накладные расходы бизнеса минимальные.В МикроИнвест кредитуется в первый раз и на займ планирует прикупить бычка.
texts.en:
On the photo you see the daughter of Ashurhon. Ashurhon is working and her children are looking after the livestock. Ashurhon is 44 years old, married and has three children. Besides her main job she is an entrepreneur - she buys and sells cattle. She does not have a lack of fodder because she has though of it beforehand and made sure to stock up in advance and has small overhead. This is her first loan at MicroInvest and she plans to use the loan to buy a calf.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Zena S G. from Dar es Salaam, married with two children aged 4½ and 13. Since 2007, Zena has been selling a variety of clothes, i.e., traditional, modern, used and new clothes of all kinds. Working at the business for five to eight hours per day, three days per week and assisted by one person, Zena currently earns about $210 per month. She is requesting a loan in order to buy stocks of clothes in bulk, and in the future plans to establish the same business in another place. Zena thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells cooked food and drinks. Joy is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to prepare and sell. Joy is 40 years old. Her husband's name is A. and they have two children. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Saimuhammad

texts.en:
T. Saimuhammad is a young guy with a great optimistic character. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard to find a job and he thus started his own business of selling men's shoes to support his parents with family expenses. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Saimuhammad now needs a 10 000 Somoni loan which he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demands. Saimuhammad is very thankful to you to help him improve his service and the quality of life of his family.   

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new shoes for summer season sales

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal Villa Tejada  a éste pertenece, la asociación “Barrio Lindo”, integrada por doce mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios.
La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden ropa para niños, chompas tejidas en lana, comida, mantas de lana de vicuña, artefactos eléctricos, abarrotes, verduras y otro tipo de mercadería dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en distintas ferias de la ciudad. Ellas precisan capital para incrementar su mercadería  de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto there is a center called Villa Tejada, "Barrio Lindo" association belongs to this center. The association is formed by twelve women anxious to progress with their small business. The main activity of the association is sales, they sale children's clothes, wool sweaters, food, vicuna wool bed sheets, electronic devices, groceries, vegetables and other types of merchandise depending on the season. They offer these products on different markets in the city. They need working capital to increase their merchandise and therefore produce more income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Caroline Achieng'

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old. She buys new petticoats from tailors in Kibuye, and she sells them at the market. She chose this business because it was profitable, although she says there are a few competitors in Kisumu.  Caroline faces challenges of not having enough finances to buy stock, so she will use this loan to buy more stock in petticoats.  

She is married, has three children, who range in age from 7 to 14 years old. She has an immediate need to pay her children’s school fees.  When asked about her dreams, she said she wants to “have a car just to drive through the roads”.

loans.use: New Petticoats

loans.name: Nene

texts.es: Nene tiene 44 años, vive junto a su esposo quien es pescador y con sus 4 hijos que están en edad escolar. Se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos; para ello, se levanta muy temprano todos los días para ir al puerto donde compra a los agricultores los plátanos por racimos, posteriormente los vende en el mercado de su localidad o en el mismo puerto. En esta labor lleva 5 años y le va muy bien, además que le gusta porque no es una actividad que demande mucho esfuerzo físico y trabaja sólo por horas. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque esta fruta es muy requerida por las personas, bebido a que es usada en casi todas las comidas regionales de consumo diario. Para más adelante, Nene quiere compra un puesto en el mercado donde instale su negocio y no tenga que seguir estar vendiendo informalmente. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es no hay problemas entre los integrantes y todos son muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más racimos de plátanos, en un monto de 1000 soles, con lo restante invertirá en el negocio de su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca, adquirirá redes, boyas, entre otros artículos necesarios para esta labor.
texts.en:
Nene is 44 years old, she lives with her husband, who is a fisherman, and her 4 children who are students. For a living she buys and sells bananas. Therefore she gets up very early every day to go to the port where she buys bananas from the farmers to sell on the local market or at the port itself. She has been doing this for 5 years and is doing well. She also likes it and does not need physical effort and she only works specific hours. On the other hand business is profitable as this fruit is popular as it is used in almost all the regional daily dishes. For the future Nene would like to purchase a stall at the market to set up her business so she does not have to sell in an informal way. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she likes to work with her community bank as there are no problems with the members and all are very responsible with their payments. With the money she will buy bunches of bananas for 1000 soles and the rest will be invested in her husband's fishing business to buy nets, floats and other material needed for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and invewst in husband's business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from K. EMMANUEL. He is a 31-year-old married man. His family has no children. He lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur does his business in Kicukiro district where he sells milk at both retail and in big quantities. Mr. K. Emmanuel has been doing the same business since 2000 and he obtains a monthly profit of $185. He has three full-time workers who help him to run his business and he starts his daily operations at 6:00 AM and finishes at 8:00 PM.
K. Emmanuel is seeking his first loan worth 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company S.A and with this loan, he intends to buy a lot of milk. With the increased profit from the loan, he hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To purchase milk

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a 48 year-old mother of 3 and grandmother to one. A landlady, Terry owns a large building and rents out both residences and small businesses. She has been in this business for the past 20 years. Terry is requesting a loan of Ksh. 70,000 in order to complete construction on her rental homes, as well as open a butchery business. A mother of three and grandmother to one, Terry hopes to pass on her assets to her children and grandchildren one day. She describes herself as social and determined.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Complete construction and open a butchery business

loans.name: Siitaga

texts.en: Siitaga S. (0) is a 65-year-old woman living in the town of Falevao. She is married and has eight adult children. Siitaga owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. In 2004, Siitaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Siitaga is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mugoma Kweterana Sembo Mary Group

texts.en: S. Mary is forty-seven years old representing her loan group. She is a married business woman blessed with two children and having four dependents going to school. She is a farmer and she has been a farmer for over twenty-three years. She is requesting for the loan to maintain her banana plantation by purchasing fertilizer (manure), pay wages etc for the better produces. She is grateful for loan offering by Kiva, she will double the efforts to see that she succeeds in maintaining her plantation. Her dream is to see the standard of living in her home is improving.

loans.use: To maintain her banana plantation by purchasing fertilizer (manure), pay wages etc for the better produces.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad owns a hairdressing salon for women and men. He is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Mhammad knows how to treat his clients, who are his friends, neighbors and others. He didn’t face difficulties starting his business. He decided on this work to use his experience and because he wanted to work independently.

Mhammad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and continue his shop décor arrangements. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and continue his shop décor arrangements

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha Akinyi O.
Jenipha is a 53-year-old mother of five. She sells fish in Kawangware Market Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last three years. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy ten sacks of Omena (small fish) for sale. She has successfully paid a loan of Kes. 20,000. Since joining Faulu, Jenipha says that her life has improved. She has grown from buying Omena in bits to buying in sacks. She hopes to be a leading supplier of Omena in Kawangware area and grow her business to a level that it can sustain her family. She describes herself as hardworking.
 
About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fish

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella R. is a vegetable farmer and vendor in her village and in some other municipalities near her village. She is 54 years old and she has been in business for 15 years. Her husband, Cesar, is a farmer. They are blessed with three children. Her first child has graduated and is taking electrical engineering courses, the second is still in school and the youngest is still an infant. Ella and her husband are helping each other to plant and sell vegetables.

Ella expanded her planted vegetable site in her fields. She needs capital to maintain her business. Her business contributes a lot to supporting her family's needs. In this regard, she is asking to borrow 5,000 PHP for the maintenance of her vegetable farm and to buy the necessary fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: Farm maintenance and purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 50 years old, married to Kabebe Wambui and they have three school going children. She has been running her food joint in Naivasha town for the last three years.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan after paying her first loan very well. She plans to expand her restaurant business by selling produce on the side and that's why she has applied for this loan. She will sell fruits, vegetables and dry food stuff from her extended business. She foresees a bright future once this new business grows as she will become financially stable and be able to buy a piece of land and build her own home. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Open a grocery shop on the side

loans.name: Mujeres De Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Leonora is the coordinator of her group Mujeres D. Nuevo Renacer (Born Again Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the North Coast where the economy centers around tourism (which is a volatile industry) and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children aged 10 and 12.

Leonora is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without delay. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling shoes and underwear, investing in women's underwear and brassieres to sell. She will use the profits to continue investing in her family and in her business with the end goal of having a fixed location from which to sell her goods. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Panties and brassieres to sell

loans.name: Lurenzo Govie Memorial Secondary School, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the Lerenzo Govie Memorial Secondary School. This school was named after its founder, Lerenzo Govie, in 1974. It is a junior secondary school with junior secondary school classes I – III (JSS I-III).

This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo to seek a loan in order to supplement their monthly salaries. With the help this loan, these teachers can meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month would repay the loan out of their salaries.

Lucian W. K. (first row, third from left) is the bursar at the school and leader of this group of teachers. Forty years old, Lucian was born in Hastings, near Freetown. She is married to a teacher and they have three children. Lucian’s children are attending school and with her share of the loan, she will pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo B. is from the village of Lobong, San Jacinto, Pangasinan. He is 36 years old. Reynaldo is single. To make a living, Reynaldo owns & operates a business providing recycling services, hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional waste & junk material to sell. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP. which will be used to purchase additional waste & junk material to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Reynaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste & junk material to sell

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa J. is a trader and rents a shop on a major business route. She trades in provisions and other assorted items. She is married to a businessman with two daughters. She has been in business for the past four years.

Massa is in need of a loan to increase her stock in her shop. She has proven to have a very good credit history in individual lending. She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to pay for one of her daughter's university fees and to buy a piece of land.

She is very modest and spends her entire time in her business without assistance from her relatives.

loans.use: To buy assorted provisions

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah has sold clothes and accessories from her house since 2006. She is 30 years old, married and has three children who still go to school. She cooperates with her husband in the household. She's thankful for her small business; it allows her to provide better living conditions for her family. 

Today, Samah is requesting to borrow $1,100 to purchase additional clothes and accessories to attract more clients to her shop in order to enlarge her business in the coming months and have higher profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes and accessories

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna C. A. O. is twenty-five years old, married and has two children. Her business is located at Kisumu behind Kenyatta Sports Club. She has been selling dresses, trousers and shoes for the last three years to the local people.

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same business as hers so customers are spoilt for choice. There are also the challenges of weather especially because her business is an open air market. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to restock her business to grow it and to be able to serve more people.  She hopes to open a boutique someday. She also hopes to give her children quality educations. She is a very hardworking and creative lady.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Comic

texts.en:
Comic M. is 32 years old and is married to Bernard Wasike who is 39 years and an employee of Kabarnet Museum. She lives in Kabarnet town with her family and she has two children: Joy (7 yrs: Class 2) and Peace (2 yrs).

Comic runs a retail shop and she started this business eight years ago. She earns a monthly profit of Ksh 6,000 and has an additional income of Ksh 5,000 from other sources. Her business is situated in Kabarnet Town and most of her clients are residents of the town.

Comic was introduced to KADET by existing KADET clients and, apart from KADET, she has also taken a loan from another micro-finance institution in Kenya.

Comic has obtained a loan of Ksh 40,000 from KADET of which she will use Ksh 20,000 to purchase stock for her retail shop, Ksh 10,000 to purchase maize to sell, and Ksh 10,000 to pay rent for her shop. If this loan boosts her business, Comic will use the money to expand her business from retail to wholesale.

Comic hopes and dreams that one day she will be able to purchase a plot and develop rental units on it. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store, maize to sell and to pay store rent

loans.name: Silab Group

texts.en: Pacha is a member of the Silab group. He lives in Surkh Road district. He is 29 years old and married with four children: two sons and two daughters. One son and one daughter are students in school. He is a taxi driver. His taxi tires are old and are not working properly and his business income is not enough to meet his family needs. Therefore, he wants to take a loan to buy new tires for his taxi to increase his business income. This is the only business he has to support his family members. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chhuon S., 38, is a divorced mother of five children; one is employed as a machinery repairman and the other four are students who also assist their mother’s business when they are free.  Chhuon is a local farmer who plants rice and vegetables on the land that she inherited from her parents, but with the farming season approaching, she doesn’t have enough materials to supply her field, so she is looking for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds. She proposes to use the other half of the loan to buy an old motorcycle for riding needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crops seed for growing.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 28 years old and is married with two children, 1 year and 8 years old. His eldest child is currently in school.

Bernard is a dedicated farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. He has been farming for five years and produces maize, potatoes and tomatoes that he sells to the local market. He also earns income from a shop he operates in the same area. His main challenge in farming is fluctuation in the prices of his produce which at times leads to losses.

Bernard has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes, through this loan, his family will experience a comfortable life where he will be able to provide good education, food and clothing for his family.

In five years time, Bernard hopes to expand his farming activities by acquiring four more dairy cows and a pick-up for transporting his milk to his client.

Bernard says Juhudi Kilimo came as a blessing and his group members are able to acquire dairy cows which is very encouraging.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. is 47 years old and lives in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, which is about 200 km from Phnom Penh along National Road No. 6. He and his wife have three teenage children who are no longer in school and who are currently working.

Heng S. earns a living by cultivating crops on his own land in the village. He normally sells the crops to buyers when the crops are sufficiently ripe. His wife typically stays at home to do housework, but she also works with him to assist him with the business. Because crop-growing and -selling is the primary source of income for his family, Heng S. is requesting a loan in the amount of $375 in order to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to grow additional crops.

loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing fertilizers and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan K. K. is thirty-two years old, married, and has a son seven years old. His business is located at a busy market called Kimbo in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. 

Duncan K. K. has been providing 'boda boda' (motorcycle) transport to the local people. He has been doing this business for the last five years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is during the rainy seasons when the roads become impassable and the rains also lead to high costs of maintaining the motorcycles. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a motorcycle to expand his business. He hopes to be a market leader in the transport business and he sees himself owning a fleet of vehicles to provide transport to the people of Thika. He describes himself as very hard-working.

loans.use: buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Tesapeara Group

texts.es:
Tesapeara se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado para trabajar en forma conjunta y solidaria.
El grupo se encuentra trabajando dentro del 5° ciclo, cada una en una actividad diferente.
Una  de la integrantes es la señora Clara B. quienes una mujer trabajadora y activa, ella es esposa y ama de casa y al mismo tiempo también atiende su un negocio que posee en su casa.
El negocio es administrado por ella y se encuentra surtida con accesorios de mercería en general.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general como por ejemplo artículos decorativos, varios tipos de papeles, globos, telas de varios tipos, y otros.
texts.en:
“Tesepeara” is the name of a great group of women who have come together to work jointly as a single unit. They are currently in their fifth loan cycle. Each member is engaged in a different business activity.

One of the members is Sra. Clara B., who is a hardworking and active woman. She is a wife and homemaker but also manages a business out of her home. Her store is stocked with general sewing supplies. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sewing supplies and merchandise such as decorative items, various types of paper, balloons, different fabrics, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies & merchandise

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis Francisco de 23 años de edad, es soltero, habita en casa de sus padres, a quienes ayuda con los gastos familiares, se desempeña como director de la Escuela de Santa Fe desde hace 3 años.  

Esta solictando  su 2do credito con el fin de consruir una cocina  ya que la que tiene se encuentra en mal estado, cuenta con una parte del dinero, sin embargo para terminarla le hace falta el financiamiento que solicita. Se caracteriza por ser un cliente bien responsable con sus compromisos.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir estudiando, tener salud y estabilidad laboral para asi seguir ayudando a sus padres y poder cumplir con todos sus sueños en el futuro.
texts.en:
Luis Francisco is 23 years old and single. He lives in the home of his parents, whom he helps with the household expenses. He has worked for the past 3 years as a school director in Santa Fe. He is requesting his second loan with the aim of building a kitchen, since the current one is in bad shape. He has some of the money already, but to finish it he needs the funds from the loan he is requesting. He has shown himself to be a client who is very responsible with his commitments. His greatest dream in life is to keep studying, maintain his health and keep a steady job, so that he can keep helping his parents and fulfill all of his dreams in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
Carlina B., 54, is from Cabisera, Ilagan. She is married and has 8 grown-up children. To make a living, Carlina owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of products, including candy and cold drinks, to the local community. Carlina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has already successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which she used to purchase additional products for sale. Now, Carlina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose, and which will be Carlina's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to provide financial support to her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Gonzalina

texts.es:
La señora Gonzalina Rodríguez actualmente tiene 2 negocios, los cuales son la venta de abarrotería, estan ubicados uno en su casa de habitación en la Colonia Bella Vista de esta ciudad mismo que opera bajo el nombre de “Pulpería Bucardo”, el cual queda a cargo de su hijo,  mientras ella atiende el segundo negocio ubicado en la Terminal de transporte de esta ciudad.
La señora Rodríguez tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar ya que el crecimiento de sus negocios es notable y sus condiciones de vida son favorables.
Gonzalina vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar labora como obrero en una fábrica de tabacos y de la relación entre ambos han procreado 2 hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para susrtir su pulperia ya que desea tener mayores ganancias para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gonzalina R. actually has two businesses, both are grocery sales, one of which is located in her house in Colonia Bella Vista which operates under the name "Pulperia Bucardo" which her son is in charge of while she runs the second business located in the transport terminal of the city. Mrs. R. has dedicated herself to this activity for seven years and during this time she has run her stores wisely so that they have grown significantly and her living conditions are favorable. Gonzalina lives in a common law marriage and her partner works as a laborer in a tobacco factory. Between them, they've had two children who depend upon them one hundred percent. She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her grocery stores because she would like to have greater earnings to further increase the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Nana

texts.fr:
Madame Nana Sidibé est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit  dans une famille polygame avec son époux, ses enfants et ses co-épouses dans le quartier Médine de Bougouni. 
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des habits etc. Elle a appris cette activité à travers une sœur.
Avec une expérience de plus de 8 ans elle maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, elle décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de dans son quartier. Après 2 prêts solidaires, elle est passée au prêt individuel.Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter,  des habits au Burkina et effectuera sa vente au marché de Bougouni  dans sa boutique. La plus part de sa clientèle est composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.
Avec se bénéfice elle compte payer les intérêts du prêt et  agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nana Sidibé, 43 years old, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her children and her husband’s other wives in the Médine district of Bougoni. Since her parents had no resources, she decided to earn a living by selling clothing. She has learned this line of business from her sister. Now, with over eight years of experience, she excels at what she does. In order to maintain a constant level of working capital, she decided to join the solidarity credit association in her district. After two solidarity loans, she moved on to an individual loan. All previous loans have been duly repaid. With this loan she plans to purchase outfits at Burkina Faso in order to resell them at her store at the Bougouni market. For the most part, her customers are women. She hopes to achieve a monthly income of 50,000 West African Francs, which she plans to use for repaying the interest on her loan and for growing her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Humberto P. N., es un hombre de 45 años de edad, habitante del Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, es casado y su esposa labora como responsable de una tienda, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad que son independiente y le apoyan a sus padres con una mensualidad para sus gastos, el señor es agricultor desde hace 2 años, comenzó con el apoyo del tío de su esposa quien le hablo de los beneficios de la actividad, decidiendo Don Luis de dedicarse de lleno a esta labor. Problemas de plagas y enfermedades en las tierras han ocasionado disminución en la producción de las cosechas y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas, insecticidas y abonos que mejoren el mantenimiento y produzcan una mejor cosecha que beneficie las ventas y la economía de la familia, a fin de reinvertir en su negocio o en planes familiares, que ayuden  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su esposa y la de él, como por ejemplo le infraestructura de su hogar que el planteaba que se encontraba en condiciones inhabitadas.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto P. N. is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. He is married and his wife is responsible for a store, which helps with the household income. They have five older children who are independent and support their parents with monthly payments for their expenses. Mr. P. N. has been a farmer for the past two years. He started with the help of his wife’s uncle who told him about the benefits of the business. After this, he decided to dedicate himself fully to this line of work. Pest problems and diseases on his lands have caused a decrease in crop production, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, fungicides, insecticides and manure. This way, he can improve the maintenance of his crops and have a better harvest that benefits his sales and his family’s economic situation. In reinvesting the earnings in his business or in family plans such as the infrastructure of their house which is in inhabitable condition, it will help to improve the living conditions of him and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide excellent maintenance to his crops

loans.name: Kugumikiriza Group-Jinja

texts.en:
O. Jane is a member of Kugumikiriza group-Jinja. She is widowed, has five children and for the last 10 years has principally been selling plastics and scrap metal as a means of earning a livelihood.  It’s a business she says is worthwhile as she does not have to incur any operational costs as she operates from home. 

Savings from a cassava selling business enabled her to jump-start this business. Jane says that what she has achieved in many respects boils down to two things - dedication and a sense of purpose. In the period of one week she says her profits equate to 130,000 shillings. With this loan, she is looking at buying more scrap that she says she will resell.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap to resell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilson C. Sosa tiene  30 años , su pareja se llama Antonia Mercedes Romero y tiene 31 años de edad. Los mismos poseen 3 hijos, 2 nenas de 7 y 6 años respectivamente que actualmente están iniciando su estudios primarios , y un varón de 2 años.
El Sr. Wilson se dedica a la compra- venta de papeles de todo tipo. El mismo recorre comprando los papeles mal cortados y reciclados de las imprentas, papelerías y otros negocios. 
El Sr. Wilson se encarga junto a su esposa de la selección de los papeles como ser : papel blanco, en colores , escritos y cartón.
Una vez seleccionado vende los papeles a las recicladoras mayoristas.
El Sr. Wilson desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mayor cantidad de papeles para tener mayor rotación de sus mercaderías y obtener mayores ganancias con ellas.
texts.en:
Mr Wilson C. Sosa is 30 years old.  His partner is called Antonia Mercedes Romero and she is 31 years old.  The couple have three children: two girls, ages 7 and 6, who are currently beginning their primary education and a 2-year-old boy.

Mr Wilson buys and sells all types of paper.  He travels around buying badly-cut paper and recycled paper from printing companies, stationery stores and other businesses.

Mr Wilson and his wife sort through the paper, for example: white paper, colored paper, documents and cardboard.

Once sorted, he sells the paper to wholesale recycling companies.

Mr Wilson would like to invest his loan in the purchase of more paper in order to have a higher turnover of his goods and achieve higher profits from them.

loans.use: Purchase of paper

loans.name: Junielka Del Rosario

texts.es: Junielka Del Rosario es una joven muy emprendedora que se encuentra muy feliz con su negocio. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, que es la venta de calzado, ropa y lotería. Sus inicios se dan porque su Mama inicio con este negocio y así con el paso del tiempo fue enseñando a Junielka para que aprendiera este oficio que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Este crédito es la compra de ropa nueva, calzado y raspaditas. Desea llegar a establecer su negocio en su vivienda en donde es más rentable.
texts.en: Junielka Del Rosario is a very enterprising young woman who is very happy with her business.  She has had her business in which she sells footwear, clothes and lottery tickets for more than 6 years.  She started in this business because her mom set it up and, over time, taught Junielka the trade.  It is her main source of income.  This loan will be used to buy new clothes, footwear and scratchcards.  She hopes to eventually set her business up in her home where it is more profitable.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ta Marr Group

texts.en: Kumba T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kumba was born in a place call Bendugu, about 42 years ago. She is married to a policeman and the couple has six children, three of whom are still attending schools. For over eight years now, Kumba has been selling clothes and trousers. With the help of this loan, Kumba and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Kumba will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy clothes and trousers at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To buy clothes and trousers at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Betty Aracely

texts.es:
Betty de 30 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive  en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Hace 10 años atrás empezó con su tienda porque siempre quiso tener un negocio que le produjera dinero para ayudar a su esposo y que pueda pasar en su casa para dedicarle tiempo a sus hijos por eso la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco la surtió con mercadería y comenzó a trabajar desde las 08h00am todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local separado de su casa para dale un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old and has a small store in the front part of her house.  She lives in Playas canton which is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations.  It is noted for its wide variety of seafood.

Betty set up her store 10 years ago because she always wanted to have a business which would make money to help her husband and she also wanted a business which would allow her to be at home so she could spend time with her children.  This is why she set up her store in her home.  Little by little she stocked her store with merchandise.  She works every day from 8 o'clock in the morning.

Betty will use her loan to buy rice, drinks and canned goods for her store.  In the future she would like to have her own premises separate from her home so that she can provide her customers with a better service and provide jobs for other people.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
CACILDA MUCOMBO nasceu no Municipio da Catembe, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique mae de 2 filhos de 14 anos e 12 anos de idade, ambos vao a escola. Fez somente o ensino primario e nao continuou devido a casamento pre-maturo. Vive na casa dos pais e sustentanta seus filhos.
Com aguerra mudou se para a vizinha suazilandia junto com sua familia e filhos afim de procurar azilo junto daqule pais. Viveu durante 10 anos e como o seu  casamento nao durou muito, volta  ao seu pais de origem a fim de comecar uma nova etapa da sua vida e decide viver em casa dos pais onde comeca com o negocio de venda de produtos de 1 necessidade na vizinha africa do sul para o seu  auto sustento e dos filhos que trouxe do lar.
Foi atraves dos seus irmaos que ouviu a falar da Hluvuku e aproximou-se ate ao banco solicitando o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para aplicar na construcao da sua casa. O emprestimo anterior foi no valor de 7.500.00mt que foi para o comercio.
Projectos para o futuro  sera a continuacao com a construcao da sua casa,  assim como poder ter mais emprestimos para o crescimento do seu negocio porque agora ja nao fornece produtos de primeira necessidae optou por comercializar comida.
texts.en:
CACILDA MUCOMBO was born in the municipality of Catembe, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She has 2 children aged 14 and 12 who both attend school.  Shecompleted elementary school and did not finish her education due to her early marriage.  She lives with her parents and supports her children.  During the war she moved to neighboring Swaziland with her family and children to seek asylum in that country.  She lived here for 10 years but since her marriage did not last long, she returned to her home country to begin a new stage of her life.  She decided to live in her parents' home and started a business selling basic necessities in neighboring South Africa to support herself and her children.

She learned about Hluvuku through her siblings and she approached the bank to request her second loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, zinc sheets, etc.) to build her home.  Her previous loan was for 7.500.00mt which was for her business. 

Her future project is to continue construction on her home and to request additional loans to grow her business because she no longer sells basic necessities and instead has chosen to sell prepared meals.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, sand, zinc sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Soeur's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people from Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province are forming this village bank loan.  The members of this village loan selected Mr. Soeur N., 44 years old, as the village bank president. The members will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Soeur N. and his wife, Mrs. Touch P., are famers who own a 2-hectares plot of land which they use to cultivate rice to sell.  They do not have enough money to grow crops on this farm, so Mr. Soeur N. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and gasoline to cultivate rice. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Soeur N. earns additional income by repairing bicycles in the local village. This couple has five children: one of whom stays at home, and the others are students who also help their parents in farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and gasoline to cultivate rice

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 38 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de desayunos en un puesto que tiene en la esquina de su casa ella vende kinua,maca,leche entre otros más ,la socia lleva en este negocio ya un par de años siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento espera poder encontrar otro tipo de trabajo,por el momento se siente bien con el negocio que está realizando ya que le permite estar más tiempo con sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como kinua, azúcar, canela, leche, entre otros más para así poder abastecer su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MUJERES UNIDAS" (United Women) communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Yolanda is 38 years old and married with five children.  She sells breakfast consisting of quinoa, ginseng, milk and other items out of a stand set up in her home.  She has been running this business, which is the only work she has, for a few years.  She hopes to find another type of job but in the meantime she is happy with what she does because it allows her to spend more time with her children.

This member plans to use the loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as quinoa, sugar, cinnamon, milk and other items.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as quinoa, sugar, cinnamon, milk and other items for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo Coronado

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo Coronado  R. G. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como Misceláneo tiene  ocho  años  de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Coronado R. G. has been working as an odd-job man at Barceló Montelimar Hotel for eight years.  He is married and has three school-age children.

Wilfredo has had two loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks etc. in order to extend and improve his home.  Ceprodel's loans have been very useful to him as they have enabled him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a married woman who lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store and a sugarcane field. Her husband Celso, who is 65 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are between between 18 and 42 years old. Amparo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amparo has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1,300, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use as funds for business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Amparo is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joiniung the Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva,org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Arnol

texts.es: Arnol, de 35 años. Vive en concubinato con Rosa con quien tiene 2 hijos, a los cuales cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de guacamayo (selva central peruana). Hace 13 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos y café. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y dedicación, tanto así que en campaña agrícola que dura una vez al año, los mismo comerciantes mayoristas visitan sus chacras para comprar su cosecha entera. Durante todo este año logró obtener 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Ahora desea mejorar su producción de plátanos para poder obtener mejores ganancias cada 15 días, puesto que es el tiempo que demora para la maduración. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es uno de los socios más entusiastas. Arnol, invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la contrata de personal para que le ayude en la limpieza de sus plantas de cítricos y café.
texts.en:
Arnol, 35 years old, lives with his partner Rosa with whom he has 2 children.  They care for the children in their own home, which is located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian forest).  For 13 years he has planted citrus and coffee, which he cares for with a great thoroughness and dedication, so much so that during the yearly farming season the same wholesalers visit his farm to buy his entire harvest.  During this whole year he was able to get 2 hectares of farmland.  Now he wants to improve his plantain production in order to increase his income every 15 days - the time it takes for plantains to ripen.  

He belongs to the village bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo" and this is his first loan with MFP, where he is one of the most enthusiastic members.  Arnol will invest the loan in hiring someone to help him prune the citrus and coffee plants.

loans.use: Hire someone to help prune coffee and citrus plantations

loans.name: Mario Alonso

texts.es:
El sr. Mario Alonso F. es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de artículos varios como ser: lápices, pulseras, súper glue, cepillos, pastas dentales, peines, desodorantes, ganchos para pelo etc. Estas ventas las realiza en diferentes pulperías de la zona de Danli, utiliza su motocicleta para repartir su producto, a adquirido una gran experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, sus clientes lo prefieren por la variedad de producto que vende y los excelentes precios que ofrece.
El sr. Mario F. es casado y con su esposa han procreado a dos hermosas hijas y esto es lo que le anima a seguir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mario Alonso F. is a salesman who sells various items such as: pencils, bracelets, superglue, toothbrushes, toothpaste, combs, deodorants, hairpins, etc.  He sells his products to different grocery stores in the Danli area.  He uses his motorbike to distribute his products and has gained a lot of experience in the running of his business.  His customers prefer to buy from him because of the variety of products he sells and the excellent prices that he offers.

Mario F. is married and he and his wife have two beautiful daughters.  This is what encourages him to keep going.  He will use his loan to buy merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: to buy pencils, bracelets, duct tape, toothbrushes, combs, toothpaste, hairpins, deodorants and glue

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Mónica, vive en la zona de Coqueni junto con su padre, hermanos e hijo, ella es la única mujer en la familia, ya que recientemente falleció su señora madre, quedando ella como responsable de la atención de su papa y de su pequeño hijo, quien tiene 8 años y se encuentra en edad escolar, Ella trabaja realizando servicio de peluquería como tintes masajes, manicure, pedicura, a domicilio por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas se ayuda con otro trabajo de limpieza, a la fecha ella solicita este crédito para la compra de material como tintes, cremas, toallas, tijeras, y otros instrumentos para su trabajo, es una persona joven que quiere superarse, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mónica lives in Coqueni neighborhood together with her father, siblings and son.  She is the only woman in the family since her mother died recently.  This left Mónica in charge of looking after her dad and her 8 year-old son who is in school.

Mónica has a hairdressing business.  She provides coloring, massages, manicures and pedicures at her customers' homes in the afternoons.  In the mornings she does a cleaning job.  Mónica is requesting this loan to buy materials such as dyes, creams, towels, scissors and other instruments she needs for her work.  She is a young person who would like to excel in life.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy dyes and other hairdressing products

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is a tailor. She and her husband have five children, and she works hard to help support the family. 

Raymunda requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. Raymunda is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment, as well as reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene un pequeño negocio de fritanga  en donde vende una variedad de platillos como: carne asada, enchilada, tajadas maduras, tajadas verdes, refrescos, gaseosas entre otros.
Negocio con tres años en las ventas, y que ha ido incrementando gracias a los ocho ciclos de préstamo que Afodenic ha dado mediante el financiamiento. En donde ha invertido en su negocio como en la infraestructura de su casa.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en materiales de construcción para hacer un baño y estar en mejores condiciones de higiene.
Contenta por lograr el objetivo de poder dar a su familia un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Mercedes has a small food business where she sells a variety of dishes such as grilled meat, enchiladas, sliced ripe and green plantains, drinks, and soft drinks, among other things.

She’s had this business for three years and it’s been growing thanks to the five loan cycles that Afodenic has provided.  This has allowed her to invest into her business as well as into her home.

She will use the money from this loan to buy building materials in order to add a bathroom and improve the sanitary conditions in her home.  She is happy to able to provide a better roof over her family’s head.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: La Fortaleza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Edermiro has a wife and nine children. He belongs to the La Fortaleza one & two (The Strength), located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. 

He will use this loan to buy different animals; he has a butcher shop where he sells beef, pork, chicken and goat meat. He is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Kiva partner Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. Edermiro started his business with his first Esperanza loan, almost six years ago. 

He will both invest the profits in his business and continue to save for his own house. His dreams are to live confortably and save up with his partner. He became interested in and motivated by others to join Esperanza after he was encouraged by others in this group to be part of the program and start his business.

His most important challenges are to save and rebuild his house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, beef, and chicken.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: Meri tiene 47 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica en la venta de artículos y químicos de limpieza, productos que los adquiere al por mayor y ella los distribuye en envases más pequeños para su venta. Entre los clientes que más tiene son aquellos que trabajan en limpieza y a la ama de casa, por lo que algunos de sus productos son repartidos a domicilio, pero la mayoría de las veces los vende en la calle. Durante estos años de trabajo, ha visto que le ha sido rentable este negocio, por lo que eso la motiva a seguir con esta actividad y convertirse en una gran distribuidora de productos de limpieza. Este será su crédito número 12 con MFP,  tiene amplia experiencia de trabajo solidario dentro de su banco comunal que le permite durante estos años tener un respaldo económico para desarrollar su negocio además de que comparte experiencias exitosas de emprendimiento de la cual esta muy agradecida, esta convencida de seguir siendo responsable en sus créditos porque desarrolla un buen historial y confianza en su persona. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
Meri, 47, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. For over thirteen years she has worked selling cleaning supplies and chemicals, items which she obtains wholesale and distributes in smaller packages for resale. Among her customers are many who work in the cleaning business as well as housewives. Thus some of her products are delivered to the home, but most of the time she sells them on the street. 

Over the years of work she has found this business to be profitable, and so she has been motivated to go on to become a large distributor of cleaning products. This will be her twelfth loan with MFP. She has extensive experience in the cooperative efforts within her communal bank, which has provided her economic support over the years for developing her business, along with sharing experiences in successful entrepreneurship, for which she is very appreciative. She is convinced she will continue to be responsible with her loans because it develops a good history and confidence in her person. She will invest the money in purchasing more merchandise in cleaning products.

loans.use: to purchase more cleaning products.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has had a personal products sales business in the Philippines for 10 years. She is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 34 years old and lives in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of four school-aged children. Marilyn has owned and operated a motorcycle transport service for one year. She runs this type of service because motorcycle transport is highly in demand by passengers because of its door-to-door service, availability, flexibility, speed and low price. Marilyn established the motorcycle transport to generate extra income of PHP 5,880 per month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase tires and accessories for her motorcycle. Marilyn is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Marilyn hopes to purchase additional motorcycles to transport passengers.

loans.use: to purchase tires and accessories.

loans.name: Luis Bayardo

texts.es: Luis Bayardo de 29 años es un joven que decidió generar ingresos para mantener a su familia. El vende productos en general como cosméticos lociones, ropa femenina y accesorios, que distribuye entre sus clientes a través de créditos. Entre sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos ha logrado un grupo de clientes fijos, que hoy forman parte de su registro de compradores permanentes. Su sueño más adelante es tener un local donde pueda tener más comodidad para ofrecer sus productos. El motivo por el cual solicita su financiación es para la compra de perfumes, toallas, sabanas, ropa en general y ropa interior.
texts.en: Luis Bayardo is 29 years old.  He is a young man who decided to make income in order to support his family.  He sells general merchandise such as cosmetics, lotions, women's clothes and accessories which he distributes to his customers through loans.  Through his neighbors, friends, family members and people who he has been recommended to, he has managed to establish a group of regular customers who currently make up his list of permanent buyers.  His dream for the future is to buy premises where he can sell his products more comfortably.  He is requesting this loan to buy perfume, towels, sheets, clothes and underwear.

loans.use: to buy perfume, towels, sheets, clothes and underwear

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 26, is a mother of a 3-year-old child. She farms and has a salon business. For the last 4 years, her farm has been producing tomatoes and eggs which all go to the local market.

Margaret has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She is focusing on running a farm of 1,000 birds at a time and becoming the main supplier of eggs locally. Like other farmers, Margaret says animal diseases are the greatest challenge for her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Quinahue Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Quinahue” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran atención de almacenes, confección de ropa, venta de ropa, venta de frutas, venta de verduras, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, repuestos de bicicletas y servicio de gasfitería. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Recoleta, ciudad de Santiago. 
Ingrid integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha, viste un sweater color verde y en sus brazos sostiene a su pequeña hija.
