Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, pan, entre otros productos, trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 1 año, se ha hecho de clientela, sin embargo considera que aún le falta atraer a más gente a su negocio. Su horario laboral es de 9ºº a 10ºº de la noche. 
Su mercadería la compra en la vega, distribuidoras y proveedores.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Sus metas son surtir su negocio con mayor variedad de productos, de ésta manera también captar una mayor cantidad de clientes a su negocio. 
Ingrid vive junto a su marido, sus tres hijos de 12, 9 y 2 años de edad, además junto a sus suegros y sus cuñados.
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional, sin embargo debe organizarse para la realización de algunos trámites. 
Ingrid está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirán invertir en su negocio. Además las reuniones del grupo del banco comunal son muy amenas y los demás emprendedores son comprometidos y respetuosos. Respecto a las capacitaciones estas servirán para administrar su negocio. Ingrid tiene muchas expectativas de prosperar con su negocio. 
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Quinahue” and has 18 enterprising members who are in a variety of occupations among which are: running stores, clothing manufacturing, clothing sales, fruit sales, vegetable sales, catalogue cosmetics sales, bicycle repair and plumbing services.  All of them are from the city of Santiago’s Recoleta Commune.

Ingrid is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the first spot from left to right and is wearing a green sweater and is carrying her little daughter in her arms.  She sells groceries and bread, among other products.  She’s been in this line of work for a year and has established a clientele.  However, she feels that she still has to attract more people to her business.  Her work schedule is from 9am until 10pm.  She buys her merchandise in La Vega and from distributors and providers.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  Her goals are to stock a wider variety of products so that she can capture a larger number of customers for her business.

Ingrid lives with her husband and three children who are 12, 9, and 2 years of age; she also lives with her in-laws and siblings-in-law.

Her dreams are to own her own house and to do so she’s already signed up for the housing subsidy but she still has to organize herself to carry out some of the transactions.

Ingrid is very happy and grateful for the services granted by Fondo Esperanza because they will allow her to invest in her business.  Besides, the communal bank meetings are very pleasant and the other members are committed and respectful.  With respect to the training, it will help her run her business.  Ingrid very much expects to prosper with her business.

Recoleta is one of Santiago’s (capital of Chile) communes and is located in the north-central part of Santiago Metropolitan Region.  It’s commercially active especially in the Patronato commercial neighborhood which welcomed Arab merchants initially and now Koreans.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en: Genevie is 31 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children between 9 and 14 years old. They are in school. For the past two years, she has been selling soap, toothpaste, and chloride air freshener. She started this business with the money that she generated from her graduation program.  She is requesting a loan to purchase soap, toothpaste, and chloride air freshener for her business. Her plan is to build a shop and a house and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase soap, toothpaste, and air freshener for her business,

loans.name: Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal conformado por Juana Guillermina, Maria Enriqueta, Dominga Del Socorro, Isidra Maria, Lidi Maikely, Keyla Maria, Gertrudis Patricia, Norma Isabel, Carlo José y Norma Isabel. Son personas responsables que disfrutan de sus diferentes actividades económicas a las que se dedican. En el caso de Juan se dedica a una pulpería, que posee desde hace más de 1 año a pesar que no ha sido fácil mantener esta actividad por la gran competencia que existe Juana no se deja abatir por los problemas y cada día se esmera en el servicio que proporciona a sus clientes. el crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos, sopas, golosinas entre otros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bello Amanecer" (beautiful dawn) is composed of Juana Guillermina, María Enriqueta, Dominga Del Socorro, Isidra María, Lidi Maikely, Keyla María, Gertrudis Patricia, Norma Isabel, Carlo José and Norma Isabel. They are responsible people who like the various activities in which they have engaged.

Juana runs a general store that she has owned for over a year, despite the difficulties to keep it because of the harsh competition in her area. Juana does not let her problems get her down and every day she strives to provide for her customers. She will use her loan to buy basic grains, detergents, matches, soups, snacks and other goods.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, matches, soups, snacks and other goods.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with five children; three attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to neighboring community members. Pauline faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bales of sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Elma Group

texts.en:
Elma is married with four children. Elma is 44 years old and lives in Ozamiz City.

Elma sells sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to purchase ingredients for her snacks vending.

Elma has been a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Elma hopes to expand her snacks vending. Elma is the leader of a four person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for snacks vending

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 49 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. The family lives in the village where Elsa raises crops. Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps provide for their daily needs.

Elsa is an industrious and cheerful person.  She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation, but since she is determined to provide for her children, she does everything to lift her family from poverty.

Elsa is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds, pesticides and insecticides for her crop production. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yields. She is hoping to harvest a large volume of rice and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and insecticides for her crop production

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman who has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Jocelyn has a sari-sari store (general store) in Talibon, Bohol. She sells various items like noodles, canned goods, and vegetables. Jocelyn also cooks delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. She also raises pigs and chickens in her backyard. Jocelyn does all these activities to support her family, especially her children's education. She requested a loan to buy piglets and more items to sell in her store, such as canned goods and vegetables. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to buy piglets and items to sell in her store, such as canned goods and vegetables

loans.name: Hector Leon

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad Hector ha encontrado una actividad que le permite generar ingresos de manera honesta y a su ves ayudar a su novia, la cual es también un persona de escasos recursos.

Ambos luchan por salir adelante por medio de la venta de ropa desde su negocio Fashion Star Antioquia, el cual han visto que puede crecer, y a su ves generarles mayores ingresos con los cuales pueden ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias. Así las cosas, se encuentran solicitando un crédito que les permita adquirir un mayor inventario para poder ofrecer un mayor surtido a sus clientes, y así llevarlos a que compren todos aquellos estilos que les permitirán estar siempre a la moda.

Su mayor sueño es ir creciendo, y consolidarse como una empresa que tenga por lo menos 10 almacenes más en Colombia y 2 en Brazil.
texts.en:
At his 25 years of age, Hector has found an activity that allows him to generate income in an honest way and, in turn, help his girlfriend who is also a person of scarce resources.

Both fight to get ahead by selling clothing from their business, Fashion Star Antioquia, which they have seen grow and generate for them greater income which they can use to improve their quality of life and that of their families. So, they are requesting a loan that will permit them to acquire greater inventory in order to be able to offer more stock to their customers and get them to buy all of those styles that will allow them to always be in fashion.

His greatest dream is to continue growing and consolidate as a company that has at least 10  more stores in Colombia and two in Brazil.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise since until now he's had little inventory.

loans.name: Love One Another Group

texts.en:
Chipo is 37 years old and lives in Gweru. As a family they have two children aged 22 and 17. One child is still at school. They have no other dependants.

Chipo is into the business of chicken rearing, and she also buys and sells Matemba (small dried fish) and clothing. She has been doing this business for the past four years now with the assistance of one employee.

She has requested $400 to buy 200 day-old chicks, 30 bags of chicken feeds, and chemicals. The challenge that Chipo faces is that of poultry death and chicken feed shortages.

She sees herself starting a piggery project in the coming five years as her chicken business grows and expands. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy chicks, chicken feed, and chicken vaccines.

loans.name: Chinyei Group

texts.en:
Chinyei is a 32-year-old lady and is married with two children aged 12 and 5 years. Both children go to school. They do not have any other dependents. Her husband is formally employed as a teacher.

She is a general dealer who sells groceries at the Save Business Centre. The client has been in this business for seven years now. The challenge she faces in the business is transportation, when carrying products to the shop. However, she has a vision of buying a business stand to build her own shop in the next five years. With the profits from the business, she will be able to buy food and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy mazoe, rice, sugar, and biscuits

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Delilah has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Delilah has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Delilah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and curd.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Sarah has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a 28-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 8 years old. She describes herself to be self-disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells stones. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more stones. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more stones for selling.

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years. 

Akeer is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Meet an amazing, honest and charming woman by the name of Everlyne. She is a small-holder farmer based in Wiyeta village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Everlyne has been practicing livestock farming for seven years. She has raised two cows on the farm. 

Everlyne is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred while gaining a profit. Everlyne is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard working and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards. Everlyne just needs a little help that she can get from you; a loan that may change her life.
Be inspired during this festive seasons and make a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es el único miembro de su familia que está estudiando una carrera universitaria, es por ello que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo. Estudia la licenciatura en deportes, y comenta que su meta es poder trabajar en su profesión y enseñar en las escuelas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus útiles de universidad, para poder seguir con sus estudios.

loans.use: Pagar gastos de útiles de universidad

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is 32 years old, is married and has 3 children and they all live in Monclova, Coahuila. Her husband is employed and earns the minimum wage. The necessities of their children grow as they continue to grow with the increasing costs of education and clothing. Given this situation Erika since about a year ago, was worried and started to look for a business that would generate an extra income to help her husband. And she identified the possibility of selling jewellery. To date she still maintains her project that she started with the unconditional support of her family.

The situation has improved, although it has not been easy, but with patience, together they have been able to make little by little. Erika now requires a loan of $250 to be able to purchase merchandise to offer her clients and therefore increase her earnings. You can contribute to the well being of this family. You only need to help them, as they need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika tiene 32 años, casada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en Monclova, Coahuila. Su esposo es empleado y gana el salario mínimo, las necesidades de sus hijos crecen conforme ellos van creciendo, pues lo gastos en educación y vestido se incrementan. Por esta situación, Erika hace ya casi un año que, preocupada, buscó una actividad que le pudiera generar ingresos extras para ayudar a su esposo y vio la posibilidad en la venta de joyería. Hasta el momento ella ha seguido con el proyecto que hace tiempo inició con el apoyo incondicional de su familia.

La situación ha mejorado, aunque fácil no ha sido, con paciencia juntos han podido salir adelante poco a poco. Erika ahora requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar mercancía, ofrecerla a sus clientes, e incrementar sus ingresos. Tú puedes contribuir al bienestar de ella y su familia, solo tienes que ayudarlos, ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with two children. He owns a retail shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items, especially food items, rice in particular.

Omari thanks all lenders for his first loan with Kiva. With the loan he was able to increase the stock of rice and other food items.

Omari is now requesting a second loan with Kiva. With this loan he is planning to open another shop in the next street. From his own savings he managed to pay rental fees for the shop premises. What he needs now is a working capital to fill the shelves of a new shop. He is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Mangwi Dora

texts.en:
Dora was born in 1956; she is the only wife of Mr. Asa Awa Joseph and has four children. What makes her so discouraged in life is the fact that she is not able to take care of her family’s financial needs, especially the education of her children. Her husband, too, is not financially viable.

The most painful incident in Dora's life is the fact that she lost her mother and her brother in the same year. This affected her very strongly, especially her finances since she had to take care of them when they were sick.

Dora thinks her video cassette business is a good thing because she is able to rent or sell cassettes to her neighbors and even outside her neighborhood. These cassettes provide relaxation in the evening after a hard day’s work and hence a source of pleasure to the community. GHAPE also gives out loans at very low interest which is extremely uncommon here.

Dora is making a good profit. The expansion of this business will help her take care of her family. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Renting and selling of video cassettes

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar is 29 years old and has 2 children. He and his wife sell personal care products. These include shampoo, tooth paste, hair coloring, products to take care of the body and many other things. Demand for these types of products is high and brings steady profits. In addition to selling his products at the markets, Zafar sells his products from home where he has a small store. Recently his business had a hard period, when the tax authorities demanded that he get a special license to sell self-care products. The costs of such a license are too high and would not have allowed Zafar to earn a profit. This type of license is used for wholesale dealers. Today, the issue has been resolved and the special license is not necessary.

A year ago Zafar received a loan from MicroInvest and included more expensive shampoos and soaps in his inventory. This attracted many customers and increased profits. He purchases his products by traveling to wholesale markets and also receives deliveries from wholesale dealers. Business is going very well and Zafar would like to take out a new loan to purchase additional products.

Zafar’s wife is pictured in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зафарчон и его жена продают парфюмерную продукцию. Она включает в себя шампуни, зубные пасты, краску для волос, средства ухода за телом и многое другое. Спрос на такую продукцию высокий и приносит стабильную прибыль. Кроме базаров Зафарчон продает свои товары и из дому, где у него оборудован маленький магазинчик. Недавно для его бизнеса настал тяжелый момент, когда со стороны налоговых органов потребовали получения специального разрешения на продажу парфюмерной продукции. Стоимость такого разрешения слишком высокая и не позволила бы получать прибыль. Такое разрешение применяется для оптовых продавцов. Сейчас проблема решена и специального разрешения не требуется. Год назад Зафарчон получил займ в Микроинвест и включил в ассортимент более дорогие шампуни и мыло. Это привлекло много клиентов и повысило прибыльность его бизнеса. За товаром он ездит на оптовые рынки и еще ему привозят товары поставщики различных оптовых продавцов. Сейчас очень хорошая торговля и Зафарчон планирует получить новый займ. На фотографии жена Зафарчона. P.S. Зафарчону 29 лет и у него 2 детей.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is 44 years old and married. Her husband is José Escobar, who is 50 years old, employed in a pipe factory in the city of Paraguarí, and contributes to the household income. They have one son, who is 23 years old, who is studying in his third year to become a teacher, thanks to the efforts of his parents. During his free time, he also helps his mother sell milk.

Feliciana is a very sacrificing woman who wakes up every day very early to milk their cows. She deals with a lot of clients due to the high quality of her product. She needs the loan to buy a milk cow to increase her production, since she has such a high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Feliciana tiene 44 años es casada, su marido es José Escobar quien tiene 50 años es empleado en una fábrica de tubos que es de la Gobernación de ciudad de Paraguarí y aporta con los ingresos de la casa. Tienen un hijo, de 23 años, quien está cursando el tercer año de formación docente, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres, que también en sus tiempos libres le ayuda a su mamá en la venta de leche. Feliciana es una persona muy sacrificada se levanta todos los días muy temprano para ordeñar su vacas, cuenta con mucha clientela por la buena calidad de su producto. Necesita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su producción ya que cuenta con alta demanda.

loans.use: Buy a milk cow

loans.name: Claudina Celeste Mas

texts.pt:
Claudina Celeste Massunga P. is a 41-year-old single mother of three and lives in the Hulene neighborhood of Maputo. She runs a stand at the Mavalane market, where she sells a variety of beverages such as soft drinks, juices, fresh milk, etc. She is new to the program and is taking on an initial loan of 6,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months. She will invest the funds in the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudina Celeste Massunga P. é mãe solteira de três filhos, tem 41 anos de idade e vive no bairro de Hulene em Maputo. Tem uma barraca no mercado de Mavalane onde vende bebidas diversas, refrigerantes, sumos, leite fresco, etc. É nova no programa e vai tomar um empréstimo de 6.000MT para pagar em 5 meses, o qual pretende aplicar no negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.es:
Agustina, Catalina and Eleuteria, 38, 60 and 42 years old respectively, are members of the “Dos Mil” (Two Thousand) Communal Bank. Catalina has been a Bank’s founding member for seven years.

Catalina is a peddler and sells several products, such as produce, hardware items, bread and meat. She also brings tara (a plant-derived powder used in the tanning process of leather), animals’ leather and fruits such as lucuma from local markets.

Eleuteria is also a peddler, who sells food on the street across from the police station. On Sundays, she sells clothes at the market “Feria D. las Americas”.

Agustina sells huatia, a typical regional dessert, prepared from different fruits and tubercles, such as apples, camote, oca and mashua, which are macerated in the oven. Depending on season and demand, she also sells medicinal herbs, salchipollo (a typical Peruvian dish based on roasted chicken), prickly pear and emoliente (a typical drink maD. of herbs and fruits).

In the future, they would like to have a permanent kiosk to sell their products, instead of working as peddlers. Agustina, Catalina and Eleuteria say that, at the Communal Bank, they learned to be punctual and orderly and to save in order to increase their capital and have their own permanent store. Their loans amount to 600, 1000 and 400 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of produce (oca, mashua, apples, camote and cane), bread, chicken, jackets, trousers and shirts. They dream of having their own capital and their own permanent space, either rented or owned, as well as buying a mototaxi for a son to work with it.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Agustina tiene 38 años, Catalina tiene 60 años y Eleuteria tiene 42 años. Ellas son socias del Banco Comunal Dos Mil. Catalina es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal hace 7 años.

Catalina es feriante y venD. diferentes productos como verduras, artículos D. ferretería, pan, carne, entre otros productos y D. las ferias trae tara, cuero D. animales, lúcuma.

Eleuteria venD. comida ambulantemente al frente D. la comisaría y además los domingos venD. ropa en la feria D. las Américas.

Agustina venD. “huatia”, un postre típico D. la zona que es preparado a base D. diferentes frutas y tubérculos como manzana, camote, oca, mashua, los cuales son sancochados en el horno. Además ella venD. hierbas medicinales, salchipollo, tuna, emoliente, dependiendo D. la época y la demanda.

En el futuro ellas quisieran tener un puesto fijo donD. puedan vender sus productos, porque actualmente son ambulantes. Agustina, Catalina y Eleuteria dicen que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, ordenadas y a ahorrar para tener más capital y tener un puesto fijo. Sus préstamos son D. 600 soles, 1000 soles y 400 soles que serán invertidos en la compra D. oca, mashua, manzana, camote, candados, caña, pan, verduras, pollo, casacas, pantalones y camisas. Ellas sueñan con tener capital propio, tener un puesto fijo alquilado o propio y comprar un mototaxi para que trabaje su hijo.

loans.use: Their loans amount to 600, 1000 and 400 soles respectively, to be invested in the purchase of produce (oca, mashua, apples, camote and cane), bread, chicken, jackets, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. Pilar del Rocio is 38 years old and has two children, who have become the main meaning in her life and in her progress. She and her husband have proposed working themselves to their utmost so that their little children can achieve the goals that they have outlined. For some time, she has dedicated herself to selling groceries and other necessities, and this business has become the main source of economic support for their home. Her goal is to expand her sales space, buy a larger quantity of foods, and above all, improve the structure of their home. To do this, she needs to request a sum of money so that she can get started with these proposals. Thanks to your help, Mrs. Pilar del Rocio will achieve her goals in very little time.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Pilar del Rocio de 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos quienes se han convertido en el principal significado de su vida y progreso. Ella y su esposo se han propuesto esforzarse al máximo para que sus pequeños hijos puedan cumplir las metas que se han trazado.Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace mucho tiempo, y precisamente este negocio se ha convertido en el principal sustento económico de su hogar. Ella tiene el propósito de ampliar su espacio de ventas, comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente solicita una cantidad de dinero a fin de poner en marcha sus propósitos.Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Pilar del Rocio logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Improvement of her small sales space.

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Krouch L., 40, works as a farmer, generally making about 3 dollars a day. Her husband Mr. Sok Houy, 29, is a wedding chef making on average in profit US$ 5.00 a day. This couple has two daughters and both of them are students.

To produce more profit they are now requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and resell when they are grown up for profit.

loans.use: purchase pigs to breed and resell for profit

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Señora Consuelo belongs to the communal bank called 'Women Leaders' located in the district of Calleria in the city of Ucayali. She's 24 years old and a mother of 2 children. Her husband is a salesman.

She currently has a locale at the local supermarket where she sells home cooked meals. Her day begans very early in the morning so that she can prepare the meals she will sell during the daytime. In the evenings, she buys all the ingredients she will need to prepare her dishes.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic ingredients such as rice, sugar, flour, eggs, cooking oil, chicken, fish, etc.

Consuelo is a hard-working woman, and she's very happy to belong to a communal bank because she likes all the women who are members.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Consuelo pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Lideres, ubicado en el Mercado Nº 3, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto en el mercado Nº 3 de venta de comida, se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus comidas, y en las tardes sale a comprar sus víveres que necesitara para la preparación de sus comidas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara víveres como: arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos, aceite, pollo, pescado, etc. Consuelo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esta contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal por que tiene buenas compañeras y se siente muy feliz.

loans.use: To puchase basic food ingredients

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John Y. deals in electrical items. He is married and has 2 children. He is working very hard to improve the lives of his family. He wishes to increase his income by increasing sales. His problem is adequate funds to purchase more goods to meet the demand of his customers.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and she has four children. All her children are currently in school. She travels to the northern regions of Ghana to buy her products and retails them in her village. Her village is one of the main market centers in the region and therefore trading in foodstuffs attracts a large market. Ama wants to use her loan to buy more tubs of fresh yams, sacks of onions and gallons of palm oil, to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Francis. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubs of fresh yams, onions and gallons of palm oil
